story:
¿Qué?

Púrpura es una novela épica que te trasladará al Antiguo Egipto o al Cádiz de los fenicios: Gadir.

Tras haber pasado su infancia en Egipto y volver de la guerra contra Nabucodonosor, Naveed abandona la ciudad de Tiro. Una tormenta le aleja de su destino yendo a parar a las costas de Gadir donde se asienta y forma una familia. Las aventuras y desventuras que vive en esa ciudad lo hacen partir hacia la ciudad de Ispal, en el territorio de Tartessos. Allí prosperará, pero la sombra de una venganza surca sobre su cabeza.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Juan Carlos García Reyes.

Nací en Sevilla una calurosa tarde de verano de 1967. Con estudios de Magisterio en la especialidad de Educación Física, he desarrollado casi toda mi vida laboral (veintiocho años) en el Instituto Municipal de Deportes del Ayuntamiento de Sevilla, en diversos puestos de mando intermedio.

Estoy casado desde hace veinticuatro años, soy padre de dos hijos y compagino mi rutina diaria con los estudios de Grado en Historia por la UNED, a la vez que realizo cursos sobre Historia Antigua y me sigo formando como escritor con talleres de Creación Literaria.

Mi afición por la historia se ve reflejada en mis novelas que, aun siendo thrillers de intrigas, contienen un fuerte componente histórico. Género por el que siento predilección a la hora de encauzar mis pasos. He impartido algunas charlas a alumnos de educación secundaria de centros educativos de Sevilla, sobre mi experiencia como escritor y los motivos que me impulsaron a adentrarme en este fascinante mundo.

He publicado dos novelas con la editorial sevillana Jirones de Azul: Cartas Inconfesas, que vio la luz en diciembre de 2001; y Salto al vacío, que llegó a las librerías en diciembre de 2014.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Al mediodía, cuando el tiempo se había calmado un poco, otro marinero se acercó con cautela al joven. Este le miró con extrañeza.
     ―Sé que no eres quien dices… pero no es asunto mío, así que no diré nada.
     ―¿Qué no debes decir? ―preguntó receloso.
     ―Que no te llamas Pa-he-ran, el asiático, como dices llamarte. Tu verdadero nombre es Naveed y eres el hijo de Shedam, un comerciante de Tiro. Y esos eran tus antiguos esclavos —y lo miró fijamente a los ojos.
     ―¿Cómo te atreves a decir eso? ―se incorporó recriminándole.
     ―Porque te conocí cuando te alistaste en el ejército. Mi nombre es Farrag y luché contigo… y nunca creí que fueras un cobarde desertor. Ese cerdo delator de Medomah jamás me pareció un hombre honrado.
     ―Te agradezco tu silencio —convino—. ¿Qué puedo hacer por ti?
     ―Nada. Solo quería que lo supieras ―respondió de manera enigmática.
     Se quedó mirando como el marinero volvía a su trabajo junto a sus cuatro compañeros como si nada hubiese pasado. ¿Por qué le había dicho aquello si no buscaba algún beneficio? Debería estar atento. Pero la piel se le había erizado ante el solo hecho de oír nombrar aquella época de sufrimiento en la guerra. También se entristeció al recordar a su padre. Sus pensamientos se desvanecieron al ver como Elahed miraba por la borda añorando el lugar que dejaban detrás»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 960€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Púrpura que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Juan Carlos García Reyes vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Short Summary

 Drafts: An Imperfect Collection of Writing. It includes essays and poems as well as original artwork created by Miranda Shannon. The book spans 15 years of my life. This is my story:

  • My name is Mark Travis Rivera and I am a 26-year-old activist, choreographer, speaker, and writer. 
  • This campaign is important to me because it's a dream realized for me to write my first book. This collection is personal, honest, and a look into my world as a Latino who is disabled, gay, and gender non-conforming.
  • With your help, I will be able to self-publish Drafts: An Imperfect Collection of Writing through Amazon's Create Space and make my biggest dream come true.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • I will need to raise $2,000 in order to cover the cost of creating this book. My editor fees equals $400; my graphic designer/illustrator fees equals $500; my layout designer fee is $250. The remaining of the funds will go to order print copies of the book, shipping costs, a book launch event, and hopefully contribute to a regional book tour. 
  • Supporters who donate will receive a thank you on social media ($24 or less); Supporters who donate ($25-$50) will receive a written thank you note and a signed copy of "Drafts"; Supporters who donate ($100 or more) will receive a thank you note, a signed copy of "Drafts" and will have their name written in the acknowledgements of the book.   
  • All funds raised will go to producing this book. 

The Impact

This is a dream realized for me, a dream I've dreamt for years. With your help:

  • A first generation college graduate who is Latino, gay, disabled and gender non-conforming will be able to call himself an author
  • These stories are deeply personal and it is my hope that these stories will help other people who may be able to relate 
  • It's a collection of coming to understand one's self and embracing every imperfection

Risks & Challenges

It's always hard to garner support for the arts but I truly believe in the power of community and I am determined to make this book a reality. 

  • Being born at 5 1/2 months made me resilient in the face of obstacles and I am determined to make this book happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone can afford to contribute so spreading the word and sharing the link with your community is also helpful. 

  • Spread the word out and make some noise about my campaign through social media, use the Hashtag #DraftsImperfectCollection.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story: .

Story of My Book

Crippled Trust is the sequel to Demon Hunter and picks up with Kate Ryder at summer’s end. Being a Slayer, partnering with Jared Ford, and fighting monsters is just as much an adventure as she’d thought it would be. But now a new enemy is on the scene and looking to tear the world—and her—apart.

My name is A.K. Walker and I am the author of Crippled Trust. I wrote this book because Kate and Jared’s story is far from over and this is the next part of their ongoing adventures and battles.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how Kate’s journey has progressed as she embraces the Network life and becoming a Slayer, and how complicated what seemed like a straightforward job can become. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to escape from our reality into one filled with monsters and magic that lurks just beneath the surface, and engage with Kate and Jared as they continue to navigate the twists and turns thrown their way together.

--------------------------------------------------------

Summer is coming to an end, and life couldn’t be better for Kate Ryder. Traveling across the country, fighting the supernatural, living through adventures that she only could have dreamed of a year earlier? She’s found her calling, and since defeating Rosh, it’s been a straightforward, uncomplicated, extraordinary rush. Sure, there’s the small issue of being able to read dead languages and seeing the future—but her partner, Jared Ford, has been handling it like a pro. With a friend like him, facing ghosts, ghouls, and anything else that goes bump in the night is more exciting than terrifying. Together, the two of them can face just about any threat that comes their way.

But if there’s anything the Network has taught Kate, it’s that nothing stays simple for long. While Jared’s been keeping them away from all things Hell-related, demons have been regrouping to carry out a plan that’s been in the works for years. Now, new threats and enemies are popping up far closer to home than she’d like, and the people that she’d thought she could trust most might not be who she thought they were. In fact, Kate might not be who she thought she was. Life’s twists and turns are becoming far harder to anticipate, secrets are coming to light, and she’s beginning to think she may not be as in control of her fate as she’d thought. All Kate can hope for now is to face it all with her dagger in hand and Jared at her side. She can always count on him... Right?

--------------------------------------------------------

You will love this book if you enjoyed Demon Hunter, have a good sense of humor, and enjoy reading about extraordinary, supernatural adventures in an ordinary world.

Crippled Trust speaks to young adults and teenagers alike who grapple with balancing everyday life and new, seemingly-impossible challenges, all while seeing the world around them in an entirely new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Crippled Trust inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Who’s worse—enemies who know a secret truth, or the friends who kept it from you?
  • What happens when someone realizes their partner trusts them even less than they trust themselves?
  • How has Kate Ryder partnered with Jared Ford for months and not lost her mind yet?

 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.

When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

 

And much more!

 

About the Author

A.K. Walker is a mechanical engineering student at the University of Michigan. She’s mostly self-taught, and has been writing since high school, using most of her free-time to create short stories and develop the Slayers’ adventures. 

Fairy tales and urban legends have been a part of her life since the beginning, and she wanted to create her own to brighten the world around her and make the mundane a little more exciting. A.K. wrote this book to share with others a world she’s been building since high school, in the hope that it could inspire others to explore their imagination and reality in a new light.

A.K.‘s writing has been supported by two loving parents and a younger brother, all of whom had to put up with far too many late hours of loud, slow typing coupled with frustrated mumbles about said-typing. Her sense of humor – while endearing – is often sarcastic and cheesy, and her ability to balance being an athlete and an absolute clutz is unparalleled.

For more information, you can connect with A.K. at a.k.walker.slayers@gmail.com and on Instagram @a.k_walker

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network.
  • Please use #RyderIsBack2021 and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

 

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
A.K. Walker

story:
Aloha!

It’s Heather, your Disco Loving Wine Ninja, Award Winning Author and lovable Saint Gregarious Dionysus with The Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence.

(Me being Sainted by Sister Jezabelle)

My current book is done; edited, professionally laid out, ready for print & champagne has been drunk.

I am running this campaign for the purpose of printing a small number of pre-release hardback editions of My Headdress Is On Fire...stories from a White Girl growing up on & off Indian land.

It is a series of deliciously skewed essays that travel the world from Indian Land to the Australian Outback; single parenting to the Empty Nest. I unearth stories about an Indian Chief, Bozo the Clown, Kupa Piti, David the Camel and more.  PLUS: It's a perfect size for the plane or train.

 

There will be exactly 100 hardback copies printed—making them truly limited. They will be numbered 1-100, measure 6” x 9”, printed with a laminate case cover and be signed by me.

Both versions of the book, (hardback and paperback--along with all bonus materials), will be printed and delivered March 15, 2018--BEFORE the official release date of April 28th.

AND: If you are in San Francisco, join us for an intimate press reception, Charity-Book Launch with Absinthe, Appetizers and Punks on Friday, March 16th. Space is limited. You must pre-register.

Registration Information is here: https://myheaddressisonfire.eventbrite.com

Join me on April 28 & 29, 2018 at The Bay Area Book Festival, where I will be officially releasing my book and showcasing my current work.

10% of all book proceeds, including this campaign, are donated to Punks With Lunch, a not-for-profit harm reduction group providing food and other necessities to people experiencing homelessness.

I know some of you can't contribute and that’s OK. I would love your help in spreading the word on social media, sharing this video and page with your friends, or passing along my book info to anyone you know who might be interested! Or, if you wan to host a book party/reading/event---let me know and we can create something unique and fun.

Thank you so much for your continued love and support.

Here are some cool things people are saying about the book:

"To read Heather’s stories is to know her. My Headdress is on Fire is like a long-overdue catch up with a dear friend. From the beginning I was enraptured; at times in stitches, occasionally in tears, but always contentedly floating in her candid nostalgia. A delightful peek into the unique American life and clever head-space of a fiery girl turned gloriously uninhibited woman!"    Laura Goldfarb, Founder of Red Boot PR & Radio Host on BTRtoday

"HEATHER JACKS IS A THIEF! She stole my heart from Flannery O’ Connor quicker than Mr. Priest’s waxed hair flew across the room! Lessons learned from MY HEADDRESS IS ON FIRE: ​That having “not one drop of (whatever) blood...” doesn’t mean shit to a tree.             

Men have real utility in spite of themselves.                                                                                                  The best things in life are not only free but unexpectedly beautiful.                                                        It’s OK, even desirable to be 'dramatically different'.                                                                                    The stories will put a smile on your lips, a tear in your eye and a resolve to read it over and over."​Sister Freida Peoples, Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence

​"In the end, shouldn't we celebrate everything (life) is—not everything it isn't?" sums up the humorous and reflective memories of Heather Jacks in 'My Headdress is on Fire.' Jacks labels each chapter as a life lesson from a person, place, or experience of her past, sharing memories ranging from time spent growing up on Indian Land to touring with Monsters of Rock and Twisted Death. Who knew that you could learn important life lessons from Axl Rose, Roller Skating in the Outback, Malibu Barbie, a Brazilian Wax or a House of Punk Rockers? Jacks’ has embraced each moment of her life and shares it vividly in her unique personal journey."      Christi Lyle-Rasheed, San Francisco Book Review

"Humor with heart...an honest, rock-your-mind snapshot of life." Yogi Dre, Oregon

“This is phenomenal; you are as funny with the written word as I am sure you are in person.”Randy, Arkansas

“Your innocence is real; both heartwarming and heartbreaking. I love how you add in US history, including the incredibly important info on how our government treated Indians. Those stories do not get told often enough. Your method is educational without detracting from the rich personal stories. Love it!”  Laura, San Francisco

story:
ABOUT THE BOOK

My name is Candace Jane Opper, and I’m a writer, a mother, and a visual artist.

In 2018, my first book, Certain and Impossible Events, was selected by Cheryl Strayed (!) as the winner of the Kore Press Memoir Award. Certain and Impossible Events combines personal narrative and cultural history to illuminate the ways we collectively make meaning out of suicide. Though I’ve been researching and writing the book for about a decade, my relationship to the topic began in 1994, when a middle school classmate killed himself a week after Kurt Cobain’s suicide. I have since been tethered—sometimes unexplainably—to the task of chronicling that event and its ramifications. This book is the result of that pursuit.

Watch the video for the full story!

ABOUT THE FUND

This campaign is less about making the book happen than it is about spreading the word and kicking a few bucks back to the organizations that helped me along the way. 

How the fund will work:

For every book preordered through this campaign, Kore Press will receive the retail cost of the book + a $5 donation. Kore is an independent intersectional-feminist press that has been publishing women and transgender voices since the early 1990s. Like many, they are struggling to stay afloat due to the financial ramifications of the COVID-19 pandemic. These funds will help them cover costs related to the book's production.

10% of total campaign funds will go to Live Through This, an organization dedicated to elevating and amplifying the voices and stories of suicide attempt survivors. 

5 - 7% of total campaign funds will cover the administrative costs of producing and disseminating perks.

These are difficult times for everyone, so contribute what you can—whether that’s buying a book (or two), sharing this campaign with a friend, spreading the word, or starting a conversation about suicide, even if it makes you feel uncomfortable and weird, because we all know that’s how the best conversations unfold.

#suicideactually

If you are struggling with thoughts of self-harm or suicide, there are people you can reach out to around the clock. Call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255) or text the Crisis Text Line at 741-741.

PERKS

Every book preordered through this campaign comes signed along with a letterpress bookmark printed locally in Pittsburgh at Meshwork Press (stay tuned for a sneak peek of the design...).

If you opt for the “90’s Special,” you’ll also get early access to the themed Spotify playlist and a copy of DITTO Zine (a new archival project), featuring archives discussed in the book. 

Book Club purchases will come with a set of discussion questions (that can be customized by age group/focus) and the option to have me Zoom in for a discussion (for an additional fee). 

LINKS

Read more about me/my work here.

Kore Press

Live Through This 

CREDITS

Music by the talented Josh Bleeks

Book Cover Art by Lauren Carrera

Painting of hometown supplied by the lovely Rita Cecarelli

Sinister Wisdom Annual Campaign 2016

Sinister Wisdom, a multicultural lesbian literary & art journal, celebrates 40 years of continuous publishing in 2016. Founded in 1976 in Charlotte, NC, Sinister Wisdom publishes four issues a year, including one Sapphic Classic. Each issue of Sinister Wisdom features lesbian-feminist essays, poetry, fiction, and non-fiction. Sinister Wisdom needs to raise $4,500 to support our publishing for 2016. This year we also have two stretch goals to help us expand our work and celebrate our 40th anniversary.

In 2016, Sinister Wisdom has exciting publishing plans. Sinister Wisdom will publish four issues. In January 2016, Sinister Wisdom 99 will be on the theme of pleasure; on July 4, 2016, Sinister Wisdom 101 will be the 40th anniversary issue on the theme, Anniversary; October 2016, Sinister Wisdom 102 will be an issue celebrating the legacy of the Michigan Womyn's Music Festival. In addition to these three issues, Sinister Wisdom will publish the fourth Sapphic Classic: The Complete Work of Pat Parker. Sapphic Classic  are reprints of iconic lesbian-feminist poetry books. Sinister Wisdom returns these books to print as a way to nurture and stimulate dialogue within the lesbian community.

The first Sapphic Classic was Minnie Bruce Pratt's Crime Against Nature, published in April 2013; our second was Cheryl Clarke's Living as a Lesbian, published in January 2014. In April 2015, Sinister Wisdom published Elana Dykewomon's What Can I Ask: New and Selected Poems 1975-2014. In April 2016, the fourth Sapphic Classic will be the Complete Work of Pat Parker.

To do this work, Sinister Wisdom needs your help. Become a subscriber to Sinister Wisdom today. Make a gift to support Sinister Wisdom. 

Over the past 39 years, Sinister Wisdom has published 98 issues. Sinister Wisdom is a vital space for dialogue and creativity. Sinister Wisdom nurtures and supports a vibrant lesbian community. Become a part of Sinister Wisdom by making a gift today.

Ways to Support Sinister Wisdom

During this fall fundraising campaign, Sinister Wisdom needs to raise $4,500. Sinister Wisdom has an ambitious publishing agenda for 2016--we can only fulfill our plans with your support. Your gift of $5 or $10 will earn you YOUR name in the journal--and enable Sinister Wisdom to send one free issue to a woman who is incarcerated or institutionalized. Your gift of $18 or $20 or $25 entitles you to a free back issue of the journal. If you give $30 or $50, you will receive a year-long subscription to Sinister Wisdom. 

For people who want to help with the daily operations of the journal, consider giving $76--a dollar to celebrate the year of the founding of Sinister Wisdom. Give $250 and pay the designer fee for one issue of the journal. A gift of $500 pays for table registration for Sinister Wisdom  to attend a conference and promote the journal to writers, editors, publishers, and lesbians.

Feeling generous? A gift of $500 or $1,000 goes a long way to ensuring the continued health and well-being of Sinister Wisdom - and our work to share and celebrate lesbian-feminist culture.

Stretch Goals

This year, Sinister Wisdom has two stretch goals. If we can secure the $4,500 needed for our operations in 2016, our first stretch goal is for an additional $1,500 to launch our new project LATCH ON! LATCH ON! Lesbian Art, Theory, Culture, and Herstory will be a weekly email documenting and celebrating the history of lesbian art, theory, culture, and herstory. Already a fabulous group of women have signed on to write these weekly email missives including Victoria Brownworth, Tara Shea Burke, and Bonnie Morris. We will curate a weekly email free to subscribers for the LATCH ON project as a way to further nurture and develop lesbian herstory, art, and culture. The additional $1,500 will cover the technology necessary for this project and offer a modest stipend to writers for their time in developing the project.

If we raise a total of $6,000 ($4,500 for our basic operations and $1,500 for LATCH ON), our next stretch goal is for an additional $1,500 to do two anniversary celebrations of Sinister Wisdom - one in New York and one in San Francisco. We are open to doing other celebrations, too, where people can help us organize to celebrate the 40th anniversary of Sinister Wisdom.

Sinister Wisdom Matters! Lesbians Matter!

After 40 years, Sinister Wisdom has a long tradition of publishing in the lesbian-feminist community. Through each issue of the journal, Sinister Wisdom affirms that lesbians matter--lesbian ideas, lesbian words, lesbian creativity. Your support of Sinister Wisdom today means that you care about lesbians, too. Your support means that you appreciate the intricate and on-going efforts of Sinister Wisdom to excavate, preserve, and disseminate lesbian-feminist culture.

Other Ways You Can Help

What we need from you most of all today is financial support. Become a supporter through this campaign. Become a subscriber to Sinister Wisdom. Share this page with your friends and family and ask them to support Sinister Wisdom.

Thank you for helping me realize my dream!

story:
Most of this project is finished. The interviews are in the can, much of the travel is now complete. Yet, there is a final chapter begging to be written...

What would you do if you knew you would have just enough money to make sure you and your family would be okay for the next few years. I’m not talking buckets of cash, just enough to allow you to think about what really matters; not so much that you get distracted and take your eye off the ball.No excuses, nothing standing in your way but your own insecurities — what would you do? 

I’m Kendall Hunter, an author of two published books and I asked this question almost two years ago when I began a journey that is now unfolding as a memoir entitled “What It Meant To Me.” I’ve since travelled to several places (self-funded) to interview female photojournalists about women in the world. I’m now raising funds to bring this journey to its conclusion — one that takes place in Johannesburg, South Africa. 

When I left the country in 1994, a friend and I had helped supply cameras to a photographer who teaches his craft to children in Soweto. Since this time, Victor Matom has managed to continue to help youth in the township, often being both their creative director and protector. Upon my return to Johannesburg, I’ll reconnect with Victor and his school, introduce my daughters to both the children benefitting from the program and the country that once meant so much to me. 

This particular stage of the story requires fundraising to cover expenses for the final chapter — one that takes me full circle to the place my career and passions were ignited some 20 years ago. Excess funds raised will go to buying supplies for Victor’s school -Sifikile. If the fundraising goal is not met, I’ll still independently raise funds to buy equipment and supplies for the school.

This is the final stage of my memoir. It takes the story beyond the conversation and enables me to actively pick up where I left off so long ago before having children, before my marriage and the divorce that initiated this journey. Having worked as a photojournalist in South Africa in 1993-94, during such a monumental time in the country’s history (the demise of apartheid) I came to understand the importance of the image but felt compelled to apply my experience in other ways that could help at a community and global level. It may be twenty years down the road but with even more life experience, passion and daughters at my side I understand that it’s never too late to make a difference or show my daughter’s a mother being true to herself. 

Recently, a photojournalism instructor whom I met in Chiang Mai, Thailand posted this comment about his take on what I'm doing: 

"From slightly afar (I taught a course, photographed and blogged the Foundry workshop in 2012 in Chiang Mai), I saw this story developing. At first I didn't understand what was happening, but then I realized that it was a truly tender story evolving, and mostly because of a smart and perceptive mother taking some risks, but betting on the payoff. As her story shows, it did pay off, proving the wisdom of Kendall's intuition." 

So this is me, still trusting the process but with clear intention. 

Motivations to write this book: 

•To have a discussion about women in the world with female photojournalists now working at the top of their game.

•To highlight the importance of connection and shine a spotlight on the dignity of women in the world despite their circumstances. 

•To show the importance of the work and dedication of the artists behind the photographs. 

•To reclaim my own life post-divorce and to be, to the best of my ability, a role model for my teenage daughters. 

•To show my daughters the world beyond their own doorstep and to teach them we are all citizens of this planet, capable of creating positive change. 

Photographers whom I've met for interviews: 

Nadia Todres, Paula Allen, Kate Brooks, Andrea Bruce, Andrea Diefenbach, Donna Ferrato, Agnes Dherbeys, Elizabeth Hermann, Krisanne Johnson, Diana Markosian, Holly Pickett, Maggie Steber, Newsha Tavakolian, Adriana Zhebrauskas

If you can help bring this journey to it’s best possible conclusion by making a contribution, I’d be most appreciative. If you’re unable to assist with a donation, it would be wonderful if you could help with awareness and share this campaign. Thank-you!

Upon my return to Johannesburg, I’ll reconnect with Victor and his school, introduce my daughters to both the children benefitting from the program and the country that once meant so much to me. 
This particular stage of the story requires fundraising to cover expenses for the final chapter — one that takes me full circle to the place my career and passions were ignited some 20 years ago. Excess funds raised will go to buying supplies for Victor’s school -Sifikile. If the fundraising goal is not met, I’ll still independently raise funds to buy equipment and supplies for the school.
This is the final stage of my memoir. It takes the story beyond the conversation and enables me to actively pick up where I left off so long ago before having children, before my marriage and the divorce that initiated this journey. Having worked as a photojournalist in South Africa in 1993-94, during such a monumental time in the country’s history (the demise of apartheid) I came to understand the importance of the image but felt compelled to apply my experience in other ways that could help at a community and global level. It may be twenty years down the road but with even more life experience, passion and daughters at my side I understand that it’s never too late to make a difference or show my daughter’s a mother being true to herself. 
Recently, a photojournalism instructor whom I met in Chiang Mai, Thailand posted this comment about his take on what I'm doing: 
"From slightly afar (I taught a course, photographed and blogged the Foundry workshop in 2012 in Chiang Mai), I saw this story developing. At first I didn't understand what was happening, but then I realized that it was a truly tender story evolving, and mostly because of a smart and perceptive mother taking some risks, but betting on the payoff. As her story shows, it did pay off, proving the wisdom of Kendall's intuition." 
So this is me, still trusting the process but with clear intention. 
Motivations to write this book: 
•To have a discussion about women in the world with female photojournalists now working at the top of their game.
•To highlight the importance of connection and shine a spotlight on the dignity of women in the world despite their circumstances. 
•To show the importance of the work and dedication of the artists behind the photographs. 
•To reclaim my own life post-divorce and to be, to the best of my ability, a role model for my teenage daughters. 
•To show my daughters the world beyond their own doorstep and to teach them we are all citizens of this planet, capable of creating positive change. 
Photographers whom I've met for interviews: 
Nadia Todres, Paula Allen, Kate Brooks, Andrea Bruce, Andrea Diefenbach, Donna Ferrato, Agnes Dherbeys, Elizabeth Hermann, Krisanne Johnson, Diana Markosian, Holly Pickett, Maggie Steber, Newsha Tavakolian, Adriana Zhebrauskas
If you can help bring this journey to it’s best possible conclusion by making a contribution, I’d be most appreciative. If you’re unable to assist with a donation, it would be wonderful if you could help with awareness and share this campaign. Thank-you!

story: ...

Who We Are

When The Curator launched on August 29, 2008 as a web publication of International Arts Movement (IAM), it sought to announce signs of a “world that ought to be” as found in our midst—to be a thoughtful, hopeful journal that would inspire its readers to explore culture that enriches life and broadens experience. 

Five years and two editors-in-chief later, The Curator still holds to that philosophy, celebrating the best of new art, music, film and books, as well as taking time to observe daily beauty through poetry and creative nonfiction. We've now published over 800 original essays, more than a thousand blog posts, the work of 230 writers, and averaged 600 readers per day (20,000/month). The site's busiest day saw approximately 5,100 page views.

The Curator's reach is global and diverse. Our writers come from every region of the United States, and some live overseas. They are teachers, poets, doctors, parents, plumbers, designers, students, baristas, store clerks, bouncers, pastors, farmers and philosophers.

Our subject matter might be even more diverse than our writers. In the last two months alone, we’ve covered topics ranging from Picasso, neuroscience, Anna Karenina and Koosh™ balls to Charles Bukowski, baseball, gun violence in contemporary film, Willie Nelson and urban planning.

What We Need & What You Get

After operating on a lean budget for years, we've determined that in order to make the magazine sustainable and "generative," new financial resources are needed. Our plan is to rework our publication calendar, recruit more writers, refresh our content, and establish a budget that will make us solvent for the 2013-2014 year, and beyond. 

Our current target is $28,000 per annum. This campaign aims to cover 50% of that, roughly $14,000 + $1,000 in processing fees. The rest of the fundraising effort will be conducted privately through individual charitable donors. 

Below you’ll find a simple list outlining an allocation of funds:

Editors - $16,000/year

  - Editor-in-Chief $6,000

  - Poetry Editor $2,000

  - Managing Editor - $2,000

  - Assistant Editors (4) - $6,000

Writers - $6,000/year

  - $40/piece (staff writers)

  - $20 one-off submissions

Additional Projects - $6,000/year

  - The Curator Celebrates - $2,000

  - The Makers Series - $1,500

  - Site Maintenance - $500

  - Collateral Materials - $1000

  - Contest Facilitation - $500

  - Partner development - $500

Total = $28,000

This campaign = $15,000

story:
Stethoscope Press is a student-run writing and publishing group at Wesleyan University.

Each year, we select several writers who work one-on-one with an editor to produce a book of original work. This year, we're printing five books: a novella, a collection of poems, two collections of short stories, and a book of essays. 

Throughout the academic year, our writers and editors work together closely, exhanging drafts and meeting often. Starting about now, our writers sit down with our small design team to transform their texts into beautiful bound books. These will arrive on campus in early May, where they will be available free of charge.

By now, our writers and editors have just about finished the writing and editing process, so the books themselves are written. Unfortunately, our budget is significantly less than we need to print our full run of books, so we are asking for your help to finish the job!

Last year, we printed 420 copies each of four books, and these all vanished in days. This year, however, we currently don't have enough money to print even 200 copies of each. We are working with several departments and campus organizations to obtain more funding, and we will be holding a bake sale next week, but to close our budget gap for good, we'll need significantly more money than we can obtain by any of these means.

Please consider donating to Stethoscope! Any amount, however small, means a lot. It costs $4.40 to print one copy of any one book, so by donating just $10, you'll be funding two whole books. For $22, you'll be supporting one copy each of all five books.

We are offering some great rewards for donations. Take a look! (Prizes with an asterisk by the title are only practically available to donors in or near Middletown, CT. Sorry!) We will mail copies of the books to any donors not on campus!

See below for samples from the books, and for an article about Stethoscope published in the Wesleyan Argus.

— http://wesleyanargus.com/2013/01/31/stethoscope-press-defies-genre-form-in-student-produced-books/

— An essay from Amy Zhang's collection on growing up Chinese-American

— The opening of Nate Dolton-Thornton's novella

— A topically appropriate poem from Josh Krugman's collection, Relative Strangers

— A story from Kate Weiner's collection, Home

– A story from Rachel Pincus's collection 


UPDATE: even though we are very close to reaching our goal and may reach it very soon, every donation still helps a great deal. If you've arrived at this site and we've recieved more than $1,200, please consider donating anyway! We will use the funds to print more copies of these wonderful books.

story:
I've written the cookbook. Now I want to come meet all of you who have supported me along the way! Please help get me to your cities!

I cannot express enough how thankful I am for all of the support you have shown me over the past couple of years and throughout the book writing process. I want more than anything to travel to your cities and meet all of you in person to express my gratitude, but we have virtually no budget left over after creating this book so I need your help! 

I am traveling to the cities where I have the largest concentration of fans first and then hope to do another tour in the Fall! 

The goal listed is the minimum I need ($5,500 + Indiegogo fees) to make this book tour happen. I am offsetting some of the costs by staying with friends and family when available and gathering up any and all airline miles we have, but will need help with the remaining transportation, airfare, lodging, and food budget. I am going make the tour happen somehow regardless of this gets fully funded, but really think this is doable! It's like less than 10% of my fans donating $1.50! Cheaper than a cup of coffee! 

I have already been working diligently researching bookstores and locations to host the best events for you guys. It's been a little like a jigsaw puzzle, but I was able to plan a tour where I could get to these cities all within 2 weeks and get to meet all of you but be away from Asher (my 3 year old!) as little as possible. The signing locations are almost booked, now I just need to get the rest of the details in order! 

If this campaign gets overly funded, I plan to add New York, Canada, Pennsylvania, and possibly more to the tour!

story:
What is The Celestial Teapot?

We are a new magazine publication for the atheist community. We write about American History and politics, religion, science, the environment, sex, atheism, humanism and secularism. We strongly believe in the separation of church & state, rational thought and logical reasoning, but we also enjoy the lighter topics: art, comics, memes, and photography. We are not here to bash, rant or hyperbolize, but to inform and raise awareness. 

 

 

Who are we?

Jeff Ridout is the magazine's Founder and Creative Director. Having worked in film and television production after majoring in writing and post production, Jeff wanted to create something that will educate, entertain and unite secular folks in the U.S. and around the world. He envisions a forum for people of different backgrounds to come together and question the society they live in, and to be aware of the religious influences that seep into global government policy unnoticed.

With a degree in English and a Graphic Design certificate, Irene Panchuk is TCT's senior editor and senior designer. Visually she has and will create a clean and sleek layout that makes full use of bright, bold color and original artwork. It's important to Irene that TCT has articles that are based on fact rather than opinion.

Bridget Gaudette is in charge of marketing. With a graduate degree in public and nonprofit administration and having built relationship with several secular organizations and noteworthy atheists, she'll be able to bring in famous guest authors and help TCT with some much needed strategy and support. Bridget wants a variety of subject matter from many perspectives.

TCT's regular authors include Rachel Johnson of The Pink Atheist podcast, Steven Olsen of WWJTD, Sean Fraser of Digital Journal, Eddie Mumford, Dylan LaCoursiere, Alex Blair and Donald Herrera Fairbairn.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Are you an atheist, humanist or skeptic? Are you interested in humanist and secular issues, politics, science, art, sex, fiction and comics? Do you like Stephen Hawking and Christopher Hitchens? Well, so do we! But we need your help to get our new magazine publication up and running. The Celestial Teapot is a new online magazine filled with articles on the above topics, plus cool artwork, memes, and interviews with awesome folks like Lawrence Krauss. Even Michael Shermer guest authors. Donating is super easy and your donations will also get you some cool Celestial Teapot merchandise (see the perks to the right). So you'll have the pleasure of helping our cause and getting complimentary goodies. 

Costs will go towards:

-Creating a fully functioning website

-Attracting authors

-Conducting an ad campaign to bring awareness

-Creating a high quality product

-Printing

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not have the money to contribute to the start-up of this project, but you can still help by passing on a link to this page.

story:
THE HELENS OF TROY

After helping Bernadette Mayer work on her project, THE HELENS OF TROY, NY, I decided that we needed to continue the project by visiting TROY, MO. We will interview and photograph all the Helens of Troy, Missouri I can find. Poems will be written based of these interviews and a short section of the history of the city with photographs will conclude the book. Homer would glory in telling the story of Troy, Missouri.

The Helens of Troy, NY is a book of poetry and photographs featuring women named Helen from the city of Troy, New York. Inspired by her knowledge of ancient Greek and the mythic character Helen of Troy, Mayer conducted interviews with these local women, photographed them and their surroundings and created a book of poems with a visual presentation of each Helen.

New Directions Press released the work as part of their reinstituted pamphlet series this year. More information can be found on their website:  http://ndbooks.com/book/poetry-pamphlets

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need funding to pay for transportation and lodging. We will need to pay for advertising in the local papers to help find the Helens. We will offer a small payment to each Helen we interview.
  • Contributors will receive the satisfaction of helping poets to continue their important work!
  • All funds collected will go towards helping this project.

The Impact

With a grant from Creative Capital, Bernadette Mayer was able to create and publish her HELENS OF TROY, NY. With your help, we will be able to continue the project by visiting the other cities named Troy in the U.S. We hope to succeed in this task by conquering Troy, Missouri. This will only be possible with the support from people like you.

Visit our website which is still growing: http://helensoftroyproject.com/

story:
Short Summary

My name is Emmaline Westlund (commonly known on the internet as Skrain, Elmo, Gul Dukat, etc....) and I am a writer of short stories. And I have a dream.
My dream is simple, but it will take dedication and a lot of money, but in the end of all things, it will be a REALLY cool thing.
The money raised from this campaign will be used to fund a cross country trip in which I will camp in all of the lower forty eight states, gathering inspiration and writing a short story (up to 10,000 words) in each state, to be published in a 48 story anthology at the end of the trip.
The trip will be a minimum of 20 weeks, maximum of 26, probably ending up at about 24, which will give me about four days in each state. I will be staying in national parks and state parks, taking lots of pictures and liveblogging the majority of the trip.

What I Need & What You Get

Basically, I need money to fund gas and food and electricity and whatnot. Also to guard against the possibility of complete car breakdown.
If you donate, and I mean this: If you donate, you will get a signed paperback copy of the book. It doesn't matter the "level" you donate at- IF YOU DONATE TO THIS CAMPAIGN YOU WILL GET A FREE, SIGNED COPY OF THE PAPERBACK VERSION OF THIS BOOK.
(That being said, if you donate more than $1,000 to this cause and you live in the lower 48 US, I will take you out to dinner when I'm in your state (or something less creepy if you're creeped by the idea of someone on the internet seeking you out and taking you for food. This is at your discretion.)

The Impact

You'll help give my writing a new, fresh perspective and bring a little more beauty from the lower 48 to the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about this campaign. Share the link on facebook, post it on Twitter, Tumblr-ize it, whatever social media you use- share this link.
Send me information about cool places in the US that you've always wanted to check out or you've always loved and I'll try to make certain that I check them out while I'm out.

story:
La Pluma Y La Tinta Needs Your Help to Grow!

As a writer, editor and lover of the written word, I started La Pluma y La Tinta's New Voices Reading Series with two other like-minded Latina writers to showcase the work of up-and-coming writers and poets. In 2014, I plan to up the ante—not only will the reading series continue to wow audiences with talented writers and poets, but new and exciting components are being added in the coming years to serve the literary community in Brooklyn and beyond.

Why You Should Help
New York City has traditionally been a mecca of sorts for writers and poets, but the opportunities for writers of color, or even writers who don't have an "in" to the publishing world, to share their work and gain new audiences are still few and far between. La Pluma y La Tinta aims to combat this challenge through a variety of projects:
  • Literary readings featuring amazing new talent
  • Thought-provoking panel discussions on literary topics
  • Writing workshops for poets, storytellers and memoirists
  • A printed anthology of great writing
  • Book clubs
  • Programs for young readers
  • A literary magazine for writers and poets
Where Your Donations Go
I helped start this venture without a budget and initially had to scrounge around for participants and an audience at our readings. Now my lists are long and empty seats are a thing of the past. People look forward to La Pluma y La Tinta events and appreciate the opportunity to be a part of this grassroots literary endeavor. I just know I need to do more for both our artists and the people who support our work!

The writing community I envision will be available to participants at little or no cost. This is where your donations help. Our goal is a conservative $4,000 for events and workshops planned in 2014, and anything you can give toward these projects would help all of the writers and poets who look to La Pluma y La Tinta to give them a platform and a mic to share their work.

The monies raised during this campaign will help:
  • Defer costs for workshop participants
  • Pay teaching artists to run three workshops (~$1800)
  • Offer honorariums to literary event participants (~$1200)
  • Production costs for anthologies and lit magazines (~$500)
  • Administrative costs for event production, marketing, web assets and legal filings expenses (~$500)

We're also open to in-kind donations for those who can't offer monetary support, or if you're a published or prominent author who'd like to donate your voice at one of our panels—any skill or resource you think would benefit La Pluma y La Tinta's community is OK, we can work something out!

I'm excited about this project and hope you all share in my vision for La Pluma y La Tinta's future!

Yours,
Raquel Penzo

About La Pluma y La Tinta
La Pluma y La Tinta began in 2009 as a writing workshop for Latinas in Brooklyn, New York, meeting in author Theresa Varela’s (Covering the Sun with My Hand) Park Slope living room. The group of three quickly grew into an entity of literary curators, hosting the first New Voices Reading Series on Sunday, January 31, 2010, at the now-shuttered Brownstone Books in Bedford-Stuyvesant. The event was the product of three Latina writers who decided to create an opportunity for up-and-coming authors to share their unique voices.

Now in its fifth year, the series can boast having graced stages in Manhattan, Brooklyn and even Washington, DC, and it’s thanks to all of you who’ve supported the arts!

Founding member Raquel Penzo (My Ego Likes the Compliments…And Other Musings on Writing) continued to host the quarterly readings after the workshop disbanded in an effort to continue growing the community of writers who depended on the series as an outlet for their work.

Additional events have taken place at Bluestockings in the lower east side of Manhattan and, in 2013 the readings had a great run at La Casa Azul Bookstore in Spanish Harlem. Under the Pluma y Tinta umbrella, panel discussions on literary topics have taken place at The New School, and Penzo even curated a special reading during Lit Crawl NYC 2013 featuring a roster of powerful Latina writers and poets, including journalist Raquel Cepeda (Bird of Paradise: How I Became Latina).

  • Karina Guardiola-Lopez
  • Daniel José Older
  • Theresa Varela

...and more!

  • Lit Crawl, NYC 2013: Radical Latinas—Words of Strength, Truth & Change
  • Panel: Finding Ourselves on the Page—Identity in the Latino Narrative, The New School 2013

Short Summary

            My name is La'Von Gittens and I have BIG dreams of becoming a New York Times Best Seller! I wrote the adult urban fantasy novel, "Divine Apocalypse: The Beginning of the End" For years, I desperately tried to get published, but simply, because of a lack of experience I was always told a flat out, "No." 

          Eventually, I was contacted by an agent. Imagine my excitement! He got my hopes up, read my novel, and told me that he liked everything, except for one factor... that I had no previous publishing experience and he was worried about taking a chance... WELL THEN.

           I decided to give myself some experience. So I created a small publishing company, NoV'al Publishing, my name backwards. It kinda sounds like "Novel" and it shows that Oprah isn't the only one who can be creative! I published the first novel to my series and I am currently a 4.5 on Amazon, Barnes and Noble, and Google Books! I created the company with the intent on finding diamonds in the ruff that could possibly be the next best seller, but have gotten lost in the politics of major publishing companies. 

New York Newbies: Poetry, will be the first book in an annual series that would showcase the talent of the undiscovered poets of New York City, ages 14+. Work that is submitted will be posted on the blog and viewers would have the option of voting on which poems should make the book. I will be obtaining works from various sources and participants can feel free to submit. 

What We Need & What You Get

What your money buys:

  • ISBN: $247.50
  • Digital File Uploads: $80.00
  • Proof Copy: $60.00
  • Cover Creation: $500.00
  • Amazon CAT FEE: $12.00
  • Inventory: $600.00 
  • Prizes/Fees: $300.00
  • Distribution and Promotion: $700.00

The Impact

As an artist, there is nothing greater than having someone enjoy your work! New York Newbies: Poetry, gives every writer the chance to be heard, without having a long track record. Many talented authors have great ideas, just don't know how to get started.  We give authors the start they need into the publishing world where the possibilities are endless. Through my personal endeavors I was able to bring my own book up to a 4 star rating on Amazon, GoodReads, and Barnes N noble. This achievement means the world to me as every review is heart wrenching! I would never trade it for the world, but, if I can I would LOVE to share it!

Other Ways You Can Help

 Poems can be submitted to newbiesnewyork@yahoo.com. Once reviewed, they will be posted on my blog, lavongittens.wordpress.com where the public can vote them into New York: Newbies: Poetry!

*****10 % off the book's proceeds will be donated to First Book, a non for profit organization which places books in the hands of children in need. http://www.firstbook.org/

story:
CAMPAIGN GOAL

Our goal is to raise $2,000 for the purpose of printing an original book, The Beauty of Change: A Father And Son's Journey To Redemption. This book was written by Anthony Boult in conjunction with United Family Ministry, a non-profit organization that assists children with incarcerated parents.

The Beauty of Change conveys a personal message of commiseration and hope that the beauty of change will be recognized within each and every human. The book will potentially change the lives of readers while providing insight into the multicultural society in which we live.

Anthony Boult has spent the previous year completing the writing and editing of The Beauty of Change. His dream and vision is to see it bound in print with 100% of the author's proceeds donated to United Family Ministry.

In Boult’s own words:

“My dream is for this book to give hope to those whom society deems incorrigible, for we as human beings posses the innate ability to change our lives.”


WE INVITE YOUR SUPPORT & DONATION

·  Donation Deadline is January 27, 2013 (12:00pm)

·  100% of proceeds raised by this campaign will go towards the manufacturing of the book in print form and publication of the electronic book.

·  Once printed, 100% of the author’s proceeds will go directly to UFM.

ABOUT UNITED FAMILY MINISTRY:

United Family Ministry was created to assist and support 2,500 children in need, ages 5-18 with incarcerated parents. The primary objective is to bridge the gap between incarcerated parents and their children by increasing the quality and amount of time they have to communicate physically with one another.

UFM provides safe and regular transportation for youth visiting incarcerated parents in the Shreveport/Bossier Louisiana region. It will also aid  with social assistance and offer mentorship centered around life skills for these youth.

Research has shown that children with an incarcerated parent are traumatized, confused by their parent’s actions, and stigmatized as well. They are also deprived of income, guidance and are vulnerable to poverty and stressful shifts in caregivers and other family disruptions. They are susceptible to imprisonment, substance abuse and behavioral disorders.

United Family Ministry seeks to confront these challenges and offer a place for healing for youth with incarcerated parents. Boult states, “There exists a culture of misunderstood and underprivileged youth who desperately need an antidote to counter act their suffering. This antidote must derive from the same culture that is responsible for their suffering."

For more about United Family Ministry: www.Unitedfamilyministry.kk5.org

HOW DOES UFM IMPACT OTHERS?

The impact UFM has on those it represents is seen on the smiling faces, extended hugs, and joy experienced between parent and child as they reunite because of our program.

ABOUT ANTHONY BOULT:

“UFM has changed the way I view my ability to help transform lives in spite of my past or my current circumstance.”—Anthony Boult

Anthony Boult is the founder of UFM and creator of, THE ANTIDOTE: URBAN CRIME AND GANG INTERVENTION INITIATIVE. As a former gang member, he is currently housed at Louisiana State Prison at Angola. He is a graduating senior at the New Orleans Baptist Theological Seminary Angola Extention Center pursuing a Bachelors Degree in Christian Ministry. He has three daughters: Azzaria 23, Loletha 23, Diamond 20.

He began to write as a means of healing, to experience inner peace, and to replace the self-torment he has experienced during his incarceration.

WHAT YOU GET FOR YOUR DONATION

*$100: Your name in “Thank You” Section of Printed Book + Everything below.

*$50: Invite to Book Release Event; Printed and Signed advanced copy of the book; E-book; Your name on UFM web site Honor Roll; Thank You note.

*$25: Printed and Signed advanced copy of the book; E-book; Your name on UFM web site Honor Roll; Thank You note.

*$15: E-book; Thank You note.

*$10: Thank You note (handwritten).

*$1: Thank you e-mail.

THE IMPORTANCE OF YOUR DONATION

Your donation helps to bring forth a profound and inspiring story of change.
Once printed, 100% of the author’s proceeds will go directly to help the youth assisted by UFM who are often blamed for circumstances beyond their control.
Support a book and support the health of Louisiana youth.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

If you cannot donate there are other ways you can help a child with an incarcerated parent.

*Donate your time to a cause associated with children of the incarcerated.
*Become a mentor to a child with an incarcerated parent.
*Speak out and bring awareness to the issue.

QUESTIONS
Email: Adrian Le at fouradrian@hotmail.com or Aimee Bobruk at aimeebobruk@aimeebobruk.com

story:
My name is Sara Maria Rivard. 

Before the sudden death of my life partner six months ago, I was a Rites of Passage guide for youth, a keeper of the Women’s Circle tradition, a teacher/facilitator of conscious creativity, an international traveler, a published writer, an art activist, a believer in magic.  Now, I am a shattered woman searching for grace and the creative fire which once fueled my life’s work. 

I am reaching out for funding to support my recovery project. This campaign will allow me to write the story of my love and loss. It is my calling to find gems among the cooling ash, to dedicate myself and this book to healing and to hope. I need your support to do this.

Please watch my video, get involved, and pass the call along to your tribe!

I need to raise at least $5,000 by November 15th, 2013, in order to fund my creative space and the publication of this piece. I have estimated that this is the minimum amount needed to make this possible, additional funding will help me to write, publish and distribute this book with ease. In exchange, I am offering copies of both this book and Caminante, Bridger of Worlds, which I published at age 23 in 2008. All contributors will also have access to a monthly update with a creative correspondence component. Your support will allow me to reflect in an authentic, engaged and inspired way, the many layers of light and shadow that I have experienced; to find medicine in this madness; and to continue to develop my skills in the art of midwifing others through their own transformational processes, as I have been doing for the past 10 years. 

A ROOM OF MY OWN

With the funding I hope to receive through this campaign, I will spend the winter at Lake Atitlan in Guatemala, a mystical, healing oasis set among three volcanos which has become one of my many homes on the planet.  This is the place where my beloved and I lived for a season while I completed Caminante, Bridger Of Worlds in 2008. The budget also includes costs for first run publication of the book at the time of its completion, which is estimated for the end of 2015. Go to the Kindling for The Fire Facebook group for excerpts from Caminante.

STONE SOUP 

Call and Response


Every full moon between November 15th and the final publication of this book, supporters can expect an update on the project, including excerpts and/or artwork. Each update will also include a skeleton poem. Skeleton poems are a tool I’ve developed to invite expression, inspiration and connection. A skeleton poem is a series of unfinished lines that each participant then fleshes out with their own unique brilliance. The bones of the poem are the same, but each person brings it to life with whatever is moving within them. Completed skeleton poems will be compiled and shared in a digital gallery and, potentially, in a paper press format. I also welcome the exchange of artwork, poetry and other forms of expression during this time. This is a way for all of us to navigate the cycles of life and death and rebirth over the coming months.

This exchange will not only allow me to share my journey and my life’s work with you but will also be kindling for the fire of my recovery as I am reminded ritually each month that I am still connected to this world. 

Go to the kindling for the fire facebook group to learn more about Kindling for the Fire, a longtime vision for creative community building and intercultural healing, and to see sample skeletons.

RECIPROCITY

* Any donation above $1.00 enrolls you in Stone Soup, a monthly mailing list tracking the progress and process of this project. It also invites you to participate in Kindling for the Fire by writing and sharing skeleton poems as a way of accompanying me in this work and of exploring your own creative reflections.Go to the kindling for the fire facebook group to read more about STONE SOUP call & response.

*$50.00 or more - Receive a signed copy of Death Wish at the time of publication.

*$100.00 or more - Receive a signed copy of Caminante as well as Death Wish.

*$500.00 enrolls you and a friend in a weekend workshop on Art As Prayer which I will be offering in both North and South America in 2016.

Please get involved.  I need help mustering the energy to do this; your words and presence may be just what I need. So please, even if you are unable to make a monetary donation, you are still encouraged to show your support. Send me an email, an ally link, an idea, some oil pastels, airline mileage…or simply pass this on to your people. 

Thank you!


Soy Sara Maria Rivard.  


Antes de que mi Querido compañero de vide se muriera repentinamente, hace seis meses, yo era guía de la juventud en Ritos de Pasaje; cuidadora de la tradición del Círculo de Mujeres; maestra de la creatividad consciente; viajera global; escritora publicada; activista del arte; creedora en la magia.  Hoy soy una mujer en astillas, en busca de la gracia y del fuego creativo que alguna vez me nutría la obra de mi vida.

Estoy en la búsqueda de fondos monetarios para mi proyecto de recuperación.  Esta campaña me permitirá escribir la historia de mi amor y de mi pérdida.  Es mi vocación encontrar piedras preciosas entre las cenizas y dedicar este libro, así como a mí misma, a la sanación y a la esperanza.  Para lograrlo, necesito tu apoyo.

Te pido que mires el video, que te unas al proyecto, y que pases la voz por tu tribu.

Necesito juntar $5000 antes del 15 de noviembre del 2013, para pagar por un espacio creativo y publicar esta obra.  Esto es lo minimo que necesito, mas donaciones me ayudara a publicar y distribuir este libro con facilidad. A cambio, estoy ofreciendo copias, tanto de este libro como también de Caminante, Bridger of Worlds (Caminante, Puente Entre Mundos), lo cuál publiqué en el 2008, a la edad de 23 años.  Todo contribuyente también tendrá acceso a noticias mensuales sobre mi progreso, con un componente de correspondencia creativa.  Tu apoyo me permitirá: trasmitir, de modo auténtico, entregado e inspirado, las multiples capas de luz y de sombra que he experimentado; descubrir la medicina escondida en esta locura; y seguir desarrollándome como esa partera cuyo arte les ayuda a los demás a navegar sus procesos trasformacionales, como lo vengo haciendo hace más de diez años. 

UN ESPACIO PROPIO

Con los fondos que espero juntar en esta campaña, pasaré el invierno a las orillas del lago Atitlán en Guatemala, un oasis místico y curativo, ubicado entre tres volcanes, que ha llegado a ser uno de mis muchos hogares en el planeta.  Fue en este lugar que mi amado y yo pasamos la temporada en que compuse Caminante, Puente Entre Mundos en el 2008.  El presupuesto incluye, además, los costos de una primera tanda de ejemplares del nuevo libro, que se espera para fines del 2015.  Para leer pasajes extractos de Caminante, Visite el grupo kindlingforthefire en facebook.

SOPA DE PIEDRA

Llamado y Respuesta

Cada luna llena entre el 15 de noviembre y la publicación del libro, los contribuyentes a este proyecto recibirán noticias sobre mi progreso, a incluir extractos y/o material gráfico, así como también un poema-esqueleto.  Este último es una herramienta mía que invita a la expresión, a la inspiración y a la conexión.  Un poema-esqueleto consiste en frases comenzadas que cada participante encarnece según su propia brillantez.  Los huesos del poema son los mismos, más cada indivíduo le da vida con lo que se mueve en su interior.  Juntaré y compartiré los poemas-esqueletos encarnecidos, ya sea en galería digital o en formato impreso.  Bienvenida, también, cualquier contribución artística, ya sea ilustraciones, poesía, o lo que sea, de modo que los próximos meses nos sirvan a todos como oportunidad de navegar los ciclos de vida, de muerte y de renacimiento.

Este intercambio no sólo me dejará compartir contigo mi odisea y el trabajo de mi vida, sino que también me servirá de leña para el fuego de mi propia sanación, al recordarme, ritual y mensualmente, que sigo conectada a este mundo.

Para aprender más sobre Leña para el Fuego, una visión de muchos años sobre la construcción creativa de comunidad y sobre la sanación intercultural, para ver ejemplos de poemas-esqueletos viste el grupo de kindling for the fire en facebook.

RECIPROCIDAD

* Cualquier donación de más de $1.00 te inscribe en Sopa de Piedra – noticias mensuales sobre el proceso y el progreso de este proyecto – y te invita a participar en Leña para el Fuego al componer y al compartir poemas-esqueletos para acompañarme en mi tarea y para explorar tus propias reflexiones creativas.

Para leer más sobre SOPA DE PIEDRA, llamado y respuesta. vaya a el grupo de facebook Kindling for the Fire.

*$50.00 o más –  Recibirás una copia firmada de Death Wish (Deseo de Muerte) al publicarse.

*$100.00 o más – Recibirás copias firmadas de Caminante  y de Death Wish.

*$500.00 les inscribe a tí y a un amigo en el taller de fin de semana El Arte Como Oración  que he de ofrecer tanto en América del Norte como en América del Sur en el 2016.

Porfavor, involucrate. Necesito ayuda para juntar las fuerzas necesarias para esto; tal vez sean justo tu presencia y tus palabras que me hagan falta.  Así que por favor aunque no puedas hacer una contribución financiera, igual se te pide mostrar tu apoyo.  Mandame un mail, un eslabón de aliado, una idea, unos pasteles al óleo, kilometraje de aerolínea…o simplemente pasá la voz entre tu gente.

¡Gracias!
story_txt:
My name is Sara Maria Rivard. 
Before the sudden death of my life partner six months ago, I was a Rites of Passage guide for youth, a keeper of the Women’s Circle tradition, a teacher/facilitator of conscious creativity, an international traveler, a published writer, an art activist, a believer in magic.  Now, I am a shattered woman searching for grace and the creative fire which once fueled my life’s work. 
I am reaching out for funding to support my recovery project. This campaign will allow me to write the story of my love and loss. It is my calling to find gems among the cooling ash, to dedicate myself and this book to healing and to hope. I need your support to do this.
Please watch my video, get involved, and pass the call along to your tribe!
I need to raise at least $5,000 by November 15th, 2013, in order to fund my creative space and the publication of this piece. I have estimated that this is the minimum amount needed to make this possible, additional funding will help me to write, publish and distribute this book with ease. In exchange, I am offering copies of both this book and Caminante, Bridger of Worlds, which I published at age 23 in 2008. All contributors will also have access to a monthly update with a creative correspondence component. Your support will allow me to reflect in an authentic, engaged and inspired way, the many layers of light and shadow that I have experienced; to find medicine in this madness; and to continue to develop my skills in the art of midwifing others through their own transformational processes, as I have been doing for the past 10 years. 
A ROOM OF MY OWN
With the funding I hope to receive through this campaign, I will spend the winter at Lake Atitlan in Guatemala, a mystical, healing oasis set among three volcanos which has become one of my many homes on the planet.  This is the place where my beloved and I lived for a season while I completed Caminante, Bridger Of Worlds in 2008. The budget also includes costs for first run publication of the book at the time of its completion, which is estimated for the end of 2015. Go to the Kindling for The Fire Facebook group for excerpts from Caminante.
STONE SOUP 
Call and Response



Every full moon between November 15th and the final publication of this book, supporters can expect an update on the project, including excerpts and/or artwork. Each update will also include a skeleton poem. Skeleton poems are a tool I’ve developed to invite expression, inspiration and connection. A skeleton poem is a series of unfinished lines that each participant then fleshes out with their own unique brilliance. The bones of the poem are the same, but each person brings it to life with whatever is moving within them. Completed skeleton poems will be compiled and shared in a digital gallery and, potentially, in a paper press format. I also welcome the exchange of artwork, poetry and other forms of expression during this time. This is a way for all of us to navigate the cycles of life and death and rebirth over the coming months.
This exchange will not only allow me to share my journey and my life’s work with you but will also be kindling for the fire of my recovery as I am reminded ritually each month that I am still connected to this world. 
Go to the kindling for the fire facebook group to learn more about Kindling for the Fire, a longtime vision for creative community building and intercultural healing, and to see sample skeletons.
RECIPROCITY
* Any donation above $1.00 enrolls you in Stone Soup, a monthly mailing list tracking the progress and process of this project. It also invites you to participate in Kindling for the Fire by writing and sharing skeleton poems as a way of accompanying me in this work and of exploring your own creative reflections.Go to the kindling for the fire facebook group to read more about STONE SOUP call & response.
*$50.00 or more - Receive a signed copy of Death Wish at the time of publication.
*$100.00 or more - Receive a signed copy of Caminante as well as Death Wish.
*$500.00 enrolls you and a friend in a weekend workshop on Art As Prayer which I will be offering in both North and South America in 2016.
Please get involved.  I need help mustering the energy to do this; your words and presence may be just what I need. So please, even if you are unable to make a monetary donation, you are still encouraged to show your support. Send me an email, an ally link, an idea, some oil pastels, airline mileage…or simply pass this on to your people. 
Thank you!

Soy Sara Maria Rivard.  
Antes de que mi Querido compañero de vide se muriera repentinamente, hace seis meses, yo era guía de la juventud en Ritos de Pasaje; cuidadora de la tradición del Círculo de Mujeres; maestra de la creatividad consciente; viajera global; escritora publicada; activista del arte; creedora en la magia.  Hoy soy una mujer en astillas, en busca de la gracia y del fuego creativo que alguna vez me nutría la obra de mi vida.
Estoy en la búsqueda de fondos monetarios para mi proyecto de recuperación.  Esta campaña me permitirá escribir la historia de mi amor y de mi pérdida.  Es mi vocación encontrar piedras preciosas entre las cenizas y dedicar este libro, así como a mí misma, a la sanación y a la esperanza.  Para lograrlo, necesito tu apoyo.
Te pido que mires el video, que te unas al proyecto, y que pases la voz por tu tribu.

Necesito juntar $5000 antes del 15 de noviembre del 2013, para pagar por un espacio creativo y publicar esta obra.  Esto es lo minimo que necesito, mas donaciones me ayudara a publicar y distribuir este libro con facilidad. A cambio, estoy ofreciendo copias, tanto de este libro como también de Caminante, Bridger of Worlds (Caminante, Puente Entre Mundos), lo cuál publiqué en el 2008, a la edad de 23 años.  Todo contribuyente también tendrá acceso a noticias mensuales sobre mi progreso, con un componente de correspondencia creativa.  Tu apoyo me permitirá: trasmitir, de modo auténtico, entregado e inspirado, las multiples capas de luz y de sombra que he experimentado; descubrir la medicina escondida en esta locura; y seguir desarrollándome como esa partera cuyo arte les ayuda a los demás a navegar sus procesos trasformacionales, como lo vengo haciendo hace más de diez años. 
UN ESPACIO PROPIO
Con los fondos que espero juntar en esta campaña, pasaré el invierno a las orillas del lago Atitlán en Guatemala, un oasis místico y curativo, ubicado entre tres volcanes, que ha llegado a ser uno de mis muchos hogares en el planeta.  Fue en este lugar que mi amado y yo pasamos la temporada en que compuse Caminante, Puente Entre Mundos en el 2008.  El presupuesto incluye, además, los costos de una primera tanda de ejemplares del nuevo libro, que se espera para fines del 2015.  Para leer pasajes extractos de Caminante, Visite el grupo kindlingforthefire en facebook.

story:
Hello Friends, Family, and Community,

Twenty-three years ago I stood in hot, humid weather on a rain-drenched street in Iquitos, Peru looking at an incredibly long line of people waiting to see the team of plastic surgeons who had come to repair the cleft lips and palates of their children. I was there to be of service and, as so many others have found out through the ages, it was the people of Iquitos, their children and families who gave me a gift I came to cherish and set me off on a path of healing and love that continues to grow and deepen each and every day.

One of those nights in Peru, I had a dream. In that dream I was standing in a beautiful clearing inside of an open structure of pillars formed in a circle with an obelisk in the center. That vision was so impactful I wrote it down.

Fast forward a year later and I am guided to join a Buddhist-based Spiritual Fellowship called Johrei, a path of service of offering divine light as a method of purifying spiritual, emotional and physical clouds. A year later that fellowship dedicated a “Sacred Grounds” near Sao Paulo, Brazil and when I saw pictures of the place I recognized the image from my dream and knew that one day I would visit that place and fulfill on the vision from my dream.

Now, these twenty-two years later I am embarking on a Pilgrimage to the Solo Sagrado de Guarapiranga, Brasil and invite you to be a part of that journey. In exchange for your support, I will take your prayers, intentions and do service in your name and the names of your loved ones who seek healing.

We are at a turning point on our planet where so many old ways of operating no longer serve us. Some members of our families are still playing out the old stories of their grandparents and parents and have become involved with drugs, violence, gangs and are in trouble with the law. The intention of this trip is to acknowledge our ancestors for having brought us to this time, thanking them for their contribution and, requesting they release us from the bondage of the Karmic clouds we carry for them, that we be free to create a new paradigm of a life of truth, goodness and beauty for our children, grandchildren and future generations.

Please join with me and I will keep you up to date on the miracles that are occurring as we travel together on this journey.

May G-d bless all of you with love, goodness and beauty!

Gratefully,

Gavriella

Other ways you can help, if you can't donate:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
