story:
Do you love animals?

Have you ever had to have the tough conversation about the Rainbow Bridge?

Introducing... Rescued By Rico 

Rescued By Rico is the true story of a 12-14 year old chocolate lab pup from Puerto Rico who affectionately became known to us as "Rico". A year or so after his family had to abandon him to escape 2017 Hurricane Maria, he was found curled up in a ball, 20 lbs. underweight, with a litany of health issues. 

Rico was something special. He was loved by everyone who had the privilege of meeting him. We're telling his story because we hope to inspire others. We want to help others understand how much a rescue animal can bring to your life. We also want to approach the hard conversation about a beloved family pet passing by painting the Rainbow Bridge so bright that it offers hope to little ones whose best fur buddy has passed on. 

About The Authors

We are Stace and Jules, the co-authors of this special book, and we also had the incredible privilege of being Rico's adoptive family for his last months on this earth. For our careers, we're founders of two companies: A Salty Rim, which is a coaching/consulting firm helping small business create a strategic plan for growth; and OME Gear, which is an outdoor gear product company changing the way people "do it in nature". We are also co-hosts of two podcasts: GSD Entrepreneur and Do It In Nature. 

 

 

A Sneak Peak Inside...

We feel very fortunate to have had Rescued By Rico illustrated by the incredibly talented Tami Boyce. Upon completion of the book, here's what Tami had to say...

"I'm a little sad that it's over, but also proud to see the completion of this book! Thanks again for letting me be a part of getting this book into the world! I am truly so proud to have been a part of it."

 

 

 

 

How You Can Help

We need your help in bringing the message of Rico to the world. Here's what you'll get if you decide to join this journey with us!!

Reward #1 - a paperback version of Rescued By Rico

Reward #2 - a hardback version of Rescued By Rico

Reward #3 - a hardback version of Rescued By Rico personally signed by the authors, Jules & Stace

Reward #4 - a hardback version of Rescued By Rico personally signed by the authors, Jules & Stace PLUS a super plush, cute Rico pup

Reward #5 - 5 paperback versions of Rescued By Rico PLUS 5 super plush, cute Rico pups

Reward #6 - 5 hardback versions of Rescued By Rico personally signed by the authors, Jules & Stace PLUS 5 super plush, cute Rico pups

 

The Impact

We wrote this book to make a difference in Rico's honor. There are so many animals who are abandoned, abused, and living on the streets. Just a little love can offer these fur babies a completely different life.  

We will be giving a portion of all proceeds to animal rescue organizations in the United States who are doing impactful work. 

Source: https://petpedia.co/animal-shelter-statistics/

 

"Until one has loved an animal, a part of one's soul remains unawakened."

-Anatole France

 

Risks & Challenges

Risks for this project are low. We've surrounded ourselves with people who've had years of experience getting children's book published and we've followed their advice all along the way!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're not interested in backing this project and getting a book, we'd greatly appreciate it if you'd be willing to share with your friends and family! 

Many thanks!!

Stace + Jules

story:
Story of My Book

Displaced Generation: Stories of the Nation's Young, Homeless, and their Paths to Housing is a collection of innovative solutions to the present day problem of youth and young adult homelessness as well as the narratives of young individuals experiencing this problem personally.

My name is Jennifer Pitsch and I am the author of Displaced Generation. I wrote this book because I wanted to bring more awareness and advocacy around a problem that has been growing detrimentally in this nation, but even more importantly give people the tools and knowledge on what can be done to fix it.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover more about what lies behind the American crisis of the young and homeless as well as what steps are being taken by those passionate to make a difference and solve it. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the young homeless in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you become an advocate in making your community a better place regarding this issue.


In this book, you'll learn about:

  • Why homeless youth are afraid of homeless shelters, and what alternatives are out there
  • Community challengers such as the Rapid Results Institute who work to eradicate youth homelessness in just 100 days
  • The story of Kate, a community activist who opened her house as a safe home to over thirty boys in just under four years

 

You will love this book if you want to gain more knowledge on a sub-demographic of our nation that is being left behind, are an advocate, hoping to better your community, or researcher wanting to discover different paths that have been used to address homelessness.  Displaced Generation is a non-fiction book that speaks to the community, activists, innovators and organizations who are looking at the best approaches of housing youth and trying out a different approach for the first time.

 

The Book - Displaced Generation

The book is written in 4 Parts.

Part 1 focuses on laying out the purpose of this book as well as history of homelessness in the United States. It trails through what factors have led to the current homeless crisis as it is today.

Part 2 explains the main causes behind homelessness specifically for youth and young adults. It overlays what may push these individuals to the streets as well as what increased risks they face once they are out there.

Part 3 is all about solutions and models that have been invented to tackle youth homelessness. This problem is so wide ranging that there is no one clear cut, fix-all band-aid, but some methods are clearly more effective than others.

Part 4 addresses what YOU can do as the readers even when you feel like you can’t make an impact as one individual. It shows what others are doing through advocacy work, legislation, and reaching out to others in their community to make a difference.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Jennifer Pitsch is an Economics and Political Science undergraduate double-major at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. She wrote this book after a personal experience witnessing the degradation of a young homeless man in her community and wanted to delve into this problem on a larger scale. Throughout the course of her book, she has interviewed over 20 different social innovators, researchers, activists, and leaders in non-profits, and homeless young individuals and has spent countless hours reading books and scientific articles that discuss the different paths to solving young adult homelessness. She hopes to devote her career to raising light on social issues and making substantial change.

By day, Jennifer is a spinach and avocado dip connoisseur and a firm believer that caramel is pronounced ‘car-ml’ not ‘car-a-mel.’ By night she is an amateur cornhole player and avid Nebraska Huskers fan. She is a caffeine and adrenaline addict (not a good combo) and can be found backpacking and traveling in her free time.

For more information, you can connect with Jennifer at jdpitsch@gmail.com or at her Twitter and her Instagram: jennifer_pitsch.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #DisplacedGeneration and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jennifer Pitsch

story:
“I remember waking up one day on a solo motorcycle adventure. My first conscious sensation of the day was the cool air on my face, and the sound of a bird singing joyfully, just outside my tent. The warm light of the sun had already begun to fill my tent as it mixed with the cool, crisp morning air.” – Tim Collins

Motorcycles and camping go hand in hand. This comprehensive, practical guide—perfect for novice and pro motorcycle campers alike—outlines all you need to know to prepare for, survive, and enjoy the great outdoors on your motorcycle. The Fundamentals of Motorcycle Camping covers how to make wise riding and camping gear choices to meticulously assemble your perfect motorcycle camping setup, avoid common pitfalls while planning your trip, master all the logistics, and implement wilderness survival tactics to deal with potential hazards in the wild.

Tim Collins is an experienced motorcycle camper with a passion for venturing off on his motorcycle towards the horizon to sleep out under the stars. His desire to share the many benefits of this immersive, budget-friendly, adventurous and rewarding hobby has motivated him to assist others to find their bliss on the road.

 

CURRENT STAGE OF THIS PROJECT:

This self published book is currently written and edited, and is in the hands of a formatter who is putting it all together. I am also waiting on the cover designer to finalize the outside of the book, which will be posted here as soon as I have it. There are a few more small steps to take before I can order a sample of the book to make sure everything looks good and at that point I can send it to the printer. 

If everything goes well the book should be done in the next few weeks, but if I need to order a second proof that could push the release date back to September which is the current release date for the presale copies of the book. It could be earlier, but September is most realistic. 

I have poured all my resources into this project, and countless hours of research, writing, coordinating processes with editors, illustrators, designers and more. The end result is just around the corner and I am so excited to get this out to everyone!!

story:
Story of My Book

Shelves of Art and the People Between is a voyage into all of the hidden people and stories behind the creation of books along with the process of producing them.

My name is Devina Bhalla and I am the author of Shelves of Art and the People Between. I wrote this book because I wanted to find and share the stories that are behind and within the texts themselves.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how the material book is art, art that is indispensable to our culture and how it will continue to be a dominant medium. In this book, I hope to instil the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for books in you.

And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you look past the surface of books to see the teams of people and the extended impact they have.

In this book, you'll learn about the process behind the creation of books and the impact they have after being created:

  • Behind the creation and publishing of a single book lies hundreds of influential people shaping every aspect allowing the book to live.
  • The traditional publishing industry definitely needs to adapt to modern times by making continued efforts to promote systematically marginalized voices and to streamline the process in a way that more of the millions of voices can be heard. It might be broken currently, but it is not beyond repair.
  • The attachment that individuals have to hold a beautifully bond book is unparalleled. Not only does the material item foster a stronger connection than an e-book, but the passion behind the written word is immense and impossible to end.

You will love this book if you are a lover of words and the stories behind written word; spend time in bookstores and libraries, or simply around books; curious about the publishing process and industry; and if perhaps you want to write your own book someday.

Shelves of Art and the People Between is a non-fiction book that speaks to bibliophiles and doubters who are looking at the publishing industry and the passion books create for the first time.

 

The Book - Shelves of Art and the People Between

The book is written in 3 Parts...

  • Part 1 contains the introduction + five additional chapters. It looks into the people behind books themselves in the publishing industry or in bookstores across the country. Whether it be in larger spaces like Powell’s City of Books or in smaller independent bookstores around my corner of the world, like Dogtown Book Shop, every space where books are held has its own set of people behind it. They are businesses that run on the passion books are created from and continue to create after they are born.

 

  • Part 2 contains Chapters 6-10. This more technical part dives into the processes behind books, from different ways to publish and aspects of the publishing industry to how people interact with books and the ways you can capitalize and market through them.

 

  • Part 3 contains Chapters 12-15. The final part of the book centers on the deep passion books hold and create in every mind they touch. With advice and interviews from authors like Emma Straub, Suzanne Berne, and Robert Pinsky, it attempts to capture each part of the excitement and importance of a single book.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats).
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

 


 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Devina Bhalla is a student at Tufts University double majoring in English and Sociology. She loves more than just words and is devoted to her family and friends. Devina loves to swim, travel, and spend time with any dog that wants to say hello.

Devina wrote this book because she had something important to say about the necessity of the written word. Books have been so important in her life and in so many of the lives around her. She believes nothing is more powerful than perfectly placed words.

Outside of this book, Devina is simply a nerd with a love of stories. She attempts to find the gems behind books but knows that every other published book is the reason she has this to write. Perhaps it might shed light on all of the work others have so beautifully created.

For more information, you can connect with Devina at devina.bhalla@tufts.edu and @d_bhalla on Instagram and Devina Bhalla on Facebook and LinkedIn.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ShelvesOfArt and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Devina Bhalla

story:
The OUTWORLD Library Project

To commerate the two-year anniversary OUTWORLD by N. Harold Donley we are launching "The OUTWORLD Library Project" campaign. 

Its incredibly simple, for each $20 donated to this campaign Lughnasa Press will send a copy of OUTWORLD to participating libraries in Oklahoma.  

Here's the Deal: 

 "Anyone who has read OUTWORLD knows the surprising and pivotal role a library plays in the unfolding of the story." N. Harold Donley.

There are 230 public libraries in the state, some participating library systems have already acquired 10 copies of OUTWORLD for their patrons, leaving 220 libraries. At $20 a book / library it will take $4400 to reach the campaign goal.

If the campaign is fully funded, N. Harold Donley will conduct a tour to personally deliver book copies to participating library systems as well as mail copies to independent libraries. If we raise less than the campaign goal, we will purchase copies proportionate to the funds raised ($20 each) and distribute those copies to library systems and independent libraries throughtout Oklahoma.

In the event we should raise more than our goal...well, there are even more libraries in surrounding states. 

The distribution will take place in the Autumn of 2013.

What's the $20 cover?

Each copy of OUTWORLD retails for $14, this pays for the actual printing of the book and the royalty to the author.  The remaining $6 covers shipping, handling, taxes and the fee to Indiegogo.com for the campaign.

(If you check our website, Outworldthebook.com, you'll see $20 is comparable to our normal purchase/shipping price. In fact, if you just want to purchase a copy, please use our website to do so.)

Perks

Those who have read OUTWORLD will quickly recognized the Perks are named after different positions within the Gnomon community, "One Among Equals","One Born to the Land", "People of the Sky", "Guardian", "First Among Equals".  

All who give to this project will be recognized on our website, Outworldthebook.com, and some will even receive their own autographed copy of OUTWORLD in recognition of their generosity.

The Impact of Your Gift:

To be perfectly candid, we want anyone and everyone who wishes to read OUTWORLD to be able to do so.

Your gift to this campaign will literally make OUTWORLD available to people in communities throughout Oklahoma.

Your contribution will provide financial support to the author and book, save libraries the cost of  purchasing, shipping and receiving the book (and perhaps even prod the author toward that sequel so many have requested).

Spread the Word.

Share, share, share!

In addition to contributing, we really need you to share the word about this campaign with everybody you know.  

Facebook, Twitter, e-mail, e-newsletters, you name it...please help us get the word out.

Thanks to all for your support.

story:
NEW PERK ADDED! $5 = $25 OF IN-GAME CASH!


Donate $5, and you'll receive $25 of in-game cash when WeWrite hits Facebook.  WeWrite Cash can be used to purchase tons of stuff, like photos, illustrations, sound effects, advanced publishing options and more.

You'll also have access to other cool features like "More Chapters" and "Story Extenders," which give you extra space to work with when you've got something brilliant to write!

 

OUTSTANDING SUCCESS! BUT WE'RE NOT YET FINISHED!

THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU to everyone who's helped us get this far! We've met our $5,000 goal, and ahead of schedule! Now we're excited about how great the WeWrite Facebook app might be. Our "stretch goal" is $7,500. If we can get there, this game is going to be stellar!

 

What Could WeWrite! Do for the World?

WeWrite! can become the largest writing network ever created!  We've set a goal to have a MILLION STORIES written by the end of 2014. It can happen with your help!

 

What Could You Do for WeWrite?

We need your help to MAKE THIS AN AMAZING GAME!.  We've already met out goal, but the more funders we get, the more features we can add. Donate $5 and get $25 of in-game cash!

 

What Is "WeWrite!"?

WeWrite! is a collaborative storytelling game that lets you write with your friends, one or two lines at a time. You can write with people you already know, or make new friends through the WeWrite network. It's not just a writing game. It's a completely new way to connect with people!

We've already built a beta version for the iPhone that's being played in over 20 COUNTRIES AROUND THE WORLD! (Click THIS LINK to see it. Or check out the screenshots below.)

 

You'll Become a Co-Creator of the Game!

By submitting a "Story Starter" at the $10 level or above, you'll be providing inspiration for dozens, if not HUNDREDS, of new short stories (written by authors from around the world).   

If you haven't played the game yet, "Story Starters" are the titles and first lines that the game provides to help spark some creativity. The "Story Starter" is the starting point for a story that will end up taking countless twists and turns before it's completed.

The WeWrite! campaign is unique because (in addition to being listed as a "Co-Creator" in the credits) you have the opportunity to literally be a co-creator of the game! Just contribute $10 or more, and email us your "Story Starter."

Don't worry, "Story Starters" are actually really easy to come up with, and it's fun too! (It was our favorite part of developing the original prototype!) Here are two examples:

TITLE: "Stepdrag"

FIRST LINE: They knew it was him in the hallway. They could hear him getting closer. "I'm scared," Matty said as he...

 

TITLE: "Three Guys, One Gun, No Lights"

FIRST LINE: Barry's eyes suddenly lit up. "How drunk are you guys, because I think I have an idea." 

 

SUBMIT YOUR "STORY STARTER" TITLES AND/OR FIRST LINES TO WEWRITEGAME@GMAIL.COM (ALONG WITH YOUR NAME, SO WE CAN VERIFY YOU'RE AN ACTUAL "CO-CREATOR.")

 

The Game Design

We've put together some artwork to show you what we have envisioned for the Facebook version of WeWrite. New features include things like the ability to add photos, illustrations, and sound effects!

 

Here's the beginning of an interactive story. We've come up with a title, invited some co-authors, and added a picture to give it some life.

 

Here's the first page, with a few lines to kick it off.  Notice the "Inspiration Button" in the top right corner. You'll be able to access it at any time to add photos, illustrations, or break your writer's block.

 

Now a second writer has added to the story. Sombrero Man has a sidekick!

 

The Prototype

The beta version includes some great features, like a personal "Library" and the ability to earn "Fame Points." Here are some screengrabs from to give you a rough idea of what we're talking about.

The "Story Starter" buttton (top right corner) helps spark a little creativity. You can click it over and over again to get pre-loaded titles and first lines.

          

 

You can connect and play with Facebook friends. (But you can't play directly on Facebook... yet!)

 

The "Genre Wheel" helps you decide what type of story to write.

 

You can also save stories to your personal library.

 

Who Are We? 

We're five guys who grew up together in (and around) Bedford, Pennsylvania.  Now we're spread out all over the world! Three of us in SoCal, one in Pittsburgh, and one in Scotland.

 

LARS - Lead Programmer / Evil Genius - His last job was with Neversoft, specifically working on the "Guitar Hero" franchise. (We're not sure what he's scheming in this photo, but we're as frightened as you are.)

 

JAMI - Lead Designer / Billy Bob Thornton Impersonator - Corporate designer looking to escape his cubical. Also enjoys running extreme distances while eating extreme ethnic food.

 

NICK - Project Manager / Witch Doctor - His career history includes time as an "inventor." Seriously, that was his job title!

 

JAMES - Creative Director / Eye Model - Between eye modeling gigs, he's worked for "Rolling Stone," "Esquire," and "Men's Journal," and currently writes/produces for radio shows around the U.S.

 

ZACH - Marketing Guru / Fashionista - Inspiring innovation with corporate teams in Europe, and also growing a beard (not pictured).

 

What We Need & What You Get

To get WeWrite! on Facebook with the features we think are essential, we needed $5,000 to cover programming and design costs.

Everything beyond $5,000 will go toward adding in other stuff that's on our list, like more social networking features, group writing contests, and publishing options (to name a few).

So what will you get out of it? Well, in addition to supporting the craft of writing and generally making the world a better place, we've put together some great perks, starting at the $5 level. For $5, you get $25 of in-game cash!

 

The Perks

NOTE: 

SUBMIT YOUR "STORY STARTER" TITLES AND/OR FIRST LINES TO WEWRITEGAME@GMAIL.COM (ALONG WITH YOUR NAME, SO WE CAN VERIFY YOU'RE AN ACTUAL "CO-CREATOR.")

 With any donation of $10 or more, you become a CO-CREATOR of the game. That's not just talk. You'll actually be able to submit story titles and first lines to be used as pre-loaded "Story Starters" in the game.

At the $25 level, you can submit two "Story Starters" and also get THE WEWRITE! WRISTBAND:

 

At the $50 level, you get to choose from our collection of WEWRITE! T-SHIRTS.  (When the campaign ends, we'll email you for the color, phrase, and size.)

 

 

Also at the $50 level, you can get a handmade IPAD OR SMARTPHONE TOTE FROM ROSY TOES DESIGNS. These are really cool! They're eco-friendly and made of repurposed felted wool. The artist is LUCY CHAPMAN, sister of WeWrite team members Nick and Zach Sorrells. Check out the pics below and some of her other products at RosyToesDesigns.com.

(Note: Each tote is unique, so you might not get exactly what's in the photos. Dimensions won't change, but colors and fabrics will vary slightly.)

 

http://www.rosytoesdesigns.com/

 

For $30, you get THE 2014 WEWRITE! WALL CALENDAR, featuring ridiculous and embarrasing photos of the WeWrite crew. (Attention FRIENDS AND FAMILY!!) Each page will feature one of TWELVE ORIGINAL STORIES, inspired by the photo(s) and written by us. (Note: This is just a quick mock-up one page. The actual finished product will be quite the event...)

 

 

And if you can find it in your heart (and wallet) to give $3,500 or more, you get a CUSTOM MADE WRITING DESK from JIM MCCARTHY of AARON-JAMES FURNITURE MAKERS in Ojai, California.

They're TWO OF A KIND and DESIGNED SPECIFICIALLY FOR THIS CAMPAIGN. They're as much art as they are funiture. Check out the sketch below, which shows a front and side view. (Dimensions are 39" x 40" x 21", but can change by a few inches, per your request.)

Also, follow the links below to see some of his previous work. Jim is the doting father of WeWrite team members James and Lars Kendall.

Larger photo: http://s8.postimage.org/gzjuk16s5/we_Write_Writ...

Aaron-James Furniture Example #1: http://s12.postimage.org/hx9r0uvfx/Mc_Carthy_Example_1.jpg

Aaron-James Furniture Example #2: http://s12.postimage.org/w4zfpi84t/Mc_Carthy_Example_2.jpg

Aaron-James Furniture Example #3: http://s12.postimage.org/e3garpe3x/Mc_Carthy_Example_3.jpg

If you have any questions, you'll find Jim's contact info here.

 

How Else Can You Help?

Get the word out, share our Facebook and Twitter posts, and let us know about any other ideas you have. You can contact us by visiting WeWriteGame.com or by emailing us at wewritegame@gmail.com.

WeWrite! can become the largest writing network ever created!  We've set a goal to have a MILLION STORIES written by the end of 2014. It can happen with your help!
 
What Could You Do for WeWrite?
We need your help to MAKE THIS AN AMAZING GAME!.  We've already met out goal, but the more funders we get, the more features we can add. Donate $5 and get $25 of in-game cash!
 
What Is "WeWrite!"?
WeWrite! is a collaborative storytelling game that lets you write with your friends, one or two lines at a time. You can write with people you already know, or make new friends through the WeWrite network. It's not just a writing game. It's a completely new way to connect with people!
We've already built a beta version for the iPhone that's being played in over 20 COUNTRIES AROUND THE WORLD! (Click THIS LINK to see it. Or check out the screenshots below.)
 
You'll Become a Co-Creator of the Game!
By submitting a "Story Starter" at the $10 level or above, you'll be providing inspiration for dozens, if not HUNDREDS, of new short stories (written by authors from around the world).   
If you haven't played the game yet, "Story Starters" are the titles and first lines that the game provides to help spark some creativity. The "Story Starter" is the starting point for a story that will end up taking countless twists and turns before it's completed.
The WeWrite! campaign is unique because (in addition to being listed as a "Co-Creator" in the credits) you have the opportunity to literally be a co-creator of the game! Just contribute $10 or more, and email us your "Story Starter."
Don't worry, "Story Starters" are actually really easy to come up with, and it's fun too! (It was our favorite part of developing the original prototype!) Here are two examples:
TITLE: "Stepdrag"
FIRST LINE: They knew it was him in the hallway. They could hear him getting closer. "I'm scared," Matty said as he...
 
TITLE: "Three Guys, One Gun, No Lights"
FIRST LINE: Barry's eyes suddenly lit up. "How drunk are you guys, because I think I have an idea." 
 
SUBMIT YOUR "STORY STARTER" TITLES AND/OR FIRST LINES TO WEWRITEGAME@GMAIL.COM (ALONG WITH YOUR NAME, SO WE CAN VERIFY YOU'RE AN ACTUAL "CO-CREATOR.")
 
The Game Design
We've put together some artwork to show you what we have envisioned for the Facebook version of WeWrite. New features include things like the ability to add photos, illustrations, and sound effects!
 
Here's the beginning of an interactive story. We've come up with a title, invited some co-authors, and added a picture to give it some life.

 
Here's the first page, with a few lines to kick it off.  Notice the "Inspiration Button" in the top right corner. You'll be able to access it at any time to add photos, illustrations, or break your writer's block.

 
Now a second writer has added to the story. Sombrero Man has a sidekick!

 
The Prototype
The beta version includes some great features, like a personal "Library" and the ability to earn "Fame Points." Here are some screengrabs from to give you a rough idea of what we're talking about.
The "Story Starter" buttton (top right corner) helps spark a little creativity. You can click it over and over again to get pre-loaded titles and first lines.
          
 
You can connect and play with Facebook friends. (But you can't play directly on Facebook... yet!)

 
The "Genre Wheel" helps you decide what type of story to write.

 
You can also save stories to your personal library.

 
Who Are We? 

We're five guys who grew up together in (and around) Bedford, Pennsylvania.  Now we're spread out all over the world! Three of us in SoCal, one in Pittsburgh, and one in Scotland.
 

LARS - Lead Programmer / Evil Genius - His last job was with Neversoft, specifically working on the "Guitar Hero" franchise. (We're not sure what he's scheming in this photo, but we're as frightened as you are.)
 

JAMI - Lead Designer / Billy Bob Thornton Impersonator - Corporate designer looking to escape his cubical. Also enjoys running extreme distances while eating extreme ethnic food.
 

NICK - Project Manager / Witch Doctor - His career history includes time as an "inventor." Seriously, that was his job title!
 

JAMES - Creative Director / Eye Model - Between eye modeling gigs, he's worked for "Rolling Stone," "Esquire," and "Men's Journal," and currently writes/produces for radio shows around the U.S.
 

ZACH - Marketing Guru / Fashionista - Inspiring innovation with corporate teams in Europe, and also growing a beard (not pictured).
 


What We Need & What You Get
To get WeWrite! on Facebook with the features we think are essential, we needed $5,000 to cover programming and design costs.
Everything beyond $5,000 will go toward adding in other stuff that's on our list, like more social networking features, group writing contests, and publishing options (to name a few).
So what will you get out of it? Well, in addition to supporting the craft of writing and generally making the world a better place, we've put together some great perks, starting at the $5 level. For $5, you get $25 of in-game cash!
 
The Perks
NOTE: 
SUBMIT YOUR "STORY STARTER" TITLES AND/OR FIRST LINES TO WEWRITEGAME@GMAIL.COM (ALONG WITH YOUR NAME, SO WE CAN VERIFY YOU'RE AN ACTUAL "CO-CREATOR.")
 With any donation of $10 or more, you become a CO-CREATOR of the game. That's not just talk. You'll actually be able to submit story titles and first lines to be used as pre-loaded "Story Starters" in the game.
At the $25 level, you can submit two "Story Starters" and also get THE WEWRITE! WRISTBAND:

 
At the $50 level, you get to choose from our collection of WEWRITE! T-SHIRTS.  (When the campaign ends, we'll email you for the color, phrase, and size.)

 
 
Also at the $50 level, you can get a handmade IPAD OR SMARTPHONE TOTE FROM ROSY TOES DESIGNS. These are really cool! They're eco-friendly and made of repurposed felted wool. The artist is LUCY CHAPMAN, sister of WeWrite team members Nick and Zach Sorrells. Check out the pics below and some of her other products at RosyToesDesigns.com.
(Note: Each tote is unique, so you might not get exactly what's in the photos. Dimensions won't change, but colors and fabrics will vary slightly.)


 




http://www.rosytoesdesigns.com/
 
For $30, you get THE 2014 WEWRITE! WALL CALENDAR, featuring ridiculous and embarrasing photos of the WeWrite crew. (Attention FRIENDS AND FAMILY!!) Each page will feature one of TWELVE ORIGINAL STORIES, inspired by the photo(s) and written by us. (Note: This is just a quick mock-up one page. The actual finished product will be quite the event...)

 
 
And if you can find it in your heart (and wallet) to give $3,500 or more, you get a CUSTOM MADE WRITING DESK from JIM MCCARTHY of AARON-JAMES FURNITURE MAKERS in Ojai, California.
They're TWO OF A KIND and DESIGNED SPECIFICIALLY FOR THIS CAMPAIGN. They're as much art as they are funiture. Check out the sketch below, which shows a front and side view. (Dimensions are 39" x 40" x 21", but can change by a few inches, per your request.)
Also, follow the links below to see some of his previous work. Jim is the doting father of WeWrite team members James and Lars Kendall.


Larger photo: http://s8.postimage.org/gzjuk16s5/we_Write_Writ...
Aaron-James Furniture Example #1: http://s12.postimage.org/hx9r0uvfx/Mc_Carthy_Example_1.jpg
Aaron-James Furniture Example #2: http://s12.postimage.org/w4zfpi84t/Mc_Carthy_Example_2.jpg
Aaron-James Furniture Example #3: http://s12.postimage.org/e3garpe3x/Mc_Carthy_Example_3.jpg
If you have any questions, you'll find Jim's contact info here.
 


How Else Can You Help?
Get the word out, share our Facebook and Twitter posts, and let us know about any other ideas you have. You can contact us by visiting WeWriteGame.com or by emailing us at wewritegame@gmail.com.

story:
My Story

Hello! My name is John Hammer. Thank you so much for checking out my Indiegogo Site for this fundraising effort of my new book. 

I am husband to the amazing Grace and Dad to 4 amazing children, Hailey, Emma, Justus and Addison. I reside in Everett, WA and am blessed to be a pastor at Sonrise Christian Center (http://isonrise.org). I work with a passionate group of young adults and am the director or our school of ministry (http://sgssm.com). I also really enjoy creativity expressed through poetry, spoken word and writing. I have a blog at http://thefreedomletters.com.

I grew up in an awesome family but around middle school I was exposed to pornography. I ended up in a downward spiral of sexual addiction that controlled my life until I was 20. Right before I turned 21, Jesus Christ's power became very real to me and my entire life was changed by the grace of God. The sin of pornography lost it's place in my life. I then started a journey of replacing old habits, developing a renewed mind and finding out about who I was in Christ. 

For over 12 years I have been sharing my story and helping people that are bound in pornography. This is an epidemic! This is affecting children, youth, men, women, families, marriages, churches, pastors and schools. Pornography is a sexual experiment that started bad and has left millions damaged in it's wake of destruction. I am convinced by the Scriptures that Jesus offers hope and healing to those that are bound. In this process of telling my story and preaching messages of freedom, many have come asking for help and advice. I often wished I had more time to tell people what I had learned through experience and mostly through the truth of Jesus as revealed in the Bible so that they could walk in freedom. This turned into a desire to write a book that would tell my story, share Scripture truth on sexuality and freedom, and ultimately bring people into freedom in Christ.

I have finished the first draft of my manuscript  and have a contract that I am waiting to sign with a great publisher. If you help me fund this project I would be so grateful. I cannot do this without you. I feel such an urgency to finish this project and release my book that those who have been bound and damaged by pornography can experience hope and freedom.


What I Need & What You Get

I need to raise $8,000 to pay for the first printing of my book. This will include professional editing, cover design, pagination and lay out, as well as 1,000 copies of my book. Plus my book will be formatted for many different E-Book distribution channels.

All of the money that I raise will go to what I have stated above as well as helping pay for this fundraiser project and the completion of my perks. Should I raise the full amount of my goal, I am planning to sign the contract I have received from the great team at eGenCo publishing http://egen.co/. 

If I raise more than my goal, I will be able to purchase more copies of my book and/or pay for marketing my book and getting the word out to more people. 

I have several perks here to thank you for your generous support that go anywhere from copies of my e-book, print book or do some creative writing in spoken word for you. Check out the perks!! You also have the option of donating and passing on the perks if you would like.

If I was to not reach my goal, the partial funds will still be used to get my book printed. I have had other offers and routes to go as well and would attempt work with my intended publisher should this situation arise. Anyway it goes, I will get this book published and fulfill my perks that I have promised (perks will be fulfilled after the money is raised, the contract is sign and the book is published). 

The Impact

I am believing that this book will impact young people, secret sinners, parents, educators, pastors and families. I believe people that never had hope before will have hope. I want to shout from the rooftops what is possible through the hope and freedom that we have in Jesus Christ! This book is full of what God has promised and because it is His Word in theprinciples that I set forth, I believe this can change the destiny of families. This book contains the Gospel and I believe that people will be introduced to a relationship with Jesus as they read it. If you help me fund this, you will help people be restored as they learn about the sex industry, God's plan for sex, the Gospel, forgiveness, healing of their hearts, freedom from dark powers, and how to be full of the Holy Spirit. 

Ways You Can Help

1. Pray for me that I reach my goal and that this book gets before the people that need to hear the message of this book and experience the freedom that's in Jesus Christ. 

2. Share! Share! Share! Please share this page via e-mail, Facebook, Twitter and more. You can use the social media links from here. If you are a blogger or vlogger, I would love to have you write a story about this or please feel free to contact me about an interview. The more we get the word out the better!

3. Please prayerfully consider donating today.

Thank you!!!

story:
What We're Doing

I recently started a Toronto-centric blog.  So far it's mostly focused on Toronto political news (read Rob Ford) and the like.  Almost all of the writing has been done by either me or my associate editor.  We have a new staff writer who's just coming on board and working for free.  

I'd like to expand the site to an actual alternative news source for Toronto.  There are some of these out there already, of course.  I'm looking to do something a little more biting and a little less pretentious than some of the current options, while retaining a sense of humour and a good dose of snark.  Sarcastic, intelligent, thought-provoking infotainment about T.O. would be as good a descriptor as any.  (And here I was talking about being "less pretentious" with this...)

What We Need

What we need is some startup capital.  Right now it's a simple Blogger site, there are no ads, and everyone is writing for free.  Writing for someone else for free is lame, and I hate asking people to do it.  What I'd like to do is raise a modest amount of startup funding to accomplish the three following goals:

1. Redesign the site into a proper news site with a good look that's easily accessible and readable.

2. Spend a reasonable, limited amount of money on promotion to drive readers to the site in order to eventually allow it to become revenue-generating and self-sustaining.

3. PAY WRITERS!  PAY WRITERS!  PAY WRITERS!  I'd like to be able to offer people who put time into writing for the site at least a little money to begin with for doing so.  This would probably be in the $15-20 range per post at least at first, which isn't exactly money to retire on, but it would provide a bit of a supplemental income for people taking the time to write four or five things a week.  It also means people would be compensated for their work.  

To accomplish these three things, I'm asking for (what I believe is) the reasonable sum of $5000.  This will provide enough to pay for a developer to put some shine on the site, to pay for some ads, and to pay for a month or two worth of posts while we grow the site.  I will not be taking a salary or paying myself for posts - I won't be making a cent off of this site until the day comes when it's independently profitable.  Even then, most revenue will be either reinvested in the site or used to increase writer pay.  I'd sure love this to become a business I could live off of one day, but that's a hell of a long way down the road.

What We've Done So Far

Not a ton, as the blog is only a week old at this point.  But what we have done has been promising.  Promising enough to have already generated over 10,000 reads as of the writing of this sentence in a little under six days. Of course, you can judge for yourself whether what we're doing is worthwhile by visiting the blog here:

http://www.queenbathurst.com

If I and the people helping me didn't think there was the potential for something really worthwhile here, we wouldn't be starting this campaign.  But we see possibilities, and we'd really like to explore them.  It's just hard to attract quality and dedication when we don't have a solid looking platform or a way to pay contributors at least SOMETHING.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Letting people know about this is always good.  And of course, if anyone with expertise in promotion or design would like to donate time and work instead of money, it would just leave more to pay writers with.

story:
Help us create a spectacular 10th Anniversary Special Print Edition

To be unveiled on Saturday March 29, 2014, the 10th Anniversary Special Print Edition will be the biggest and boldest thing Guerilla has ever published!

Celebrating our first decade and published with critical support from CHUO FM 89.1 at the University of Ottawa, this special issue will include the biggest-ever collection of original and in-depth cross-cultural features—the same compelling mix of words and images that the magazine has delivered since it debuted in March 2004.

Guerilla has always been community-driven. We invite friends and supporters to participate in our efforts to mark 10 years of Ottawa-wide cultural collaborations.

What will we do with the money?

Printing high-quality magazines can be an expensive proposition. With your help we will be able to print our biggest and boldest edition ever. We'd even venture to say that it'll be a collector's item!

How can you help us?

You can make a critical difference by purchasing a perk, by telling your friends about our crowdfunding effort, and by attending our GuerillaCRAWL event series in late March. The CRAWL will culminate in the 10th anniversary GuerillaLIVE event on Saturday, March 29 at Gallery 101, where we will launch the special print edition!

If we exceed our goal, what will we do with the extra money? 

All extra funds will go towards GuerillaCRAWL events. See our Facebook event page for details! 

https://www.facebook.com/events/579185868828679/

About Guerilla magazine

http://getguerilla.ca

Guerilla was created almost 10 years ago to help fill a void in Ottawa’s arts media landscape with challenging and in-depth content exploring the broad spectrum of creative activity existent in the capital regiont.

In considering “Ottawa culture at ground level,” Guerilla deliberately spans boundaries, addressing a diversity of artistic forms and examining cultural contributors at all stages of development.

Guerilla’s multi-disciplinary approach and focus on the Capital Region gives the publication a unique ability to stimulate dialogue across traditionally insular institutions and creative circles.

Guerilla has successfully opened eyes and turned heads by showcasing the tremendous quality and diversity of work taking place in Ottawa. The magazine features proven performers and relative unknowns with equal emphasis, letting the strong and engaging local content speak for itself.

story:
FISH QUILL POETRY BOAT:

We are Leigh Kotsilidis and Linda Besner, two Canadian poets with critically acclaimed first books. In 2010, we wanted to organize a reading tour, and we talked about how author tours tend only to hit the big cities: Toronto, Montreal, Vancouver, Calgary, Halifax. We thought it would be great to get out to some smaller towns, and find a way to reach new audiences—people who might not ordinarily come out to a literary reading.

We wanted a tour that would make poetry feel like something people can relate to. And something that seemed like fun.

At first we thought we would ride horses from town to town, and call ourselves the Royal Canadian Mounted Poets (RCMP). Then we figured since we don’t know how to ride horses, don’t own horses, and would probably break all our bones on our way to the readings, that was probably a bad idea.

Then we thought of the perfect unconventional tour vehicle: the canoe.

We started Fish Quill Poetry Boat, which is now an annual ten-day poetry and music tour featuring five poets and one musician—2013 will be our fourth year. For riverside towns, the water is a huge part of the life of the community. Travelling along a river seemed like an ideal way to get to know a region rather than just parachuting in for a reading, talking about ourselves and our work, and then taking off.

We chose the Grand River in southwestern Ontario. The Grand is a beautiful river with tonnes of herons, turtles, wildflowers, and spots to camp along its shores. It flows 300 kilometres from the highlands of Dufferin County to Port Maitland, where it empties into Lake Erie.  It’s also a river that connects a whole string of small and medium-sized towns where we found fantastic local organizations willing to partner with us. In particular, our partnership with Treks in the Wild (http://www.treksinthewild.com/) has been crucial to this tour.

This June 13-23, FQPB will be paddling from Elora to Six Nations of the Grand River Territory, camping every night and giving performances in pre-arranged and pre-advertised venues along the way.

Our poets this year are David Seymour, Gillian Savigny, Andy McGuire, Leigh Kotsilidis, and Linda Besner. All are accomplished poets, and between us we’ve been shortlisted for the CBC Literary Awards, the Gerald Lampert Award, and have had our work anthologized in publications such as The Best Canadian Poetry Anthology.

To view our itinerary and this year's participant biographies, please click here: http://fishquill.weebly.com/upcoming.html

To join our Facebook event, please click here: https://www.facebook.com/events/431285653633505/

HERE'S WHAT WE NEED YOUR CONTRIBUTION FOR:

TRANSPORTATION: Our biggest cost is transportation; even though we get our canoe rental for free from our awesome sponsor, Treks in the Wild, we still need to pay them for the shuttling service they provide—the nature of running a tour by canoe means that sometimes where we sleep (campsites) and where we give our performances (cafés, heritage sites) aren’t very close to each other, and sometimes our campsites are too far from the river for us to lug our canoes and all our gear. If you’ve ever driven a huge van with a canoe rack with three canoes, eight people, and ten days worth of camping gear, you know it guzzles a lot of gas. We also need to get our participants and their gear out to Elora, and then back to Toronto at the tour’s end.

FOOD: We’re lucky to be reading in some great venues that are able to feed us for free, so some of our dinners are taken care of. But we still need to feed six people breakfast and lunch every day for ten days, with a few dinners as well. We cook at our campsites over Coleman stoves, so our budget is very reasonable.

CAMPING: We get some of our camping costs sponsored by the Grand River Conservation Authority, but a few campsites we have to pay for.

PROMOTION: We’ve worked out a great deal with Coach House Books who do our poster and flyer printing for free. But to get our promotional materials out, Leigh and Linda have to rent a car and drive out to the towns our tour goes to and put up posters and place flyers in local businesses and libraries.

And, if we exceed our indiegogo goal…

ADMINISTRATION: Leigh and Linda organize this tour in their “spare” time. If the four other performers on the tour were to pay a professional tour manager for a ten-day tour with eight performances, complete with all logistical and promotional activity, it would amount to a lot of money. We’d like to offer Leigh and Linda a small honorarium for all their work.

ARTISTS' FEES: Fish Quill Poetry Boat’s writers and musicians are professionals who have reached a high level of accomplishment in their fields. They’ll all be taking time off from other work to go on the tour. We’d like to offer each of them a professional reading fee for each performance.

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL GET YOU:

Perks! We’ve got perks galore. We’ve devised rewards for the following levels of Fish Quill supporter:

PERCH: 10$ will get you a Fish Quill tote bag stuffed with the gorgeous Fish Quill poster made by artist extraordinaire Ian Turner, and a Fish Quill magnet.

BASS: $20 will get you a copy of our Fish Quill anthology, a book with poems and song lyrics by Fish Quill performers past and present; that’s 50 acclaimed poets and musicians, including Nick Thran, Gabe Foreman, Asa Boxer, Helen Guri, and Jack Marks.

TROUT: $25 gets you a sweet Fish Quill t-shirt featuring artwork by the talented Ian Turner. Ian’s got serious chops.

SALMON: $50 gets you a plaque-mounted copy of our poster signed by all six of our 2013 participants. Literary wall art you can be proud of.

PIKE: $100 gets you all of the above. A great deal.

DOLPHIN: $300 means we’ll compose a poem just for you! You can commission an original piece on a topic of your choice; it’s an original and meaningful gift for a loved one (or for yourself).

SHARK: $500 gets you a Fish Quill-themed day with Leigh and Linda! First, canoeing on the Grand River, with a private reading on the water. Then, dinner with us at one of the region’s fine restaurants.

SHARK + ONE: $750 gets you AND A GUEST a Fish Quill-themed day with Leigh and Linda! First, canoeing on the Grand River, with a private reading on the water. Then, dinner with us at one of the region’s fine restaurants.

WHALE: $1000 will get you a personal manuscript workshop with acclaimed poets Leigh Kotsilidis and David Seymour. Leigh and David will read your work (up to 70 pages) and provide you with detailed feedback.

WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DON'T REACH OUR GOAL:

The show must go on!  If we don’t reach our funding goal, it means we’ll prioritize paying for transportation, food, and camping, and skimp on our promotion. We would nix any administration fee, so once again Leigh and Linda would do all the work for free and no participants would be paid.

THE IMPACT:

What we love about Fish Quill Poetry Boat is that it really does get a different audience out to hear new poetry and music. Every year audience members who’ve been attracted by the quirky concept come up to us after the show to tell us they’ve never been to a poetry reading before, and they loved it. This really means a lot to us. Poetry doesn’t get a lot of exposure in our society, so a lot of people never get a chance to find out whether they like it or not! We always bring extremely high quality performers on our tour, and often their art isn’t what people are expecting.

For the past four years, we have also made a point of involving non-arts organizations who have a concern for the river and see it as an integral part of their environment that enriches lives. We believe it is extremely valuable for these distinct communities to be in conversation with one another. In most cases, we have more in common than we think.

Our track record makes us confident that our 2013 tour will be a success. It’s the fourth year we’ve run Fish Quill Poetry Boat, and every year we’ve had great audiences, great performers, and no one has drowned yet!

If you like the idea of modern-day troubadours heading down a river in canoes to share their music and words, we think you’ll see why Fish Quill Poetry Boat is something we want to run again in 2013.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Get the word out! If we do say so ourselves, our video is pretty funny—share it on your social media networks, email it to family, friends, and colleagues. You can use Indiegogo’s share tools to make spreading our campaign even easier.

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

FISH QUILL POETRY BOAT:
We are Leigh Kotsilidis and Linda Besner, two Canadian poets with critically acclaimed first books. In 2010, we wanted to organize a reading tour, and we talked about how author tours tend only to hit the big cities: Toronto, Montreal, Vancouver, Calgary, Halifax. We thought it would be great to get out to some smaller towns, and find a way to reach new audiences—people who might not ordinarily come out to a literary reading.
We wanted a tour that would make poetry feel like something people can relate to. And something that seemed like fun.
At first we thought we would ride horses from town to town, and call ourselves the Royal Canadian Mounted Poets (RCMP). Then we figured since we don’t know how to ride horses, don’t own horses, and would probably break all our bones on our way to the readings, that was probably a bad idea.
Then we thought of the perfect unconventional tour vehicle: the canoe.
We started Fish Quill Poetry Boat, which is now an annual ten-day poetry and music tour featuring five poets and one musician—2013 will be our fourth year. For riverside towns, the water is a huge part of the life of the community. Travelling along a river seemed like an ideal way to get to know a region rather than just parachuting in for a reading, talking about ourselves and our work, and then taking off.
We chose the Grand River in southwestern Ontario. The Grand is a beautiful river with tonnes of herons, turtles, wildflowers, and spots to camp along its shores. It flows 300 kilometres from the highlands of Dufferin County to Port Maitland, where it empties into Lake Erie.  It’s also a river that connects a whole string of small and medium-sized towns where we found fantastic local organizations willing to partner with us. In particular, our partnership with Treks in the Wild (http://www.treksinthewild.com/) has been crucial to this tour.

Our poets this year are David Seymour, Gillian Savigny, Andy McGuire, Leigh Kotsilidis, and Linda Besner. story:
For more than a decade, the site www.dorothyswebsite.org has been giving visitors access to information on free concerts and music-related events - and much more - in the Los Angeles, Orange County and Inland Empire regions of Southern California. Following the site's 10th Anniversary summer, Dorothy put together a book about the site called "Ten Summers: The Story of www.dorothyswebsite.org." The book includes poetry, photographs and other materials which have appeared online over the years, a history of the site, and other behind-the-scenes information, particularly the story of how the site's creation is related to Dorothy's experiences within the U.S. student loan system.

Dorothy is asking site visitors and others to please get in touch with their inner Santas this holiday season and help her make it past the final hurdles toward getting the book published. The goal of this "10 Summers" Indiegogo campaign has been set at a minimum $7,500 level to raise funds for a pre-publication legal review of portions of the book's contents, for pre-publication bound paper copies to be distributed to some of the many people who have been involved in some way with the site over the years, and for the replacement of some semi-working computer equipment which was purchased in 2006. Your generosity in helping this campaign reach its goal would be greatly appreciated!

THE SITE

The site was started in the summer of 2003 and was originally intended to be a computer exercise lasting about a month. The 10th Anniversary summer was celebrated in 2012, and www.dorothyswebsite.org is now in its 11th year! Most people visit the site to find listings of free concerts in several areas of Southern California. There are two phases to www.dorothyswebsite.org - the smaller Fall/Winter/Spring version (when there are fewer events, the current format), and the Summer version. In the summer the site has a particular theme which changes each year, and the site expands to include other sections: Guest Artists (poets, painters, photographers, sculptors, etc.), featured musical groups or individual performers, poetry, links, "Extras" (other things to do, get or see for free), and a series of essays on topics of technology-related consumer interest.

Over the period of its existence, the site has grown to be a steady source of information for concert listings, and to a lesser extent for other free products, services or events. Finding that information has given visitors access to everything from family-friendly activities to free birthday meals. Whether directly or indirectly, the site also has helped create jobs for musicians, support various aspects of the arts, provide information on a variety of science and technology- related topics in a manner which (hopefully) was easy to understand, and give others, particularly musicians and artists, the chance to let people know more about themselves and their work.

THE BOOK

As said above, the site was started in 2003 and has been operated since then by the author of "Ten Summers: The Story of www.dorothyswebsite.org", Dorothy Birsic (which is where the name of the site comes from). On more than one occasion over the years someone has said, "Why don't you put together a book about the site?" The end of the milestone 10th Anniversary summer in September 2012 seemed to be an opportune time to do just that, but for more than one reason. The date reflected milestone anniversaries of two intertwined stories, the stories of the site and Dorothy's experiences within the U.S. student loan system.

The 228-page working copy of the book, with the cover depicted above, was completed earlier this year. The book includes everything previously listed, plus a detailed description of the summer themes and a photographic collectors' guide/appendix showing the 2 x 3.5 inch cards designed over the years to let people know about the site's existence. There have never been advertisements on the site, nor have advertisements for the site appeared anywhere. People have found out about the site primarily from the cards they were given before or after a concert, by word of mouth, or by an internet search for free concert information. A link to a pdf file of the book's table of contents can be found at www.dorothyswebsite.org/FallBookPreview.html, the site's book information page.

THE BUDGET

Your assistance is greatly appreciated in helping Dorothy clear the final hurdles to get the book through to publication. At this time no decision has been made on whether or not to independently publish the book. The $7,500 minimum campaign fundraising goal has been set to meet the following needs:

-- Replacing partially working computer equipment originally purchased in 2006. I typeset/did all the graphics for the working copy. However, the screen on the 2006 CRT monitor I have been using is not large enough to work on a page of the book at full size, and the 2006 all-in-one printer has only one remaining working function (and it's not the printing). A 2006 desktop computer died last year, and I have been using a borrowed one since then. (Estimates: monitor only: $100 - $300, good quality multi-function printer: $200 - $500; new desktop tower/laptop or re-do of overall system: $400 - $2,500).

-- A legal review of certain portions of the book (estimated at $3,000 - $5,000)

-- Following the review, making of 40 B/W and 10 full color bound pre-publication copies to distribute for courtesy review to those who have been involved in the site (estimates, even with volume copy discounts, range from $1,500 to $1,900, plus an estimated $200 - $350 for postage. Some people still need an actual physical copy to review).

-- Fees/expenses associated with the Indiegogo campaign: Will vary. There is an Indiegogo fee of 4% of all funds raised if the campaign goal is met, or 9% of the funds if the goal is not met (plus a 3% fee on credit card contributions).

ESTIMATED TOTAL BUDGET: $5,400 - over $10,000.

PLEASE NOTE: THE $7,500 GOAL IS THE MINIMUM THAT NEEDS TO BE MET TO AVOID HAVING 9% OF THE FUNDS GOING TO INDIEGOGO. THERE IS NO LIMIT TO THE AMOUNT WHICH CAN BE RAISED, ONLY A DEADLINE, WHICH HAS BEEN SET FOR SATURDAY DECEMBER 14. ANY AMOUNT RAISED BEYOND THE FIGURES LISTED IN THE BUDGET ABOVE WILL BE APPLIED TO THE REGULAR OPERATING EXPENSES OF WWW.DOROTHYSWEBSITE.ORG, KEEPING IT GOING IN THE SHORT TERM WHILE DECISIONS ARE MADE ABOUT ITS LONGER-TERM EXISTENCE. THERE ARE FEW WORDS TO ADEQUATELY EXPRESS MY APPRECIATION FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS TO THIS CAMPAIGN!

THE PROCESS

Indiegogo will process payments through PayPal and credit cards, and Indiegogo does allow friends to make contributions for others. You can make a contribution only or select a "perk" for a contribution level. The levels of contributions are listed on the right with the "perk" you will be receiving for your contribution along with my gratitude. YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS THROUGH INDIEGOGO ARE CONSIDERED GIFTS AND NOT DONATIONS, SO THEY ARE NOT TAX DEDUCTIBLE. YOU ALSO CAN HAVE THE CONTRIBUTION LISTED UNDER YOUR NAME, A NICKNAME OR AS ANONYMOUS. Over the years www.dorothyswebsite.org has had visitors ranging in age from their teens to 70s/80s and beyond. I understand that some people are still not comfortable with making online transactions. FOR THIS CAMPAIGN ONLY, personal checks/money orders made out to Dorothy Birsic (no cash, please) also may be sent to "10 Summers" Book, Indiegogo Campaign Support, c/o P.O. Box 1432, Fullerton, CA, 92836. PLEASE CLICK HERE TO PRINT A FORM TO SEND ALONG WITH YOUR CONTRIBUTION. (pdf form) These contributions will not be able to be applied by Indiegogo to the campaign goal, but they are welcome with my most gracious thanks, and you will still receive a "perk" for your contribution level. Please include an e-mail address for confirmation of the receipt of the contribution, physical mailing address for any "perk" which will need to be sent to you, and whether you would like your full name or nickname to be listed in the contributor section(s), or as anonymous or with no name at all.

IF YOU HAVE AN QUESTIONS ABOUT RECEIVING PERKS, PLEASE SEND AN E-MAIL TO 10SUMMERSBOOK@DOROTHYSWEBSITE.ORG, CC THE E-MAIL ADDRESS ADBMAILPLACE@GMAIL.COM, AND PUT THE WORDS "INDIEGOGO PERKS" IN THE SUBJECT LINE.

THE PERKS

In an orchestra, every instrument - no matter how small or large - is important and plays a special role. Your contributions are the same, very significant at any level.  Images of some of the perks are included below.
-- At the $20 level, your choice of one of four photo "Indiegogo Contributor" thank you card designs (flower, cat, guitars, or butterfly) for the Facebook photo gallery:

-- At the $25 level, the keepsake holiday-themed photograph and digital artwork (approximately 5x7 inches in size) are pictured below.


--At the $35 level, one copy of the 11x17 "Scenes and Summer Themes 2003 - 2013," a color digital print on 70 lb uncoated book paper (pictured below on the left in the row with "Faith, Hope and Love.") To see a larger view of the image on a separate page, click here.
--- At the $50 level and above: "Ducks in Shades" limited-edition poster print, offset print on 100 lb gloss book paper This limited-edition 11x17 poster print, created by Dorothy exclusively for the Indiegogo campaign, will have a maximum run of 250, and each print will be numbered.


-- A small image of the 8x10 digital artwork entitled "Faith, Hope and Love," which is available at contribution levels of $250 and above, is also included below on the right. Photographic prints will be made only to accompany contributions and will be numbered (and will not be offered anywhere else after this campaign).

     

-- Starting at the $2,500 level, six complete sets from Dorothy's personal collection of the 2 x 3.5 inch cards created to publicize the site are offered through this campaign. The complete set consists of the 25 cards pictured in the book, plus a bonus random sample of five of the hand-cut paper cards used to publicize the site in the early years of its existence (but not necessarily pictured in the book). An example of a card from Summer 2012 is included here.

AND IF YOU LIVE IN THE ORANGE COUNTY, LOS ANGELES COUNTY, OR INLAND EMPIRE AREAS OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA, YOU HAVE THE BEST "PERK" OF ALL -- YOU CAN GO TO WWW.DOROTHYSWEBSITE.ORG AT ANY TIME FOR FREE!

THE REST

Indiegogo fundraising campaign address: www.igg.me/at/dorothyswebsitebook
Website: www.dorothyswebsite.org
Twitter: www.twitter.com/dorothyswebsite
Facebook: www.facebook.com/dorothyswebsite
E-mail: information@dorothyswebsite.org, dorothyswebsite@hotmail.com, adbmailplace@gmail.com

story:
How It All Began

Hi, I'm T. D. Von Dohren, an Australian who now calls the beautiful city of Vancouver, Canada home. I'm a creative writing major and media professional who started writing my first fiction novel in 2002 as part of my degree. I wrote over half back then and intended to continue, however the pressure of starting a 'real' career and getting my life 'set up' got in the way and for 8 years, I didn't write a word. By then, I was almost scared to put pen to paper. What if I simply wasn't a good writer anymore? What if my tutor, lecturers, friends and family had just been being kind when they said they thought my story idea was intriguing and could really take off? 

Though my story had always been at the back of mind, I had almost given up hope of it ever coming about. The truth that many don't realise, is that publishing your book the right way is hard. Yes you can self publish, but who would be the outside voice of reason to tell you where you needed to add in more description, or ensure that the story you have in your head (one that has also changed many times) has translated and makes sense on the page? As a bit of a perfectionist I wanted to do things right. Adding that to the fact that there was significant base cost involved and I had just moved my whole life to Canada leaving me back at square 1 financially, I was slowly starting to accept that the dream of being a published writer, of getting my views out there, was over.

Then fate stepped in. I was newly single and had decided to pair getting out and meeting people, with building my professional network. A woman I work with runs a networking blog and asked if I would be interested in attending local networking events for free in exchange for writing an article on them for her blog. I jumped at the chance, and soon had my very first event lined up. A glamorous 'Ladies who Lunch' event at one of the most upmarket private lifestyle clubs in town. It was here that I met Julie Salisbury, Founder of Influence Publishing and at the end of the lunch, when the influential business women in the room were given the chance to offer up any experiences or gifts for a lucky door prize, it was my business card that was pulled out to attend a workshop with Julie specifically for first time authors! 

What We Need 

The rest, as they say, is history... At this point, I have a contract with Influence Publishing who, unlike the big name publishers, allows first time authors to maintain ownership of the rights to their work on the basis of collaborative marketing rather than the publishing house doing it all for you. This means that on the up side, I have a lot more say in how I am presented and how involved I am (which I love!) but it also means there is more of a financial contribution needed on my part (which is where I need your help). 

My book will be available to order from January, 2014. I am not planning any outrageous book tours around the world, but will instead by focusing my efforts on:

  • Building an online following through bloggers, reviewers and social media,
  • Attending conferences as a guest speaker or exhibitor to help leverage my profile, 
  • and entering relevant literary contests to help legitimise my book,
  • I can also now confirm that I will be donating part proceeds for the whole 3 months of Summer to http://www.survivalinternational.org/ : The Global Movement for Tribal People's rights.

The main costs associated with this campaign will be: 

  • Building my website (I already have a basic wordpress site and have purchased the relevant domain names - no links yet as I'm working on them),
  • Putting together small but creatively engaging press kits to send with my book to relevant media and bloggers,
  • Any costs involved with attending profile boosting conferences (ie. Application, booth fees and travel),
  • Entry fees for literary contests

Given that I have over 7 years experience working in the media industry in promotions and programming, I will be doing most of the marketing work myself. I have also recruited a friend who works at a top PR Agency to further guide me. I have a small amount of money saved, so this will be to help me avoid using my whole life savings. I do guarantee that 100% of any money raised here will be contributed ONLY to the costs outlined above.

What You Get

To show in some small way my sincerest gratitude for you help, I can offer the following benefits:

  • Top Tier Donations will receive a signed copy of the book 'Daughter of the Moon: Awakening Ancient Bloodlines', thank you mention in the book for the next available print run and all future print runs between January 2013 and January 2015, a minor character named after them in sequel, offer of a short story tailor written for the donor or as a gift;
  • Middle Tier Donations will receive a signed copy of the book 'Daughter of the Moon: Awakening Ancient Bloodlines', offer of a short story tailor written for the donor or as a gift;
  • Minimal Donations will receive a signed copy of the book 'Daughter of the Moon: Awakening Ancient Bloodlines'.

The Impact - Why is this book different?

If you are still reading, THANK YOU! Here is a brief description of the book. While it is about Vampires, it also takes a deep look at the relationship and similarities between myth and religion. This story is quite controversial in the way that it paints a very different view of history and religion. I ask readers to question not only, 'What If' but 'What is...'

What do Jesus Christ, a Greek goddess and a thousand year old Vampire have in common?

This intriguing and thought provoking journey will have you questioning everything you think you know about myth and religion as Chhaya, a vampire born more than a millennium ago, discovers she is the descendant of an ancient bloodline, the blood of Christ.

As the power in her awakens, Chhaya must use her new gifts as the Daughter of the Moon to fight against the corrupt coven leader Khai to protect the door to heaven and hell and prevent the end of days.

Whether you are a fan of fantasy, religious theories or mythology you’ll be inspired to ask, ‘What is good, and what is evil?’

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand that not all people have the spare cash to contribute financially, that's why I'm doing this! So please, if you do believe that this is a worthwhile campaign, share this link and tell your friends and connections. This small gesture can really do so much to help me build the funds to get this unique story out there. 

The share tools are all easily accessible on this page, Thanks!

story:
For the past five summers, I have spent 7 or 8 days on Grand Bahama Island with a mission trip from my home church in Pennsylvania. The trip is predominantly for Senior High youth, which means I moved past this age a few years ago.

As a junior Journalism major at Ithaca College, I have also developed two minors in religious studies and politics. I am fascinated by the intermingling of all three, and especially how the media and mediums of today effect religious practice. A statistic that astounds me is that 97% of Bahamian people identify with some sort of religion. Why is this true in a country that has so much economic and physical hardship? The biggest boost to the economy in the Bahamas comes from tourism, while the islands are quite literally rocks in the Atlantic Ocean taking hit after hit from hurricanes and other dangerous and deadly storms.

I’d like to return to Grand Bahama Island with the mission group from July 18-24 to spend time with the Bahamian people and answer this question: Why do Bahamians have so much faith when they have so little of everything else?

I will record interviews with Bahamian people of all religions and ages and aggregate my findings in a journalistic piece with both written and audio components.

The cost of airfare, lodging and food for the trip is $1000 and it must be raised by June 1st. I am hoping this experience will further my goals as a journalist and also shed some light on the intermingling of religion and culture in a way not heavily researched or well known.
