story:
We want to tell stories, to document conflicts and injustices. We did it until today receiving the most important international awards. Now we want to use digital technology to create a magazine with interactive web-reportage.

  Queremos contar historias, documentar los conflictos y también las injusticias. Lo hemos hecho hasta hoy consiguiendo los más grandes y reconocidos premios. Ahora queremos aprovechar la libertad de las nuevas tecnologías para crear una revista de reportajes interactivos. 

Me-Mo website


WHO ARE WE?

  We are a collective of 5 photojournalists specialized in conflict and social issues: Fabio Bucciarelli (Robert Capa Gold Medal, World Press Photo), Manu Brabo (Pulitzer Prize, Prix Bayeux-Calavados), Guillem Valle (World Press Photo, Best of Photojournalism), Diego Ibarra Sánchez (NYT contributor), José Colón (AFP contributor).

We are a team of professionals working all over the world who, in partnership with a web-passionate group of creatives (Libre), have created this new editorial project: ME-MO.

  Somos un colectivo de cinco fotoperiodistas especializados en conflictos sociales: Fabio Bucciarelli (Robert Capa Medal Award, World Press Photo), Manu Brabo (Pulitzer Prize, Prix Bayeux-Calvados), Guillem Valle (World Press Photo, Best of Photojournalism), Diego Ibarra Sánchez (NYT contributor) y José Colón (AFP contributor).

Un grupo de profesionales que trabaja por todo el mundo y que ha decidido hacer equipo con un grupo de apasionados creativos web (LIBRE), dando forma a este proyecto editorial: ME-MO


WHAT IS ME-MO?

  ME-MO is a free and independent digital magazine aiming to reveal the untold stories of our tumultuous world. We document international conflicts and historical events, human rights violations and social injustices, always with great respect towards people and their stories.

Nowadays, technology has broadened the impact of photography and it is going to consolidate new ways of storytelling.

Therefore, we are using the strength of a digital application to produce a cross-media platform by combining photography, video, writing and animation, so we can reach as much people as possible.

The magazine will be quarterly and in English. Each issue will have a key theme which conceptually liaises all the published stories on that edition.  “Fear” will be number 0's theme.

World-renowned journalists will collaborate with us by providing insights and editorials on every issue.
ME-MO will be available as APP, at a cost of € 5 per issue, reachable on every platform and highly interactive.

  ME-MO es una revista digital de reportajes fotográficos, libre e independiente que pretende seguir historias de carácter internacional, y sobre todo, la gente que forma parte de ellas. Intentando, siempre, mostrar las realidades ocultas. 

Queremos posar nuestra mirada sobre los conflictos sociales importantes de nuestra época, contar historias y usar la narrativa siempre con los derechos humanos y la discriminación social como trasfondo, enseñando siempre, la cara oculta de la historia.

La aplicacion será en Inglés y cuatrimestral. Cada numero tratará un tema central que represente y aglutine la idea principal de todas las historia publicadas. El “miedo”, será la temática del nº 0.

En cada número, periodistas de reconocido prestigio internacional, colaborarán con nosotros dando su punto de vista en artículos y editoriales.

ME-MO se podrá conseguir en forma de APP a un coste de 5 por número. Será un proyecto altamente interactivo  y accesible para todas las plataformas.


WHY DO WE NEED YOUR DONATION?

  You can't ask for money to others, if you aren't willing to stand up for the project and to personally invest in it. We put talent, expertise, passion, time and resources.

The realistic and total amount to launch ME-MO project and to ensure the adequate quality standards, is approximately 25 thousand euro.

The goal of 15 thousand Euros, which we would like you to contribute to, will cover the living costs of the software annual user license, multiplatform application included (5000 euro) and the  reporting expences for the first year of the magazine.

  No pediríamos dinero a nadie si no estuviéramos dispuestos a apostar por el proyecto e invertir personalmente en él. Aportamos talento, pasión, experiencia, tiempo y recursos.

La cifra total y realista para llevar a cabo el proyecto ME-MO y asegurar una calidad adecuada ronda los 25 mil Euros.

El objetivo de 15,000 €, con el que queremos que contribuyáis, cubrirá el costo real del software, licencias de usuario anuales, aplicación multiplataforma incluida (5000€) y gastos de trabajo de los fotógrafos durante primer año de la revista.


WHAT DO WE ASK FOR AND WHOM ARE WE ASKING TO?

  We ask you to believe in the ME-MO project along with us and to make a donation. Even the smallest is precious.

We need the contribution of everyone: those who love photography, those who love journalism and want to stay updated, those who know and appreciate our work, those who have never heard of us but are excited about promoting  independent photojournalism.

We need the support of the press, opinion leaders and professionals who can give prominence to the project and spread it.

We need donations from our relatives, our friends and colleagues because they are the guarantee that we will make ME-MO and we will do it really well.

  Pedimos que creáis en nosotros, así como en este proyecto haciendo una donación. Cualquier cifra por pequeña que sea se agradecerá.

Necesitamos contribuciones de todo el mundo. De aquellos que aman la fotografía, de los que aman el periodismo y quieren estar actualizados, de aquellos que aprecian nuestro trabajo y también de aquellos que nunca han oído hablar de nosotros pero apuestan por el fotoperiodismo independiente.

Necesitamos el apoyo de la prensa, de los líderes de opinión y de los profesionales que pueden dar relevancia a este proyecto y expandir su idea.

Necesitamos donaciones de familiares, amigos y de nuestros colegas. Ellos serán la garantía de que llevaremos ME-MO a buen puerto y de que lo haremos realmente bien, poniendo siempre lo mejor de nuestras habilidades.



WHAT ABOUT THE PERKS?


Limited Edition Picture 1  - 200€

(20x30)

España. Sevilla. Olivares. 25/01/2013. Un coche transita, por la carretera que limita los pueblos de Olivares y Albaida del Aljarafe. (By José Colón)



Limited Edition Picture 2 - 250€
(20x30)

Pristina, Kosovo. 19/02/2008. The very first day of Kosovo's independence. (By Guillem Valle)



Limited Edition Picture 3 - 300€
(20x30)

The challenge of education in Pakistan, 2013.  (By Diego Ibarra Sánchez)




Limited Edition Picture 4 - 500€ 
(60x40)

Sirte, Libia - October 2011. (By Manu Brabo)



Limited Edition Picture 5 - 550€
(60x40)

From reportage 'Battle To Death', Syria 2012. (By Fabio Bucciarelli)

De aquellos que aman la fotografía, de los que aman el periodismo y quieren estar actualizados, de aquellos que aprecian nuestro trabajo y también de aquellos que nunca han oído hablar de nosotros pero apuestan por el fotoperiodismo independiente.Necesitamos el apoyo de la prensa, de los líderes de opinión y de los profesionales que pueden dar relevancia a este proyecto y expandir su idea.Necesitamos donaciones de familiares, amigos y de nuestros colegas. Ellos serán la garantía de que llevaremos ME-MO a buen puerto y de que lo haremos realmente bien, poniendo siempre lo mejor de nuestras habilidades.WHAT ABOUT THE PERKS?Limited

story:
UPDATE - The project was featured on in Ad Age, the New York Business Journal and on Creativity-online.com. Be sure to check it out! 

Also, please be sure to read the updates page. 

The Grand Experiment

Since childhood, we've always been told to be great people and pursue great things. As a Copywriter at an impasse in life, I finally understood that greatness could not be found, it had to be created. Well, this is my creation. This is my attempt to do something great. 

This isn't about me or any one individual. This is about changing how people view an industry that's home to some of the world's most creative and talented individuals. That's why I'm calling upon anyone with a creative bone in their body to assist me in bringing this idea to life. If successful, this project can be the spark that ignited a revolution. Let's show the world just how great advertising can be. 

So, throughout 2014, I’ll be plying my craft at advertising agencies across North America. It’s about discovering creative transcendency, experiencing native cultures and developing a new understanding of what it means to be a part of this crazy world we call advertising. That's 14 agencies in 14 months. 

As a creative, I know how hard it can be to find an agency that best fits one’s talents and interests. That’s why I’m making this trip a reality. I’ll document the entire experience via a dedicated website and blog, and various other outlets such as Facebook, Tumblr and Twitter. In the end, I’ll collect it all and publish it as a hardcover book.

My goal is to show young, hungry creatives just how much advertising, and creativity in general, varies around the world. Then, perhaps, they can make better-informed decisions on where they would like to take their careers and where they will be their happiest.

Everyone can follow along at the project's dedicate website:

www.thegreatagencyadventure.com.

The timeline for this project is as follows (I'll update with new agencies as they confirm):

Cleveland - December 1 - 29: (Kickoff Month) Recess Creative
Boston - January 3 - 31 BEAM Interactive
New York - February 4 - 28 We Are Social
Philadelphia - March 4 - 28 Red Tettemer O'Connell + Partners 
Charlotte - April 2 - May 1: BooneOakley
Memphis, Nashville, Atlanta or Cincinnati - May 6 - 30:
St. Louis - June 3 - 27: Boxing Clever 
Chicago - July 1 - 31: TRIS3CT
Minneapolis - August 5 - 29: Campbell Mithun
Austin - September 3 - October 2: 97 Degrees West
Seattle - October 7 - 31: Wunderman
Vancouver - November 4: 28 Cowie & Fox
San Francisco - December 2 - 30 
Los Angeles - January 5 - 30 (2015) 

Why am I doing this? 

I guess that’s the million-dollar question. Off the top of my head, I can think of a thousand reasons. However, the number one answer is that as a Copywriter, I know first hand how difficult it can be to find the right agency. I’m hoping that by embarking on and documenting this experience, I will not only open my own eyes, but also go on to help new creatives as they graduate and enter the field. I want to assist the next generation by offering a new view of this industry through the eyes of someone who was in their shoes. In the end, perhaps a few young creatives will be able to make better-informed decisions on where they want to take their careers and where their unique qualities would fit right in. 

Where will the money go?

I know it's a steep amount, but please keep in mind it is designed to sustain the project for 14 months. All funds raised will go toward the following:

  • Transportation (planes, trains, cars and subways) ($6,500 = $4,000 for travel between cities and $2,500 for inner city travel).
  • Housing ($12,500 = $892 per city)
  • Associated costs (i.e.web hosting fees, design, shipping, work visa application) ($1,500)
  • Taxes, CPA & Indiegogo fees ($1,500)
  • Publishing costs ($2,250)
  • Advertising / Media costs ($3,500)
  • Legal / Trip insurance ($2,000)
  • Shipping fees ($500)

The remainder of my goal will be set aside for emergencies / issues. I plan on being as thrifty in my spending as possible. Any money not utilized in the project will be set aside and donated to the Red Cross. 

Will you be getting paid at the agencies?

Yes. However, as part of my selling point to agencies, I'm only asking for enough to cover food, toiletries and inescapable bills (i.e. medication, cell phone, student loans).

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have any dough? No problem! Anyone can help by spreading the word about my project. 

  • Tweet me at @zombieparmesan
  • Check out my past work at www.zombieparmesan.com

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hello, and welcome to my Indiegogo campaign!

My name is Emet Degirmenci and I am a permaculture designer and environmental activist with a social justice focus originally from Turkey and presently living in Seattle, WA, the US by way of Australia and New Zealand!

I am seeking your support to raise funds to publish my second book focusing on empowerment through food sovereignty and social-ecological principles for community building. In the tool bag it will also include practical skills such as bokashi composting which works through Effective Microorganisms (EM) planting and mulching techniques for dry areas, foraging wisdom, & food preserving techniques from the Anatolian culture.

My first book was about Ecological Transformation Through Womens Hand and accomplished this in 2010 http://kitap.radikal.com.tr/Kitap/kadinlar-ekolojik-donusumde-305661

I have received very good feedback that the book was helpful to women in rural and urban areas to help empower them to empower for their leadership in Turkey.

My second book is also written for women in rural and urban areas to support their access to real food and to be self reliant without any dependence of author

This time my second book will help to audience in rural and urban for real food and to be self reliant without any dependence of authorities.

Your support to make this happen will not only support me to share my knowledge and experience to benefit for Turkish and English speaking community, at the same time I'll support you with my small gifts. Please take a look the perks on the right side of this page. Thank you for your contributions and for sharing this project in your circles.

More about me/the author

I am an independent researcher of ecology and gender, environmental activist, and a freelance permaculture designer and teacher. Here’s my profile on the World Wide Permaculture Network: www.permacultureglobal.com/users/875-emet-degirmenci

In 2007, I founded Innermost Gardens in Aotearoa/New Zealand inspired to create a place where refugee and migrant women could grow and share food together. The project is still very successful to this day: www.innermostgardens.org.nz/

In 2010, I edited and published the book, 'Kadınlar Ekolojik Dönüşümde' in Turkish, which translates as (Ecological Trasformation Through Women's Hand): www.bianet.org/biamag/kadin/126261-anadolu-dan-and-daglarina-ekofeminizm

I also invite you to check out my blog which includes more information on local community projects that I am hosting or contributing to: kendineyeterlitoplum.wordpress.com/

Where you come in

I am trying to reach out to my community for financial help to cover some of my living costs while I devote my time and attention to making this book happen.

Where is the money going?

The $5,000 goal set for this campaign.

Indiegogo charges 4% + 15%TAX

$1000 travel expenses to visit some inspiring ecological projects to share in the book.

About $3000 to support the author's living cost.

How you can follow this project?

I will post regular updates here at indiegogo.com so you will get automatic updates on the progress of the book if you contribute here. Also I invite you to become my friend on Facebook to get more regular updates both on the book and also on my other work in the community: www.facebook.com/emet.degirmenci

Stretch the goal

This will be totally awesome!

-The author could buy and donate some of her books to disadvantage communities which she often contributes to them.

-Also this will be a nıce motivation for my further writings to share. I'm already planning my life experience in different cultures based on my analysis of dominant culture and what to replace man's domination over nature.

Other ways you can help:

Your support to make this happen will support me to share my knowledge and experience to benefit both Turkish and English speaking communities.  I'm happy to be able to share some small gifts with you.  Please take a look the perks on the right side of this page. Thank you for your contributions and for sharing this project in your circles.

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/empowerment-through-food-soverenity/x/6202121

If you what to find out more about this campaign contact us via e-mail <kendineyeterlitoplum@gmail.com>

*****************************************************************************************************

TURKISH/TÜRKÇE

Merhaba ve Indiegogo kampanyama hoşgeldiniz!

Ben Emet Değirmenci. Türkiye kökenli olmakla birlikte Avustralya ve Yeni Zelanda dan sonra şu an ABD'nin Washington eyaleti Seattle kentinde yaşamaktayım. Permakiltür tasarımcısı ve ekoloji aktivistliğimi toplumsal adalet odaklı yürütmekteyim.

Sizden ikinci kitabımı yazmaya odaklanmak için destek istiyorum. Kitap, Gıda Bağımsızlığı ve Toplumsal Ekoloji Prensipleriyle Topluluk Oluşturmak gibi temellere dayanıyor. Pratik beceriler olarak alet çantası bölümünde ise Etkin Mikroorganizmalarla (EM) çalışan Bokaşi Kompostu, kurak alanlar için Malçlama teknikleri, Doğadan besin  toplama bilgeliği ve Anadolu kültüründe bazı gıda koruma yöntemleri olacak.

İlk kitabım 2010 yılında çıkan Kadınlar Ekolojik Dönüşümde idi ve oldukça geniş bir kitleye ulaştı. http://kitap.radikal.com.tr/Kitap/kadinlar-ekolojik-donusumde-305661 Kitap kırsal ve kentli kadının yerel ekolojik olarak yaptıklarına sahip çıkması ve sesini duyurmasına teşvik anlamında oldukça yararlı olduğu yönünde geri bildirimler aldım.

Bu kez ikinci kitabım hem gıda bagımsızlığı anlamında işin politikası hem de merkezi otoritelere bağlı olmaksızın yerel topluluklar oluşturarak kendine yeterliliği odak alacak.

Yardımınız yalnızca bilgi ve deneyimlerimi paylaşmaya değil, aynı zamanda Türkçe ve İngilizce konuşan destekçilerimi gerçek gıda yetiştirme anlamında kendine yeterlilik için küçük armağanlarımla desteklemek. Lütfen yan tarafa göz atın. Bu projeyi kendi netvorkünüzde paylaşırsanız memnun olurum.

Yazar/Kendim hakkında biraz daha bilgi

Ekoloji ve Cins konusunda bagımsız araştırmacı, aktivist ve serbest permakültür tasarımcısıyım. www.permacultureglobal.com/users/875-emet-degirmenci

2007yılında , yerli dilinde Aotearoa olarak bilinen Yeni Zelanda da Innermost Gardens projesini sığınmacı ve göçmen kadınların toprakla bağlarını korumaları ve çevrelerine katkıda bulunmaları iöin kurdum. Proje başarılı olarak yürüyorŞ

www.innermostgardens.org.nz/

2010 da 'Kadınlar Ekolojik Dönüşümde' kitabını derleyip edit ettim: www.bianet.org/biamag/kadin/126261-anadolu-dan-and-daglarina-ekofeminizm

Gerçek gıda ve ekolojik yaşam çerçevesinde yazı ve projelerimi paylaştığım bloğuma da göz atmanızı öneririm: kendineyeterlitoplum.wordpress.com/

Nasıl parçası olabilirsiniz?

Kitaba zamanımı ve dikkatimi verirken bazı yaşam giderlerimi karşılamama destek olabilirsiniz.

Para nereye harcanacak?

Hedef 5,000 ABD doları.

Indiegogo:%4 +%15 Vergi (kampanya hedefine ulaşmazsa İndiegogo'nun payı %9)

~1000$ ABD içinde bazı ilginç ekolojik projeleri ziyaret edip kitapta yansıtmak

~ 3000$ yazarın yaşam harcamalarına destek

Projedeki gelişmeleri nasıl izleyebilirsiniz?

Kampanya boyunca güncellemeyi düzenli olarak bu saffadan izleyebilirsiniz.

Ayrıca kendi kişisel Face Book sayfamdan da bu konudaki gelişmeleri ve diğer toplumsal odaklı projelerimi takip edebileceksniz. Dilerseniz arkadaş olabiliriz: www.facebook.com/emet.degirmenci

Hedeflediğimizden fazla toplanırsa

Bu kesinlikle sevindirici olacaktır! Şu anda zaten herşey minimumda tutulmuş durumdadır.

-Sıkça yoksul topluluklarla çalışmaktayım. Kitapları satın alıp onlara bagışta bulunurum.

-Bu aynı zamanda kafamdaki başka yazma projelerime devam etmem için güzel bir motivasyon olur. Değişik kültürlerdeki yaşam deneyimimi ve hakim kültür altında yaşama analizlerimi ve insanın doğaya hükmetmesi yerine neler yapılabileceği üzerine başka bir kitap projem bulunmaktadır.

Başka nasıl destek olabilirsiniz?

Bilgi ve deneyimlerimi Tükçe ve İnglizce konuşan toplumla paylaşmam desteğinizle  mümkün olacaktır. Katkınız için lütfen sağdaki küçük armağanlar bölümüne göz atın.  Katkılarınız için teşekkürler!  Aşağıdaki linki iletişim ağlarınızda paylaşırsanız beni daha da mutlu edersiniz.

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/empowerment-through-food-soverenity/x/6202121

Eğer kampanya hakkında iletişim halinde olmak isterseniz e-maille bana ulaşabilirsiniz: <kendineyeterlitoplum@gmail.com>

story:
Hello! My name’s Jo Roberts. My book, Contested Land, Contested Memory: Israel’s Jews and Arabs and the Ghosts of Catastrophe, has just been published by Dundurn Press. I’m getting very positive feedback so far (see below); and the first review, in Publishers Weekly, said “Roberts does a masterful job of presenting all perspectives in their proper context.” Now, I just need to get the word out more widely! Can you help?

How much am I trying to raise, and how would I use it?

These days, the publishing industry’s in turmoil, and authors have to do most of their own book promotion. I'm not expecting to make any money from this book— aside from some Arts Council writing grants, and a $2,000 publishers' advance, I've been living off my savings. But I feel passionately about this. I know that there’s a receptive audience out there for books like mine – books on Israel/Palestine that seek to deepen understanding, rather than fight a war of words. To reach that audience, I need to get my book into the hands of people who are in a position to recommend it widely.

I’d like to raise $2,500. Here’s how I’d use it:

$2,000: I’d buy copies of my book at cost, and mail them with a personal letter to the people on my growing list. Your money would be spent on books, mailers, and postage. Depending on postage variables, each book will cost $22-35 to buy and ship out.

$500: I’d put this money aside for travel expenses, to accept the out-of-town invitations to speak that are coming in. If I raise over $2,500, that’s what the money will go to.

What my book's about

1948: As Jewish refugees, survivors of the Holocaust, struggle toward the new State of Israel, Arab refugees are fleeing, many under duress. Sixty years later, the memory of trauma has shaped both peoples' collective understanding of who they are.

After a war, the victors write history. How was the story of the exiled Palestinians erased -- from textbooks, maps, even the land? How do Jewish and Palestinian Israelis now engage with the histories of the Palestinian Nakba ("Catastrophe") and the Holocaust, and how do these echo through the political and physical landscapes of their country?

Vividly narrated, with extensive original interview material, Contested Land, Contested Memory examines how these tangled histories of suffering inform Jewish and Palestinian-Israeli lives today, and frame Israel's possibilities for peace.

While Contested Land, Contested Memory is grounded in scholarly research, it’s written for the general reader. The many Jewish and Palestinian Israelis I interviewed tell much of the story.

Why I wrote my book

The debate around Israel/Palestine, and much of the literature on the topic, is tremendously polarized. I have my own political perspective, having been a human rights observer in the West Bank, but what I wanted to do in this book is to convey how the memory of past trauma has shaped both people’s collective understanding of themselves and each other. This gives breathing room to the complexities of human experience, the fears and vulnerabilities of human suffering. As one of the Israelis I interviewed said to me, “We can’t communicate if we won’t acknowledge the pain the Other is feeling.”

Advance Praise

“In this moving, lyrical, and very important book, with some of the bravest and most honest of Israelis and Palestinians as guides, Roberts offers readers an intimate, often searing tour of the country’s psychological landscape.”

— Professor Ian Lustick, Bess W. Heyman chair of Political Science, University of Pennsylvania

“This compelling and compassionate book offers fresh insight into how these divergent histories reverberate in Israel today, examining how selective memories of suffering that exclude the “other” impede reconciliation and a just peace.”

— Mubarak Awad, founder, Palestinian Centre for the Study of Nonviolence

“[T]his nuanced, empathic, and knowledgeable book is an important read for supporters of [both Israelis and Palestinians], and for people seeking a book through which to enter the charged field of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.”

— Hillel Cohen, Israeli historian and journalist

“[This] beautifully written book provides an essential perspective on a topic that could not be more urgent. . . [and] captures the voices of Jewish and Palestinian Israelis in all their diversity, pain, and eloquence.”

— Professor Michael Rothberg, Director of the Holocaust, Genocide, & Memory Studies Initiative at the University of Illinois 

(You can read the full endorsements, and more about me and my book, on my website: www.joroberts.org)

[November 27th UPDATE: Embassy, Canada's foreign policy weekly, just published a glowing review: "Her writing has academic credibility and personal appeal. If that sounds unlikely, it is. Only a writer as good as Roberts could make it work—but work it does, as it proceeds to unravel Israel’s paradoxical political identity." ]

Why I need crowdfunding

I’m discovering that these days authors are expected to do the lion’s share of promoting their books. My publisher sent out some advance copies, and will send review copies to anyone who has definite plans to review the book. I’d like to be more proactive. What I want to do is to send out copies to all sorts of people who are in a position to spread the word: potential reviewers, writers in related fields, folks with a specific interest in what’s happening in Israel-Palestine.

I’ve written for a general audience, but my book would also be of interest to academics. My publisher doesn’t have academic sales reps, so effectively no promotion will be happening in that sphere. I’d like people in related academic fields to know about my book – partly, of course, to increase sales (if a few profs choose a book as recommended reading for a course, that really helps) but particularly because I want the book and its ideas to circulate as widely as possible.

Everyone’s swamped with email these days, so I don’t just want to send an email describing the book to all those people, and have it get lost in the shuffle  – I want to send a copy of the book itself.

How you can help!

  • You can help crowdfund my project!
  • You can spread the word about Contested Land, Contested Memory via email, Facebook, or Twitter!  (Contact me via the Comments section if you’d like me to send you an html email describing the book to forward to your networks.)
  • You can share this campaign with your networks!
  • If you’ve read the book, you can write a review on Amazon.com or Goodreads!

Many thanks for considering supporting me! Any help you can offer is very much appreciated.

And a special thank you to my wonderful Indiegogo Team: Franca, Tim, Jenny, and Claire, and to the awesome Julia Dogra-Brazell for contributing the pitch video.

story:
This is my sister, Tanya.  In her mid fifties, she has completed her first novel.  How she found the time to do this with a crushing teaching schedule (mixed fourth and fifth classroom this year) and three school-age children at home, I can't even imagine -- but she did!  

Her entire extended family is sincerely hoping she has produced a best seller, because we want to exist in her wake.  More importantly, though, any funds this novel brings in would be a big help to a family of five trying to live on an Albuquerque teacher's income.

Before Tanya can submit her manuscript to a publisher, however, it needs to be whipped into publishable shape -- the job of an editor.  And Tanya has found one she feels is perfect.  They've spoken several times, and have a real rapport.  This editor (Carol Gaskin -- she's legit, Google her!) has agreed to a discount price, but even that is much more than Tanya can afford.  As an editor myself, I know that $1800 for a work this size represents a very generous discount.  (However, as an editor myself, I know that editing a family member's work is risky business!)

Her natal nuclear family will try to make up any shortfall in the amount raised, but there is no one in that can invest the whole shebang, so I am appealing to the public at large to support this effort.  

Please help Tanya become a published author, and her extended family less insecure about her family's financial future!  Forward to your friends, tell your colleagues -- help start a starving professional on the path to becoming a well-fed artist!

story:
About the Book

In the spring of 2011 Laura Lane and Laurie Nersten found out that they both had 12 year old daughters, Celeste and Hayley, who were both diagnosed with Pineoblastoma, a very rare form of brain tumour. They were even both hospitalized and diagnosed within a month of each other.  These two mothers are now writing a book together. It is the story of two beautiful girls and two mothers who prayed for each other daily and the miracles they found in their two year journey together.  It is the story of friendship and inspiration, of struggles and miracles, of joy and sadness, of love and loss as they share how they supported one another as the the girls went through radiation, chemotherapy, as they watched the girls return to school and coped with relapses and ultimately the death of one of the girls. Laura was inspired to write the book and has spearheaded the project. She then asked Laurie to be her co-author.  Both mothers share the initial story of their girls, they share the relationship that developed between Laura and Laurie as they supported their daughters in hospitals 500 miles apart from each other.  Laura finishes the book by sharing and summarizing the many things they learned about facing your child’s cancer with Hope, Strength and Courage!

Laura Lane is a published children’s book author, poet, artist, gallery owner and coaches clients on how to gain clarity to live an inspired life filled with passion and purpose, not only in setting goals but how to achieve them. In the book, Laura shares how much of her back ground in personal growth and development helped her to remain positive and help her daughter through treatments and her end of life transition to her Heavenly Father.

The book is nearing completion, soon to be edited with a manuscript completion date of February 24th, the third anniversary of Celeste surgery and diagnosis and the first anniversary of Celeste’s passing, and to be published with a first release date of June 8th 2014, Celeste's 16th birthday.

Laura has been working with other New York Times bestselling authors to get this book “Two Mothers, One Prayer” into the hands of hundreds of thousands of parents around the world whose children are currently battling cancer in order to share the Hope, Strength and Courage that they found to continue to brave the journey they take with their children every day.

In order to finish the book, and the editing, publishing, marketing needed to make it available to parents worldwide, they need your support. Once they have 20,000 pre-orders of the book they will pitch the book to major publishers such as Hay House, New World Library and Simon & Schuster. From there the book will be sold and marketed online and in bookstores internationally.

What We Need & What You Get

$25,000 to cover the cost of editing, publishing, marketing, media training, websites, travel to interviews and promotional speaking engagements.

·  $5000 for editing service, coaching and training

·  $5000 media training and travel costs to interviews and speaking engagements

·  $5000 publishing costs and book coaching included cover design

·  $5000 for graphic design, website design, web hosting and marketing

·  $5000 for EPK – video promo

Rewards

During Celeste’s stay in hospital and while Ronald McDonald House became her home away from home, Laura Lane took to painting late at night as a way to relax and de-stress.  Over 3 months, she created 24 paintings inspired in part by colours chosen by both Celeste and Hayley. Those paintings later were exhibited in galleries in the Niagara Region and the painting “Waves”, named and created with colours chosen by Hayley, became Laura’s signature piece and is featured on the cover of “Two Mothers, One Prayer”.  It is Laura’s desire to share that special artwork with all those who support the campaign.

                                         

"Waves” by Laura Lane

Reach Out
$5 – Thank You – Heartfelt Appreciation Ecard of Laura’s Art


Connect
$10- Thank you card mailed – Laura’s art card

Reflect
$25- Thank you card mailed – Laura’s art card, EBook copy of “Two Mothers, One Prayer”

Express
$50- Thank you card mailed – Laura’s art card, Signed copy of the book.  6.5”x8” Signed Print of Laura’s painting “Waves” 

Love

$100- Thank you card mailed – Laura’s art card, Signed copy of the book. 8”x10” Signed Print of Laura’s painting “Waves”, Acknowledgement in the book, Complimentary coaching call with Laura

Hope
$250- Thank you card mailed – Laura’s art card, 5 Signed copies of the book. 8”x10” Signed Print of Laura’s painting “Waves”, Acknowledgement in the book,

Strength
$500 - Thank you card mailed – Laura’s art card, 5 Signed copies of the book.  Acknowledgement in the book, Original Acrylic Abstract painting created using your choice of 4 colours

Courage
$1000 - Thank you card mailed – Laura’s art card, 10 Signed copies of the book. Acknowledgement in the book, Series of 4 Original Acrylic Abstract paintings created using your choice of 4 colours, invitation for you and a guest to attend the book launch party in Niagara Falls, Canada including a personal /private tour of the Niagara Region during your visit.

Charity  
$5,000 - Thank you card mailed – Laura’s art card, 10 Signed copies of the book. Acknowledgement in the book, Series of 4 Original Acrylic Abstract paintings created using your choice of 4 colours, invitation for you and a guest to attend the book launch party in Niagara Falls, Canada including a personal /private tour of the Niagara Region during your visit. 150 copies of the book donated in your name to the Cancer Center of your choice.

Compassion
$10,000
Thank you card mailed – Laura’s art card, 10 Signed copies of the book. Acknowledgement in the book, Series of 4 Original Acrylic Abstract paintings created using your choice of 4 colours, invitation for you and a guest to attend the book launch party in Niagara Falls, Canada including a personal /private tour of the Niagara Region during your visit. 300 copies of the book donated in your name to the Children's Hospital of your choice.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people may not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Get the word out! Tweet this page or mention it on Facebook. @LauraLaneLSC and I'll happily retweet your comments! Visit the book website www.twomothersoneprayer.com Let us know what you think of the book when it launches. Want to ask us anything? Email us info@twomothersoneprayer.com Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Help Publish Radical Family! Parenting: A Guide for Parenting with Compassion, Honesty, Respect, and Unconditional Love!!!

Appreciation for Radical Family! Parenting: A Guide for Parenting with Compassion, Honesty, Respect, and Unconditional Love

 “With his light-hearted and loving approach, Jess provides the reader with a set of interconnected and effective parenting strategies. Incorporating these strategies into your parenting will absolutely, positively improve your relationship with your child.”

 ~Annette Gustafson MEd, Mom and Educator

 "Jess touches on a major governing principle in how I interact with children - they are individuals with autonomy who deserve respect. This principle applies to children that I treat professionally in addition to my own children. The ideas set forth in this book provide an easy-to-understand framework that readers can use to help improve their relationships with all children. Jess has captured the essence of a more loving and humanistic way of parenting."

 ~Bobby Ghaheri, MD, Dad and Doctor

 "We've been attachment parenting and radically unschooling for almost 11 years now and found many gems in Jess's book. It's great to have reminders of why we are parenting the way we are, and to have support and encouragement for the times when we stumble."

 ~Carolyn and Bret Winkler, Mom and Dad

 "Every time I talk with Jess, I feel that I should be writing down or recording the advice he has to offer, now I don't have to! This workbook has helped me refocus my unconditional and connected parenting goals and apply them to specific family conflicts. This type of parenting isn't easy, but Jess's book offers a simple and constructive route to more joyful relationships. Radical Family! Parenting is useful for both new and seasoned parents."

 ~Emily Luis PT, DPT, Mom and Physical Therapist

 “”Man walks down the street in that hat, people know he's not afraid of anything.” Hoban Washburne, character from the TV show "Firefly," speaking of his fellow character, the infinitely self-confident Jayne Cobb. Jess Robertson (as pictured in the “About the Author” section) is a man like that. Jess has thought deeply on this subject. He has researched broadly. He has practiced these concepts within his own family life. He has written, and rewritten, and distilled his thoughts into this lovely, logical, linear, condensed format for you, the reader, to consider and, perhaps hopefully, digest for yourself. I wish it had been available when our kids were younger!”

 ~Frank Maier, Dad

 "As a parent what I love about this book is it keeps me focused on my long term goal...maintaining the integrity of the parent-child relationship."

 ~Jenn Golik, Mom and Peer Support Specialist

 “Jess Robertson knows what he is talking about. The unique (and awesome) thing about this book is that doesn't just talk about the WHY of gentle, respectful parenting... it takes you deeply into the HOW... giving you specific tools to implement, questions to ask yourself, and practical ways to positively begin changing your family dynamic *right now.* Lovely and important book for those wanting to connect more deeply with their kids.”

 ~Jennifer McGrail, Mom and The Path Less Taken Blogger

 “Jess lovingly welcomes the reader into a world of gentle, respectful parenting. He understands that children aren't just grubs waiting to become human: they are fully formed beings who deserve way more credit than mainstream parenting books typically give them. He encourages the reader to work through personal issues to see how important the parent-child relationship actually is. Those who like a more interactive approach can work through their own stumbling blocks by answering questions at the end of each chapter. This book is a must-have on your parenting bookshelf!”

 ~Kelly Lovejoy, Mom

 "Radical Family! Parenting helps parents raise their children with love, warmth and emotional intelligence.  Jess has captured and presented in a clear and interactive style, the true essence of a successful parent/child relationship.  I will be recommending this book to the parents that I work with in my practice.  Thank you Jess."

 ~Pamela Skiver LCSW, Mom, Grandparent, and Child and Family Therapist

 "This book shines its light on what matters most in parenting and in life: nurturing our relationships. The positive, respectful, do-no-harm approaches given in these pages offer a sound philosophical foundation for parents interested in doing just that. I wholeheartedly recommend it!"

 ~Robert Bye MS, Dad and Child and Family Therapist

 “When you have a child, your life is altered beyond imagination. If you desire to think deeply about this most important role and accompany your child’s growth with your own as a parent, then this book is for you. The workbook format allows for reflection and perhaps more important, for transformation. With Jess Robertson’s book, you will see results in your family through this contemplative and experiential process.”

 ~Sarah Theberge MA, Mom, “Goongi,” and Child and Family Studies Professor

What is Radical Family! Parenting?

Radical Family! Parenting is the culmination of nearly two decades of supporting children and families. Having worked with hundreds of families and taught several conventional parenting curricula, Jess Robertson grew increasingly disheartened by the lack of compassion being shown to children. Books such as Alfie Kohn's Unconditional Parenting offered some perspectives that were helpful for supporting families but he was unable to find a parenting curriculum that personified the value of unconditional love. Discovering the world of Whole-Life Unschooling, in 2009, Jess was encouraged by the close and respectful relationships he saw between parents and children. Over the next few years Jess noticed that some families in the Unschooling community struggled to put into practice the values they held. He also believed that no matter a family's perspective on learning, values of kindness were applicable and needed by all. Thus began the two year journey of writing a guide book to support parents who were looking for help in their pursuit of having an unconditionally loving relationship with their children. 

Who is Jess?

Jess is an unconditional parenting coach and author currently residing in the Pacific Northwest of the United States. He is in a family partnership with Jenna and their three daughters. Jess likes to wear cool hats, thinks he is funny, and loves spending time with friends and family learning and growing together. As learning facilitation transportation guru for his family Jess can be seen driving all over Washington and Oregon when he isn’t writing feverishly.

Jess has been working with children and families since 1994. He has degrees in Sociology and Early Childhood Education from the University of Montana and Clark College. His master's degree is in Education from Capella University. Jess has committed his life to the study of parenting and learning to better serve his family and community as a whole.

What We Need & What You Get!

Your contribution will support a first publishing run of Radical Family! Parenting: A Guide for Parenting with Compassion, Honesty, Respect, and Unconditional Love. Jess is offering pre-orders of the book through perks that include digital and signed copies! You are also welcome to contribute without selecting a perk. All funds up to the goal of $5000 will be used for publishing related expenses. Anything above and beyond the initial goal will go toward other book related endeavors including donations of the book to community organizations and families in need, a well-designed website, and other types of marketing.  

The Impact of Your Contributions!

By contributing you are making an investment in your family as well as the lives of others. Supporting the success of Radical Family! Parenting will help provide greater accessibility of an unconditionally loving approach to parenting for all families.

Other Ways You Can Help!

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Get the word out and make some noise about Radical Family! Parenting: A Guide for Parenting with Compassion, Honesty, Respect, and Unconditional Love!

story:
I think it’s important to say a word or two about why I wrote this book. And who the book is for. Many people will look at it and think that it fits in a specific category . . . or that it doesn’t fit into any. And I guess they would all be right.

This book is not necessarily just for teenagers, although it is about a teenager and takes place during his early high school years. By the same token, it is not intended just for adults, although the time period will bring back many fond memories for those of the older set. This book is not just for gay or questioning teens, or just for teens who self-identify as straight, either. The themes are mature, but there is nothing gratuitous or salacious in it.

I wrote this story as a story for almost anyone.

I intended it to be read by parents and their children, by people of any sexual orientation and by anyone who has been bullied or who has bullied or who remembers what a terrible and wonderful time high school can be. I would like this to be a story that will start a conversation, or maybe a whole lot of conversations, among people who may believe that they have nothing in common. And maybe after these conversations, the reader might find her or himself a little closer to someone they previously thought was completely foreign to her or him.

Most of all, I would like this to be a story that offers hope. 

 

Here's a brief synopsis of the story:

Thirteen-year-old Charles Siskin is not like other boys. Set apart from everyone by his odd disposition and what his schoolmates see as a distinctly feminine way of speaking and walking, he has become an outcast. He talks his parents into letting him attend St. Ignatius Loyola High School, an all boys, military private school. And when he auditions for the spring play, he sets a series of events into motion that lead to a crushing and humiliating catastrophe.

 

The need for this campaign:

To be able to get the story of Charles Siskin out there, we still have some financial hurdles to jump. While I've been able to take care of many of the costs myself, creating a book like this and getting this important story out there simply takes a lot. The funds raised during this campaign will cover expenses including art, design, self-publishing (digital and print), website creation and marketing.

story:
Who is Rachel Karu?

  • I am a Recovering Perfectionist who is a professional coach, speaker, and singer. My perfectionism stopped me from performing for over 20 years.
  • I have embraced my courageous creativity by stepping back into performing and integrating music into my speaking and training engagements.
  • I am inspiring people to grapple with perfectionism and step into their vulnerability by publishing a book, creating an accompanying CD, and producing a one person show where I sing as I share my story!

What We Need & What's in it for YOU!

  • As a coach, I am a big believer in asking for what we need. I am seeking support to help with costs to publish and promote my book, produce a CD and show.

  • Perks include, autographed books, Kindle versions of the book, copies of the CD, and complimentary professional and personal development coaching and training sessions! 

  • I will use whatever funds are donated towards the three projects even if I don't reach my goal.

The Impact

  • My message is inspiring and entertaining!
  • I regularly speak and coach and am gratified by the continual affirming feedback I receive from participants. People share how my message inspires them to live the life they desire and deserve. They also throroughly enjoy my singing.
  • My unique approach of integrating music into my work engages and entertains!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are not able to contribute at this time you can still help by sharing my campaign.

    Post it to your facebook wall. Share it with people you know, colleagues, friends and family. Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update.  Click on the Facebook or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks. 

    *All perks can be gifted and therefore are transferable.

story:
About the Book

When her dreams start to suddenly, terrifyingly come true, Maggie Stuart realizes her life is something far from ordinary. Fortunately, Maggie is anything but an ordinary 13-year old girl.

First, her estranged father shows up out of the blue with a mysterious young man who shows an unnatural interest in Maggie. Then, she’s torn from home, school, and family and thrown into the middle of an ancient struggle between Char, a being of almost limitless power, and his terrifying children.

Will Maggie be pawn, or player? Will she escape from Char’s clutches, or be transformed? And above all, can she find a way to overcome her greatest fear — of what she herself is becoming?

I'm raising money to launch a comprehensive publicity campaign to promote, distribute, and otherwise introduce Maggie to the world. Besides, I can't wait to write the sequels!
 
THE LAST RITE is published by Wildcard Pictures Productions and Lulu.com. It's 338 pages long, which makes it somewhere around 147,000 words. This beautiful new edition is a trade paperback and features new cover art, illustrations and a schematic of Maggie's school inside, and what I believe is some of the best writing I've ever done.
 
I wrote THE LAST RITE to fulfill a very basic desire: to put down on paper the kind of book I loved to read when I was a kid and still go back to year after year as an adult. I can't get enough of adventures stories that mix reality and hyper- or supernormal realities, that make ordinary (or slightly extraordinary) people face their fears, their weaknesses, and their baggage and just HAVE to step up to win.
 
I have big plans for little Maggie Stuart. The sequel to this novel is called THE RED RING and it's almost ready to go once THE LAST RITE is properly launched. And I have two more books planned which will actually take Maggie from her baby steps at 13 through high school, into young adulthood, finally emerging as a fully grown woman in the final story.

What We Need

Here's how we've structured the marketing campaign:

  • Targeted Ads
  • Email campaign
  • Wholesale book purchases for resale & local stores
  • Local, national, and world-wide media campaign
  • Bookstore tour for readings and signings
  • Fan con presence for direct sales to our best audience

If we raise 50% of the funds, our priorities are:

  • attend conventions and market directly to fans
  • increase social media presence for the book, the characters, and Jen
  • a smaller number of targeted ads

If we raise 33% of the funds, we will:

  • again lower the number of targeted ads, and
  • begin another campaign, but ONLY when we believe interest has increased enough for the goal to be met entirely

This way, we'll use whatever you donate to make sure that we are constantly building awareness and an audience, and that the donations will be used in the most effective way.

What You'll Get

I want the perks for you to be as personal and meaningful as the Maggie series is to me. Every book that you order directly from me will come signed, and personalized if you like. You'll also get a personalized thank you card from me featuring one of the original drawings from THE LAST RITE. For donations of $100 or more, you'll get a card with a drawing from the NEXT book, THE RED RING, as an extra special thanks.

The Bigger Picture

Although I can't say I ever write something just because it will sell, I also believe absolutely in writing something that will satisfy readers at the most elemental level. This means writing from the heart, and always learning more about humanity, psychology, storytelling, and the mechanics of being an author. There's a lot of passion that goes into what I write, but there's just as much a sense that I'm working my craft.

Here's why I love Maggie Stuart, the character and the series:

  • Maggie enters her adventures as barely a teenager, and is as unready for the challenges she confronts as any of us would be. Uniquely though, it's her flaws that provide her with the strength she needs to survive and ultimately triumph as much as her own positive attributes.
  • As she grows, Maggie faces real life problems in greater numbers than her occult issues. Not ever kid has a great upbringing, or all the advantages money or love can provide. When Maggie develops difficulties trying to succeed despite her advantages, I think readers will empathize, and see their own struggles reflected in her.
  • It's not easy to be different, and Maggie has to cope with that as well as the secrets she carries. Her journey to a fulfilled life is a long and often dark one, but it's going to be rewarding AND a lot of fun along the way.

One of the reasons I haven't pursued a traditional publisher with this novel is maybe an ironic one: the very thing I think makes THE LAST RITE unique and valuable is the same thing that has made publishers say no. It's hard for a publisher to market a book with a young adult protagonist that is written, essentially, to appeal to both kids AND adults.

But if you love the same kind of books I do, you know that adults not only re-read the books they loved as kids, they also love to read well-written YA books. I want to bridge the gap in our thinking -- sometimes, a book can have as much appeal to a smart 13 year old as to a grown-up who still loves fantasy, sci fi, and horror.

The biggest reason I started writing is for the love of stories. I write the kind of books I want to read, and I think you will love Maggie as much as I do!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even a dollar can help! But if you'd like to help in some other way:

  • Click "LIKE " on my Facebook page
  • Follow me on Twitter and RT and reply! I love to interact with other users
  • Share on Indigogo
  • Order a book and pass it on, or donate it to your local library
  • Write a review on Amazon or Lulu

Who You'll Meet - The Characters

Maggie Stuart

Maggie is 13 when we meet her, a bit of an oddball at school. Her mom has recently started dating again, which is something Maggie finds strangely disturbing. Her dad isn't in the picture - he ran away with her when Maggie was still a baby and it took Interpol and a long court process to get her back to Canada and her mother. Maggie's favorite teacher at Westbrook Elementary School is Mr. Hunt.

Mr. Hunt

Hunt is the kind of teacher you like and fear in just about equal measure. He's strict, but fair. He's also kind of unpredictable - and Maggie thinks he may have more than his share of a sadistic streak. He's also in Westbrook for reasons that have absolutely nothing to do with teaching.

Jason Lawson

Maggie's hopeless first crush. Jason is everything Maggie isn't - outgoing, athletic, and popular. But they have more in common than either might think, and their worlds collide after Jason accidentally spies on some very bizarre activities happening inside Mr. Hunt's room.

Arabella

Aria seems to be a girl of about sixteen, but you don't have to know her very long to know that impression barely scratches the surface of the truth. She's brutal, and arrogant, and fearless. She's also heir to an underground kingdom of enormous scope and she'll do anything to secure her future throne.

Damon

Arabella's older brother, but he has been passed over in the succession. He may even take the whole power struggle less seriously than she does, but that hardly means he can avoid the fallout of an ancient battle for supremacy which is only now coming to a head.

John Tamblyn

In disgrace after an infamous investigation in Vancouver, Tamblyn works for the Toronto Metro Police in a mysterious capacity. Part pariah, part savant, he is only called in to take charge in cases that defy conventional explanation. What happens at Westbrook Elementary will put him face to face with a past he thought he'd finally escaped.

Carla Szaba

A constable with the Toronto Metro Police, Carla has kept a close and surreptitious eye on John Tamblyn since he was hired. She doesn't like what she sees, and she's determined to find out what he really is and who he answers to.

Jan Stuart

Maggie's mom, a single mother since her relationship with Maggie's dad Nick Marino blew up in her face. Slow to trust, she feels out of her depth with a teenage daughter, especially one as private and troubled as Maggie. But when Maggie vanishes, she realizes there is nothing she won't do to bring her back.

Nikolas Marino

Maggie's long-estranged dad. Even he's not sure why he's returned after all these years to rekindle a relationship with his daughter. Maybe that's because it wasn't entirely his own idea.

Char

A being of immense power and influence. Char makes and unmakes kings, politicians, and potentates. He rules a shadowy underground kingdom that exists just below our own. Still mourning the loss of his wife after centuries, he allows his children Arabella and Damon to run wild and battle for his attention and affection. His own occult powers have been on the wane for a long time - but that was before he discovered the existence of a very special and gifted young girl: Maggie Stuart.

The Plan

THE LAST RITE is ready for release as a trade paperback (6"x9") with beautiful full color covers and black and white interior illustrations. It will also be available as a multi-platform e-book.

The sequel to THE LAST RITE is in the final stages of editing and will be available for release in early 2013. It's called THE RED RING and jumps forward in Maggie's history three years. Now, she's in high school and dealing with both the very tough pressures of adolescence and the burden of her memories of the events of the previous adventure.

In book three, HEAVEN AND HELL, Maggie is 23 and struggling with addition, depression, and a feeling of purposelessness. But everything changes when Hunt re-enters her life and she rediscovers magic in an unexpected and unnerving way.

When we meet Maggie again at age 35 in THE MAD MONK, she's ready for a final showdown with Hunt. Coming into her own both as a woman and a magician, she thinks she can at last take on both her former mentor and her past. But that's before Hunt finds a way to completely blindside her...

The Campaign

As the campaign timeline progresses, I will be posting extras about the writing of the book, the development of the story and characters, little tidbits about the sequels, and some inside information on what DIDN'T make the cut to the final edition. I'll also be posting sketches and character concepts, and some encouragement to other writers who are involved in this amazing process of writing and selling a novel.

 

I can't wait to bring these stories to you! Thank you so much for your help in launching Maggie Stuart to the world!
story_txt:
About the Book

When her dreams start to suddenly, terrifyingly come true, Maggie Stuart realizes her life is something far from ordinary. Fortunately, Maggie is anything but an ordinary 13-year old girl.

First, her estranged father shows up out of the blue with a mysterious young man who shows an unnatural interest in Maggie. Then, she’s torn from home, school, and family and thrown into the middle of an ancient struggle between Char, a being of almost limitless power, and his terrifying children.Will Maggie be pawn, or player? Will she escape from Char’s clutches, or be transformed? And above all, can she find a way to overcome her greatest fear — of what she herself is becoming?


I'm raising money to launch a comprehensive publicity campaign to promote, distribute, and otherwise introduce Maggie to the world. Besides, I can't wait to write the sequels!
 
THE LAST RITE is published by Wildcard Pictures Productions and Lulu.com. It's 338 pages long, which makes it somewhere around 147,000 words. This beautiful new edition is a trade paperback and features new cover art, illustrations and a schematic of Maggie's school inside, and what I believe is some of the best writing I've ever done.
 
I wrote THE LAST RITE to fulfill a very basic desire: to put down on paper the kind of book I loved to read when I was a kid and still go back to year after year as an adult. I can't get enough of adventures stories that mix reality and hyper- or supernormal realities, that make ordinary (or slightly extraordinary) people face their fears, their weaknesses, and their baggage and just HAVE to step up to win.
 
I have big plans for little Maggie Stuart. The sequel to this novel is called THE RED RING and it's almost ready to go once THE LAST RITE is properly launched. And I have two more books planned which will actually take Maggie from her baby steps at 13 through high school, into young adulthood, finally emerging as a fully grown woman in the final story.

What We Need
Here's how we've structured the marketing campaign:

Targeted Ads
Email campaign
Wholesale book purchases for resale & local stores
Local, national, and world-wide media campaign
Bookstore tour for readings and signings
Fan con presence for direct sales to our best audience

If we raise 50% of the funds, our priorities are:

attend conventions and market directly to fans
increase social media presence for the book, the characters, and Jen
a smaller number of targeted ads

If we raise 33% of the funds, we will:

again lower the number of targeted ads, and
begin another campaign, but ONLY when we believe interest has increased enough for the goal to be met entirely

This way, we'll use whatever you donate to make sure that we are constantly building awareness and an audience, and that the donations will be used in the most effective way.
What You'll Get
I want the perks for you to be as personal and meaningful as the Maggie series is to me. Every book that you order directly from me will come signed, and personalized if you like. You'll also get a personalized thank you card from me featuring one of the original drawings from THE LAST RITE. For donations of $100 or more, you'll get a card with a drawing from the NEXT book, THE RED RING, as an extra special thanks.



The Bigger Picture
Although I can't say I ever write something just because it will sell, I also believe absolutely in writing something that will satisfy readers at the most elemental level. This means writing from the heart, and always learning more about humanity, psychology, storytelling, and the mechanics of being an author. There's a lot of passion that goes into what I write, but there's just as much a sense that I'm working my craft.
Here's why I love Maggie Stuart, the character and the series:

Maggie enters her adventures as barely a teenager, and is as unready for the challenges she confronts as any of us would be. Uniquely though, it's her flaws that provide her with the strength she needs to survive and ultimately triumph as much as her own positive attributes.
As she grows, Maggie faces real life problems in greater numbers than her occult issues. Not ever kid has a great upbringing, or all the advantages money or love can provide. When Maggie develops difficulties trying to succeed despite her advantages, I think readers will empathize, and see their own struggles reflected in her.
It's not easy to be different, and Maggie has to cope with that as well as the secrets she carries. Her journey to a fulfilled life is a long and often dark one, but it's going to be rewarding AND a lot of fun along the way.

One of the reasons I haven't pursued a traditional publisher with this novel is maybe an ironic one: the very thing I think makes THE LAST RITE unique and valuable is the same thing that has made publishers say no. It's hard for a publisher to market a book with a young adult protagonist that is written, essentially, to appeal to both kids AND adults.
But if you love the same kind of books I do, you know that adults not only re-read the books they loved as kids, they also love to read well-written YA books. I want to bridge the gap in our thinking -- sometimes, a book can have as much appeal to a smart 13 year old as to a grown-up who still loves fantasy, sci fi, and horror.
The biggest reason I started writing is for the love of stories. I write the kind of books I want to read, and I think you will love Maggie as much as I do!

Other Ways You Can Help
Even a dollar can help! But if you'd like to help in some other way:

Click "LIKE " on my Facebook page
Follow me on Twitter and RT and reply! I love to interact with other users
Share on Indigogo
Order a book and pass it on, or donate it to your local library
Write a review on Amazon or Lulu

Who You'll Meet - The Characters
Maggie Stuart
Maggie is 13 when we meet her, a bit of an oddball at school. Her mom has recently started dating again, which is something Maggie finds strangely disturbing. Her dad isn't in the picture - he ran away with her when Maggie was still a baby and it took Interpol and a long court process to get her back to Canada and her mother. Maggie's favorite teacher at Westbrook Elementary School is Mr. Hunt.
Mr. Hunt
Hunt is the kind of teacher you like and fear in just about equal measure. He's strict, but fair. He's also kind of unpredictable - and Maggie thinks he may have more than his share of a sadistic streak. He's also in Westbrook for reasons that have absolutely nothing to do with teaching.
Jason Lawson
Maggie's hopeless first crush. Jason is everything Maggie isn't - outgoing, athletic, and popular. But they have more in common than either might think, and their worlds collide after Jason accidentally spies on some very bizarre activities happening inside Mr. Hunt's room.
Arabella
Aria seems to be a girl of about sixteen, but you don't have to know her very long to know that impression barely scratches the surface of the truth. She's brutal, and arrogant, and fearless. She's also heir to an underground kingdom of enormous scope and she'll do anything to secure her future throne.
Damon
Arabella's older brother, but he has been passed over in the succession. He may even take the whole power struggle less seriously than she does, but that hardly means he can avoid the fallout of an ancient battle for supremacy which is only now coming to a head.
John Tamblyn
In disgrace after an infamous investigation in Vancouver, Tamblyn works for the Toronto Metro Police in a mysterious capacity. Part pariah, part savant, he is only called in to take charge in cases that defy conventional explanation. What happens at Westbrook Elementary will put him face to face with a past he thought he'd finally escaped.
Carla Szaba
A constable with the Toronto Metro Police, Carla has kept a close and surreptitious eye on John Tamblyn since he was hired. She doesn't like what she sees, and she's determined to find out what he really is and who he answers to.
Jan Stuart
Maggie's mom, a single mother since her relationship with Maggie's dad Nick Marino blew up in her face. Slow to trust, she feels out of her depth with a teenage daughter, especially one as private and troubled as Maggie. But when Maggie vanishes, she realizes there is nothing she won't do to bring her back.
Nikolas Marino
Maggie's long-estranged dad. Even he's not sure why he's returned after all these years to rekindle a relationship with his daughter. Maybe that's because it wasn't entirely his own idea.
Char
A being of immense power and influence. Char makes and unmakes kings, politicians, and potentates. He rules a shadowy underground kingdom that exists just below our own. Still mourning the loss of his wife after centuries, he allows his children Arabella and Damon to run wild and battle for his attention and affection. His own occult powers have been on the wane for a long time - but that was before he discovered the existence of a very special and gifted young girl: Maggie Stuart.
The Plan
THE LAST RITE is ready for release as a trade paperback (6"x9") with beautiful full color covers and black and white interior illustrations. It will also be available as a multi-platform e-book.
The sequel to THE LAST RITE is in the final stages of editing and will be available for release in early 2013. It's called THE RED RING and jumps forward in Maggie's history three years. Now, she's in high school and dealing with both the very tough pressures of adolescence and the burden of her memories of the events of the previous adventure.
In book three, HEAVEN AND HELL, Maggie is 23 and struggling with addition, depression, and a feeling of purposelessness. But everything changes when Hunt re-enters her life and she rediscovers magic in an unexpected and unnerving way.
When we meet Maggie again at age 35 in THE MAD MONK, she's ready for a final showdown with Hunt. Coming into her own both as a woman and a magician, she thinks she can at last take on both her former mentor and her past. But that's before Hunt finds a way to completely blindside her...
The Campaign
As the campaign timeline progresses, I will be posting extras about the writing of the book, the development of the story and characters, little tidbits about the sequels, and some inside information on what DIDN'T make the cut to the final edition. I'll also be posting sketches and character concepts, and some encouragement to other writers who are involved in this amazing process of writing and selling a novel.
 
I can't wait to bring these stories to you! Thank you so much for your help in launching Maggie Stuart to the world!

Worthy of Wonderful(TM)-Book, Workshops, and Online Classes Copyright 2013

In 1993 I wrote a song entitled “I Am Worthy of Love”, inspired by her own challenging experiences of self worth. After recording and releasing the song, I began to travel as an inspirational singer, speaker and songwriter. I have performed this song for thousands of people across the county and around the world. Before each performance of the song I have the audience loudly decree “I am worthy, not because of what I know, not because of what I do, it’s simply because I am, I am, and so therefore I am worthy”. 

Now I have written the book inspirired by that song. The book is entitled Worthy of Wonderful. The book:

  • Places worthiness in a combined context of Relationships, Career, Finances, and Wellness.
  • Is embedded with a process enableing the reader to incorporate the information provided in each chapter and;
  • Includes original inspirational music that corresponds with each chapter.

Excerpt from Worthy of Wonderful:

"Clarifying Worthiness-The terms self-worth and self-esteem are frequently used interchangeably. But they are not the same. The Webster’s dictionary defines self-esteem as a feeling of pride in oneself. Self-worth is defined as the quality of being worthy of esteem or respect.... A person may have high self-esteem based on what they know, possess or how they look, but struggle endlessly to live up to their perceived potential because they lack a strong foundation of self-worth....When you embrace your self-worth, you know you are sufficient – you are okay as you are, even during times when you feel low and discouraged. And conversely, when you have the world by the tail, your success is at hand and everything you touch turns to gold..."

Worthy of Wonderful is more than a book

More than a book, Worthy of Wonderful is platform supporting workshops and online classes. Like the book, the workshops and classes are designed to uplift, enlighten, and inform audieneces on ways to improve overall well'being.

The workshops:

  • Combines physical activity with life coaching activity.
  • Combines positive music with video imagery.

The online classes:

  • Combines the positive music/video imagery with online curriculum.

Worthy of your support

I am asking for $4,400.00 in funding that will be allocated as follows:

Workshops and Classes  
Equipment (Video/LCD Projector)  $      900.00
Website(Development/Optmization)  $   1,000.00
Total  $   1,900.00
Book  
Self-Publishing(ISBN/Amazon)  $      500.00
Self-Publishing(100 copies hard copies)  $      550.00
Logo and Graphic Design  $      350.00
Total  $   1,400.00
Marketing and Advertising  
Online ads, Brochures $   1,100.00
Grand Total  $   4,400.00

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also assist this project by:

  1. Sharing this link through your social media outlets.
  2. Offering your marketing and advertsing services on an in-kind basis.

In Closing

Many people live a life unfulfilled because they see themselves unworthy to have the life experience they desire. My desire is to help people see themselves as worthy of having a life that is joyful, blissful and authentially WONDERFUL!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT

Bukeka

story:
ABOUT ME: Christina Lovin is the author of What We Burned for Warmth and Little Fires. A two-time Pushcart nominee and multi-award winner, Lovin’s writing has appeared in numerous journals and anthologies. The Society for Humanistic Anthropology chose her heroic crown sonnet, “Myth Information,” recipient of the 2009 Ethnographic Poetry Award. The Southern Women Writers’ Conference awarded Lovin the 2007 Emerging Poet Award. Her poetry has been named finalist for the 2006, 2007, 2008, and 2009 Rita Dove International Poetry Award and the 7th Juried Reading at the Poetry Center of Chicago. She has received the Judson Jerome Scholarship from Antioch Writers’ Workshop, the Baron Wormser Scholarship for Stone Coast Writers’ Conference, and most recently was awarded the 2008 AWP WC&C Poetry Scholarship. Lovin has served as Writer-in-Residence at Devil’s Tower National Monument and the H.J. Andrews Experimental Forest in Central Oregon. She has been a resident fellow at Hopscotch House, Prairie Center of the Arts, Virginia Center for the Creative Arts, Vermont Studio Center, and Footpaths House in the Azores. Her work has been generously supported on several occasions with grants from the Elizabeth George Foundation, the Kentucky Foundation for Women and the Kentucky Arts Council, including the 2007 Al Smith Fellowship. She lives with four dogs in centreal Kentucky, where she is currently a lecturer in the English Department at Eastern Kentucky University.

 

Christina has been chosen to lead a writing group at the 2011 AROHO (A Room of Her Own) Retreat at Ghost Ranch in New Mexico, August 8-14. Although half the registration fee has been waived for group leaders and presenters, lodging at the retreat, as well as transporation to and at the retreat remain as direct costs.

 

 

The IMPACT: Having come to literary writing rather late in life, I feel I have a lot to contribute to a group of women over fifty. When I was fifty-one, I decided to take my writing seriously. That summer, I enrolled in Harvard University's summer writing program. I returned the next summer for more writing sessions. As a result of those two summers, I was encouraged to go for a Master of Fine Arts degree in Creative Writing. Now at sixty-two, I have completed that MFA and have spent the last seven years teaching writing at the college level, as well as presenting workshops at various venues around the U.S. I belive it's never too late to begin one's life work. I am a prime example of that idea. Leading a group of older women as we explore what "women of a certain age" have learned about life can inform and enrich our writing is an exciting prospect for me. Having time to converse and commune with nearly a hundred other women writers and artists in such an enchanted place (Ghost Ranch was the summer home of the artist Georgie O'Keefe) will be an added delight for this old girl.

 

WHAT I NEED:  The registration for the week-long retreat is $294 for presenters. Room & Board is just over $500. Travel has not yet been scheduled, but preliminary searches have shown that travel will be around $500 as well. Factor in a couple hundred dollars for incidentals and the total for the retreat will be around $1500. I will still be attending the retreat even if my goal is not made. It will just be a financial burden, as summers are when my income drops to about half of that during the academic year.

 

WHAT YOU GET: 

 

 

The satisfaction of helping promote the arts--poetry and writing in particular.

 

 

 

In addition, if you choose, I will provide the following:

 

 

 

$10 donations get my chapbook What We Burned for Warmth, which includes the multi-award winning sonnet crown, "Coal Country."

 

$25 donations get What We Burned for Warmth, along with Little Fires, my chapbook of poems about rural living under the shadow of war.

 

$50 donations get both chapbooks and critique of up to five poems or 2000 words of prose.

 

$100 donations get both chapbooks and critique of up to ten poems or 4000 words of prose.

 

Donations of $200 or more get both chapbooks and critique of a book-length poetry manuscript or up to 20,000 words of prose (one piece or several).

 

Gifts can be claimed after August 15, 2011.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:  Let your friends know that a poet needs a push! Your moral support is as important and desired as your monetary support. Check out my Facebook page and my website. Buy my chapbooks from Finishing Line Press.
