story:
What is The Recital?

"Just think what it would be like if we all could imagine like when we were little kids."

In the brooding of her parents' divorce, Edith Madeline Solstice, a naive seventh grader, discovers she's a witch when a fight with her rival Julie turns magical and almost fatal. Edith nearly kills Julie with magic.

Her best friend Lenore, who Edith learns is also a witch, helps her to cover it up. They may not be able to keep secrets for long. Edith wants to set things straight, but that comes at a price.

The Recital is a story about a girl afraid to grow up. As her thirteenth birthday looms, right and wrong begin to blur. Secrets she wished she didn't have to keep pile in her head. She seeks contrition by working the ways of her new supernatural talents, but she's not sure that everything will work out fine. 

It's tough trying to balance that with maintaining straight A's (especially with Pre-Algebra in the way), the pursuit of her first kiss from an unrequited love, and keeping fingers crossed for a long-awaited growth spurt.

And she's got a piano recital coming up. Sheesh.



Who is Kyle V. Hiller?

Just some dude from West Philly who wrote a book.

I'm a proud native from West Philadelphia. I've been writing since I was a shorty in Kindergarten. Hyperrealism is my jam. And I like the absurd: fantasy seems a lot more real to me than reality most of the time. Alice's Adventures in Wonderland was kind of a big deal for me. I don't care if admitting that makes me basic. I'm a "new writer," so I don't think I can list a bunch of awards and accolades. I haven't been all over the world. But I come from a place where passion runs deep and allows you to see things in unique ways. 


Where Are Contributions Going?

“This book ain’t free!"

The cost of writing a book adds up. There's professional editing and illustrating, ISBNs and printing fees, copyrights and marketing, and...

...Okay, that's the boring stuff. This campaign isn't about recouping funds. It's about investing in the future. And I want you to be part of it.

Everyone who contributes will receive a discount on all future independently published works from me. This means that your contribution is not merely a donation, but an investment that pays in the long run. And I'm in it for the long run.



Other Ways to Help

Sharing is caring, too.

There's other ways to support the cause. Share with your friends and family, especially the ones who like to read. Post on social media (especially Facebook and Twitter). And also, sign up for my newsletter!


If you sign up for my newsletter, you'll be the first to find out about news (obviously), contests and giveaways, and other cool stuff. Don't worry, I send an issue out only every 1-2 months.


Be sure to use the hashtag #TheRecital2016 in all your social media shares!


Beyond the Book

Why is The Recital important to you and the rest of the world?

It's time to take independent authors seriously. I'm not the Messiah for self-publishing, but I do want to hold hands with all the other writers like me and move forward together. Publishing is changing. Writing is changing. Art is changing. We all are changing.

The Recital is a real, raw story of what it’s like to be twelve going on thirteen. As a black author, I’d like to send a message to the young diverse artists out there and encourage them to express themselves honestly without compromise. As a person raised in a low-income, single-parent home, I’d hope to send ripples of hope back to the neighborhood I grew up in, and whatever other places like it that I can extend my reach to.

The Recital taps into some sensitive themes like bullying, homosexuality, familial conflict, and drug use—all of which are real and confusing things for our budding young adults. 

Edith does so with bravery but she is flawed, thrust into the world of adolescence—a murky place that defines and then twists our fibers into knots for the rest of our lives. 

The Recital is honest: these things do happen to our preteens. It happened to us. Edith is here to help us understand it better through her journey as a seventh grade witch.


The Perks of Being A Wallflower

Simply Crafty is a small business with some nifty crafts and gifts. I'm excited to be partnering up to give you some exclusive gear for The Recital. The perks won't be available for sale beyond the campaign. Get your hands on some stuff and be one of the cool kids!

Please note that all contributions that have physical perks will incur a $2 shipping fee. 


~
Thank you, no matter if you're contributing, sharing, or just visiting! I hope you'll be reading The Recital soon!

Everyone who contributes will receive a discount on all future independently published works from me. This means that your contribution is not merely a donation, but an investment that pays in the long run. And I'm in it for the long run.





Other Ways to Help

Sharing is caring, too.
There's other ways to support the cause. Share with your friends and family, especially the ones who like to read. Post on social media (especially Facebook and Twitter). And also, sign up for my newsletter!
If you sign up for my newsletter, you'll be the first to find out about news (obviously), contests and giveaways, and other cool stuff. Don't worry, I send an issue out only every 1-2 months.
Be sure to use the hashtag #TheRecital2016 in all your social media shares!

Beyond the Book
Why is The Recital important to you and the rest of the world?
It's time to take independent authors seriously. I'm not the Messiah for self-publishing, but I do want to hold hands with all the other writers like me and move forward together. Publishing is changing. Writing is changing. Art is changing. We all are changing.
The Recital is a real, raw story of what it’s like to be twelve going on thirteen. As a black author, I’d like to send a message to the young diverse artists out there and encourage them to express themselves honestly without compromise. As a person raised in a low-income, single-parent home, I’d hope to send ripples of hope back to the neighborhood I grew up in, and whatever other places like it that I can extend my reach to.
The Recital taps into some sensitive themes like bullying, homosexuality, familial conflict, and drug use—all of which are real and confusing things for our budding young adults. 
Edith does so with bravery but she is flawed, thrust into the world of adolescence—a murky place that defines and then twists our fibers into knots for the rest of our lives. 
The Recital is honest: these things do happen to our preteens. It happened to us. Edith is here to help us understand it better through her journey as a seventh grade witch.

The Perks of Being A Wallflower




Simply Crafty is a small business with some nifty crafts and gifts. I'm excited to be partnering up to give you some exclusive gear for The Recital. The perks won't be available for sale beyond the campaign. Get your hands on some stuff and be one of the cool kids!
Please note that all contributions that have physical perks will incur a $2 shipping fee. 




~
Thank you, no matter if you're contributing, sharing, or just visiting! I hope you'll be reading The Recital soon!

story: .

Good evening.

“In short, it’s a story of friendship and plasma rifles, with the emphasis on the friendship. The characters are well-written, the XCOM setting is fleshed out very well, and the story is compelling. If you love XCOM, you’ll love the story, but even if you’ve never heard of it, it’s more than worth giving the first 3 chapters a read.

“There’s excellent action later on, but the real strength lies in the collision between the friendly and naïve world of Twilight Sparkle and the desperate world of humans fighting a losing war for survival and willing to do anything to turn the tide.”

—Fimfiction

“Rating: SURPRISINGLY GOOD.”

—/r/Xcom

Short Summary

[Note: Knowledge of either setting is not required to enjoy the story.]

The book will be leather-bound (Synt3 Nebraska B236), with cover elements embossed on it in silver. It clocks in at 580 pages, set on 60x90 1/16 (220x150 mm) 80g paper. It will be shipped with a dust cover emblazoned with full-scale artwork commissioned exclusively for the project.

 

The book has been manually proofread and typeset with TeX prior to publication, assuring top-notch quality and satisfaction of values, as confirmed by the participants of previous print runs.

The Bonus Pack includes two additional books, produced for experimentation and research purposes: Hello, Sedna/Bon Bon Bon Bon Bon Bon, by SS&E. They will feature 12 illustrations, made by DiscordTheGE and FoxInShadow respectively, and will be printed on 130g glossy paper.

(Images shown are preliminary sketches)

What We Need & What You Get

By contributing according the perks on the right, you'll get the books you want to get. Everything is already included: shipping, handling, and extra care.

Risks & Challenges

I live in Russia. We love books here, and that's why I've started this in first place. But, as Russia is currently not at best terms with the rest of the world, a lot of organization-related things have been very hard to make right. Right now, I hope that we'll be able to make it. Don't worry, there will be no issues with shipping.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want the book yourself, maybe you know someone else who does! Please share information about this campaign with anyone who will love a great read and a fancy piece of community memorabilia. Together, we will accomplish anything.

And that's all there is to it. If you have questions that haven't been answered here, I can be found on Discord: https://discord.gg/Dg8Jpht

 

(Confused? Learn about the community at https://whatisabrony.com/)

story:
Short Summary

I have been working with children for over ten years, and ever since my first day a passion has continued to stir in my heart to nurture, encourage, and challenge children to grow in the Lord. 

For the entirety of my elementary education I was homeschooled and grew to deeply appreciate the value of a parent's interaction with their children, and this book is designed to encourage that interaction. 

I received my degree in Film from Western Kentucky University, where I learned and honed my skills of storytelling. It has been a great passion of mine to create art, as well as encourage young people. 

Tuck Tuck's Tales is a way for me to accomplish both. Children are never more easily influenced than during their first several years and it is so important to nurture them with wholesome and rich entertainment that doesn't numb their spirit but encourages it. 

By participating in this campaign, you are stepping forward to nurture young minds and broaden imaginations in a way that is God honoring. 

Tuck Tuck's Tales: The Great White Horse is merely the beginning...

What We Need & What You Get

For this book I am looking to raise $4,000. The majority of this money will go to pay for the rest of the illustrations, which are being masterfully crafted by Miss Niamh Sinclair of the U.K.  

Other expenses will include purchasing the book's ISBN #, and legal fees such as finalizing the trademark. I have already invested a good deal of my own funds over the 10 years, but am unable to clear the remaining hurdle alone. Every dollar given will be met with massive appreciation and gratitude. 

We are offering some great perks in exchange for your generosity! These perks will include digital character sheets, where you can see the character designs Miss Sinclair crafted in bringing these characters to life! 

Other perks include signed copies of the book for yourself as well as copies donated to various schools, libraries and charitable organizations! This book is meant to be in the hands of children, regardless of social status or financial capability and your gift can make that happen! 

Finally, we are offering a limited run of illustration posters! You can have your very own poster of one of the beautiful illustrations completed by Niamh Sinclair. 

In the event we do not reach our goal here, the funds we do raise will be used entirely on illustration work. Children respond well to visual elements such as illustrations, making those the highest priority at this juncture. 

I hope you will considering partnering with this project financially. Every dollar is one step closer to this story being in the hands of the children it can impact. 

The Impact

We live in a world where technology reigns. Where the tablets and tv screens are rapidly replacing more traditional means of both entertainment and education. While I have no issues with technology (I received a degree in Film) I do believe there is great benefit in the breaking open of a good book, to turn the pages and let the story unfold before you. This book is an effort to preserve this medium and create a book of lasting impact for generations to come. 

Children are smart, and will very often rise to the challenges we set before them. This book attempts to provide children with a mental challenge, encouraging them to rise up and tackle slightly more difficult words, sentence structures, and plots. 

At no time in a person's life are they more easily influenced than in the early years of their childhood. This means that what we give our children in terms of entertainment is of the utmost importance. I have dedicated myself to creating uplifting and rich media that will have a positive impact on the children who read it. Tuck Tuck's Tales: The Great White Horse is only the first of what I hope to be many books that will enrich the spirits of kids everywhere and glorify the Lord who made them. 

But I'm going to need your help in order to make that happen...

Risks & Challenges

As with any art form, there are some obstacles in the way!

Getting the word out concerning this project will be one of our largest hurdles. In utilizing the independent publishing route, every voice we have to raise awareness of the book is a huge help! 

Of course, this presents the inherent risk that not enough awareness will be raised, thus having a negative impact on our mission.  

However, we have an answer to this problem: You. Your contact list, your circle of friends, is the answer to our potential issue of awareness. With only one share you've raised the awareness of this project dramatically. If enough people hit that share button, send that email, and tell that friend or family member, awareness will not be a problem for us. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, there are still major ways in which you can help this project come to life:

1) Pray for us. It is my sincerest hope that this project glorifies the Lord. The more people that we have supporting this project with their prayers, the better!

2) Spread the word! Social media, emails, word of mouth, and even Indiegogo itself are all excellent ways to spread the word about this project!

Thank you so much for your time! I hope that you will consider partnering with us! 

Sincerely, 

Jacob Willoughby &

story:
¿Qué?

Mar hostil es una obra de personajes, que se apoya en violentos eventos naturales para desarrollar su trama.

El Joven José, un pesquero de reciente construcción con base en el puerto de Mahón, inicia su última singladura una mañana del mes de noviembre en pleno temporal de tramontana. Su avezada tripulación no puede evitar la tragedia, en uno de esos días en los que a cualquiera se le quitan las ganas de navegar y, si se ha elegido el oficio de pescador, no deja de preguntarse por qué ha optado por esta fatigosa profesión. En las operaciones de búsqueda y rescate de El Joven José, en las que no se escatima esfuerzo, participa un buen número de efectivos humanos y materiales. Ese mismo día el buque portacontendores Hudson River sufre una avería y debe recibir ayuda externa para poder continuar la navegación hasta su destino en el puerto de Barcelona.

El protagonista de esta novela es Vicente Vázquez, un marinero de origen vasco que solo existe en la mente del escritor, y está escogido a propósito para pasar a formar parte de la vida real en la que se desarrolla este relato. Sus vivencias son narradas sumido en una profunda depresión de la que solo el destino sabe si podrá salir. Cuenta con la ayuda, en contra de su voluntad, para la narración de su historia de un afamado personaje polifacético que algo pone de su cosecha, aunque cuenta los hechos en primera persona. 

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Mateo Cerdán Cárceles.

Natural de Águilas (Murcia), es actualmente Capitán  de Fragata del Cuerpo General de la Armada, en la que ingresó en el año 1976 como marinero voluntario, pasando en 1983 a la Escuela Naval como Aspirante Alumno. Desde que recibió el despacho de Alférez de Navío en la Escuela Naval Militar de Marín en el año 1988 ha estado embarcado en los barcos más emblemáticos de la Armada Española como son el Príncipe de Asturias y el Juan Sebastian de Elcano. Mandó el Patrullero Tagomago en Las Palmas de Gran Canaria en el año 2000. Aunque su vocación ha sido la Armada a la que servido durante más de cuarenta años, actualmente se encuentra inmerso en una segunda actividad que descubrió durante una crisis emocional, decidiendo dedicarse a escribir.

Mar hostil es su tercera novela, las dos anteriores publicadas en internet; Entre dos islas escrita en 2006 y El caso Subic en 2010.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Nos hallábamos ante una fría mañana del mes de noviembre en la costa de Menorca. El mar Baleárico estaba enfurecido a causa del fuerte temporal de tramontana de fuerza siete con rachas de ocho en la escala de Beaufort, típico de esta área geográfica situada bajo la influencia meteorológica del golfo de León. En tierra se levantaban agigantados rociones producidos por el choque de las enrabietadas olas contra la escollera del puerto deportivo de Addaya, situado en la zona norte la isla. En los predios los acebuches, oleastros y arbustos salvajes, que se encuentran repartidos junto al borde de los acantilados y que habían ido creciendo graciosamente inclinados y orientados hacia el mediodía debido a la fuerza del viento, volvían a resistir un día más la potente acometida de la tramontana, tan característica en esta época del año. Los viejos del lugar padecían durante semanas este viento frio y turbulento proveniente del norte y que, según los habitantes de la isla, desde hace unas décadas suele durar sólo varios días.
          Como otras tantas veces, nos hicimos a la mar a las cinco de la mañana en el pesquero de arrastre de nombre El Joven José. Llevábamos dos horas con el arte de pesca calado y navegando a una lenta velocidad de apenas tres nudos. Sin embargo, el resto de los barcos que componen la flota pesquera menorquina se quedaron amarrados y a buen cobijo en los puertos de Mahón, Ciudatella y Fornells, esperando a que remitiera el fuerte vendaval. Soportábamos la hostilidad de este mar que se encabritó en las últimas horas. Podríamos decir que es uno de esos días en los que a cualquier persona se le quitan las ganas de navegar y si se ha elegido el oficio de pescador no deja de preguntarse por qué ha optado por esta fatigosa profesión».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Mateo Cerdán Cárceles vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
Story of My Book

The Next Advocates focuses on young female activists and advocates, discovering what skills and themes have helped them gain success. After hearing their stories and what connects them, we delve further and offer tips for becoming a successful activist and/or advocate.

My name is Amanda Musolf and I am the author of The Next Advocates. I wrote this book because now is this perfect time to highlight the triumphs and successes of young women across the globe.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that anyone can gain success as an activist or advocate, they just need the tools and skills to do so. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for youth activism in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you gain the confidence that you can successfully launch or join an activist campaign thanks to the smoke and mirrors of it all being lifted.

In this book, you'll learn about young female activists and advocates and how to become a successful activist or advocate yourself. You will learn:

  • The history of activism and advocacy as we now understand it by briefly revisiting historic movements.
  • What skills the women in this book used to fight for causes they are passionate about.
  • Tips and tricks for how to successfully pursue the world of activism and advocacy yourself.

You will love this book if you want to hear stories of empowering women, and finding success at any age from all walks of life. The Next Advocates is a non-fiction book that speaks to young women and passionate people who are looking at activism and advocacy for the first time.

 

The Book - The Next Advocates

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + first 3 chapters. It delves into the history of activism and advocacy, in which we look into some historic movements—from the Protestant Reformation to the 1968 Student Revolts. Then, we tackle the question of “Why now?” by exploring what factors have lead to today’s environment being perfect for this book. Finally, we take a peek at the issues championed by the activists and advocates in this book—from #MeToo in China, to Ukrainian civil service reform, to battling climate change—in order to give a bit of background before we hear their stories.

Part 2 contains 4 chapters. In this section, we get to explore the stories and triumphs of young female activists and advocates by looking at some of the tactics that they use to make them successful. From Social Media to Social Movement Organizations, and everything in between, we learn more about what it takes to become a successful activist and advocate.

Part 3 contains the last 4 chapters. To wrap things up, Part 3 aims to use the tactics and stories from the previous two sections in order to guide potential activists and advocates as they begin their own journeys. It attempts to break down the process into simpler steps, like saying “yes” and getting informed, so that aspiring young people are less intimidated and overwhelmed.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Amanda Musolf is an undergraduate student at University of St Andrews in Fife, Scotland, studying International Relations and Art History. As a lifelong puzzle lover (though she starts more than she finishes), Amanda has always been curious about gaps in where attention is focused by society. Thus, The Next Advocates was born. The lack of spotlight on the achievements of women, and young women in particular, hit close to home. Being surrounded by strong women who have never been afraid to share their (sometimes unwanted) opinions left Amanda with a passion for telling the stories that hadn’t been told yet.

When she’s not contemplating life’s puzzles, Amanda can be found with her head stuck in a novel, playing word games on her phone, or trying to figure out how to become a worldwide jet setter on a student budget. Amanda is originally from Baltimore, Maryland, where she lives with her parents, younger sister, and two mini English bulldogs named Moose and Wilson (yes, they’re even cuter in person).

For more information you can connect with Amanda via email at amuse122@gmail.com and on LinkedIn (Amanda Musolf) and Instagram (@mandymase1998).

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Amanda

story:
Story of My Book

My name is Ella Epshteyn, and I am the author of Collaborative Strategies for Entrepreneurs in Higher Education Teaching and Learning. Collaborative Strategies is a nonfiction book for higher education professionals, such as faculty, administrators, course designers, IT professionals, librarians, and many others, looking to set themselves up as entrepreneurs, as well as those already taking on projects outside of their day jobs, but unsure about the next steps.

I wrote this book because entrepreneurship can be a confusing, scary, and lonely place. My goal is to start a conversation around collaborative entrepreneurship in teaching and learning and how we can support and promote each other. I hope that in reading this book, you will discover how using the power of professional networks and forming alliances in this space can help create stronger products and services. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you navigate this new-to-you space.

In this book, you'll learn about developing an entrepreneurial mindset, identifying a niche, creating a business canvas, and setting up a marketing funnel. You'll hear stories based on my own personal and professional lived experiences, as well as those told by fellow entrepreneurs - instructional designers, faculty developers, authors, and others, such as:

 

  • Stories about burnout, life changing events, and other circumstances that make higher education professionals seek out alternative career paths.
  • Examples, profiles, activities, and tips from established entrepreneurs.
  • Steps to finding support for getting started, as well as collaborative strategies for promotion and marketing.
  • Overview of relevant technology and tips on choosing the right tools to support entrepreneurial activities.

 

You will love this book if you are an aspiring entrepreneur who is looking for guidance, support, and resources in setting up and promoting your own entrepreneurial space. The book merges personal narratives with professional ones and is meant to start a conversation, to challenge, to discover. I welcome you to engage with me in a companion discussion forum.

 

Join the conversation at https://learning.attecenter.com (Entrepreneurship in Teaching and Learning Forum).
 

The ultimate goal of this book is to connect, to build a network, and to facilitate collaborations. So, please reach out, and let’s get this conversation going.

What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I am offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now (see the tiers for specific rewards):

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • 1:1 consultations
  • Early access to Entrepreneurship 101 for Higher Education Professionals

About the Author



Ella Epshteyn, EdD is an experienced instructional designer, technologist, and faculty developer, having worked at a number of higher education institutions. Since 2019, Ella has been a CEO of ATTECS, LLC - a Boston-based start-up with a mission to provide flexible and affordable instructional design and faculty support services to higher education institutions.

For many years, Ella juggled the demands of her family, life, and professional ambitions. While full-time employment in higher education provided financial security, lack of flexibility and control eventually led to dissatisfaction with her job and severe burnout. While deeply committed to her work, Ella wanted to reclaim the freedom to control her schedule and the projects she was taking on. She finally made a switch to entrepreneurship in 2019.

Ella lives in Boston with her husband, four children, and two cats.

For more information, you can connect with Ella at ellaep@attecenter.com and on LinkedIn.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #CollaborativeStrategies and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

story:
C'est quoi, Petit Pois Collection?


Petit Pois Collection, c'est un univers créé par Manuella Côté, illustratrice et designer graphique depuis plus de 8 ans déjà. J'ai toujours été une passionnée des contes et histoires, des personnages les habitant et des mondes les entourant. Durant mon baccalauréat en Design Graphique à l'Université Laval, j'ai toujours eu une préférence pour les cours d'illustrations dans le but de me perfectionner dans ce domaine. C'est d'ailleurs durant ces années que j'ai eu la piqûre pour l'illustration d'édition et surtout, l'édition jeunesse.

Depuis la fin de mon baccalauréat, j'ai toujours voulu œuvrer dans l'édition jeunesse, mais travaillant principalement dans un autre domaine, je n'avais pas, ou peu, de temps pour m'y consacrer. Le "bon moment" est arrivé durant mon premier congé de maternité. J'inventais des histoires pour mon petit garçon et je me suis alors dit : Pourquoi ne pas les illustrer et en faire des livres?  Petit Pois Collection était né. Depuis sa création, cinq tomes, un cahier à colorier et une foule de petits produits dérivés ont fait leur apparition pour le plus grand plaisir des enfants et des parents.

L'histoire de Macha et Pasta a toujours été très aimée des enfants et on m'a souvent demandé d'écrire d'autres histoires avec ces héros. C'est d'ailleurs pour cette nouvelle aventure que j'ai ouvert une campagne. J'ai toujours fait ces livres par passion plutôt que par profit et comme je suis maintenant travailleuse autonome, il m'est plutôt difficile de financer ce nouveau projet par moi-même. Je souhaite énormément pouvoir vous offrir ce nouveau livre qui mijote depuis 2 ans déjà, mais dont je n'ai pas été en mesure de finaliser pour diverses raisons.

C'est donc pourquoi je fais appel à vous. Grâce à cette campagne de financement, je pourrai me concentrer à terminer ce livre et à ne pas stresser quant aux coûts d'impressions qu'il va nécessiter. Je pourrai avoir la certitude que ce livre sera achevé et que les jeunes lecteurs pourront en profiter dès l'été/automne 2015. 



Ce que cette campagne inclut?


Pour le montant que je désire atteindre, soit 1 400$, environ les deux tiers sont nécessaire pour permettre l'impression du livre.

De plus, ayant épuisé la presque totalité des cartes d'affaires de Petit Pois Collection (puisque j'en inclut une à chaque achat et j'en donne aux boutiques qui tiennent la collection), il me faut renouveler mon inventaire. Donc sur le tiers restant, une partie ira pour l'impression de nouvelles cartes. Une autre partie des fonds iront pour les envois postaux de tout ces beaux livres et des commandes qui s'y rattachent, en lien avec la campagne de financement.  Il y a bien sur les frais pour lancer cette campagne, qui sont inclus dans le montant.

Si je ne réussis pas à atteindre complètement mon objectif, sachez que la priorité va aller à l'impression du livre, donc les sous que j'aurai réussis à accumuler vont quand même m'aider à imprimer ce nouveau tome.

Si nous dépassons l'objectif? J'aimerais grandement réimprimer le tome 1, puisqu'il me reste très peu de copies disponible. Donc si nous parvenons à atteindre 2 000$ je pourrai mettre le tome 1 en réimpression (pour la troisième fois!) J'aimerais aussi avoir la possibilité de réimprimer le tome 2, donc si jamais le montant arrive à 2 500$, le tome 2 ira en réimpression (pour la première fois!)

Ce tout nouveau livre est prévus pour l'AUTOMNE 2015.


L'univers Petit Pois Collection


Les livres Petit Pois Collection sont excellents pour stimuler l'imaginaire des enfants, les amuser le soir avant le dodo ou encore simplement pour un moment de détente durant la journée. Chaque histoire se veut une façon positive et amusante d'apprendre, grâce à des leçons simples que les enfants peuvent comprendre pour les aider avec le monde qui les entourent.

Chaque livre possède des héros attachants auxquels les enfants, filles et garçons, peuvent s'identifier et aimer. Comptant chacun 20 pages couleurs, avec 18 pages de texte, les histoires ne sont pas trop longues et peuvent aider lors de l'apprentissage de la lecture. 


L'impression


Le gros défi de ce projet, c'est surtout de trouver un nouveau centre d'impression qui pourra reprendre le même genre que mes anciens livres. Je devrai chercher un endroit dont le rapport qualité/prix sera excellent et dont le produit final pourra se  comparer aux autres tomes de la collection. Je ne souhaite pas baisser en qualité et même au contraire, j'aimerais améliorer le look de Petit Pois Collection.

Les livres sont en termo-reliure, d'une grandeur de 7 par 7 pouces.

Mises à jour


Étant quelqu'un qui aime être mise au courant, il va de soi que vous soyez avisé de chaque étape franchie pour ce merveilleux projet, autant par courriel que par Facebook et le Blog de Petit Pois Collection. Des images seront publiées lors de la réalisation des illustrations (finalisation des couleurs, des traits, du montage...) ou pour tout autre renseignement que je juge important de vous communiquer. 


D'autres façons d'aider


Chaque don et chaque partage sur les réseaux sociaux comptent!

N'hésitez pas à partager la campagne sur Facebook, Twitter et par le bon vieux "bouche à oreille". Chaque petit geste pourra m'aider à atteindre mon objectif!

Je vous remercie grandement pour ce support, vous m'encouragez à aller de l'avant!

Pour le montant que je désire atteindre, soit 1 400$, environ les deux tiers sont nécessaire pour permettre l'impression du livre. 
De plus, ayant épuisé la presque totalité des cartes d'affaires de Petit Pois Collection (puisque j'en inclut une à chaque achat et j'en donne aux boutiques qui tiennent la collection), il me faut renouveler mon inventaire. Donc sur le tiers restant, une partie ira pour l'impression de nouvelles cartes. Une autre partie des fonds iront pour les envois postaux de tout ces beaux livres et des commandes qui s'y rattachent, en lien avec la campagne de financement.  
Il y a bien sur les frais pour lancer cette campagne, qui sont inclus dans le montant.
Si je ne réussis pas à atteindre complètement mon objectif, sachez que la priorité va aller à l'impression du livre, donc les sous que j'aurai réussis à accumuler vont quand même m'aider à imprimer ce nouveau tome. 

Si nous dépassons l'objectif? J'aimerais grandement réimprimer le tome 1, puisqu'il me reste très peu de copies disponible. Donc si nous parvenons à atteindre 2 000$ je pourrai mettre le tome 1 en réimpression (pour la troisième fois!) J'aimerais aussi avoir la possibilité de réimprimer le tome 2, donc si jamais le montant arrive à 2 500$, le tome 2 ira en réimpression (pour la première fois!)Ce tout nouveau livre est prévus pour l'AUTOMNE 2015.




L'univers Petit Pois Collection

Les livres Petit Pois Collection sont excellents pour stimuler l'imaginaire des enfants, les amuser le soir avant le dodo ou encore simplement pour un moment de détente durant la journée. Chaque histoire se veut une façon positive et amusante d'apprendre, grâce à des leçons simples que les enfants peuvent comprendre pour les aider avec le monde qui les entourent. 

Chaque livre possède des héros attachants auxquels les enfants, filles et garçons, peuvent s'identifier et aimer. Comptant chacun 20 pages couleurs, avec 18 pages de texte, les histoires ne sont pas trop longues et peuvent aider lors de l'apprentissage de la lecture. 


L'impression

Le gros défi de ce projet, c'est surtout de trouver un nouveau centre d'impression qui pourra reprendre le même genre que mes anciens livres. Je devrai chercher un endroit dont le rapport qualité/prix sera excellent et dont le produit final pourra se  comparer aux autres tomes de la collection. Je ne souhaite pas baisser en qualité et même au contraire, j'aimerais améliorer le look de Petit Pois Collection.

Les livres sont en termo-reliure, d'une grandeur de 7 par 7 pouces.

Mises à jour

Étant quelqu'un qui aime être mise au courant, il va de soi que vous soyez avisé de chaque étape franchie pour ce merveilleux projet, autant par courriel que par Facebook et le Blog de Petit Pois Collection. Des images seront publiées lors de la réalisation des illustrations (finalisation des couleurs, des traits, du montage...) ou pour tout autre renseignement que je juge important de vous communiquer. 


D'autres façons d'aider

Chaque don et chaque partage sur les réseaux sociaux comptent!

N'hésitez pas à partager la campagne sur Facebook, Twitter et par le bon vieux "bouche à oreille". Chaque petit geste pourra m'aider à atteindre mon objectif!
Je vous remercie grandement pour ce support, vous m'encouragez à aller de l'avant!

story:
Story of My Book

 

The Sky, Soft Red is a graphic novel about finding courage and hope amidst troubling times in life. 

My name is Lysander Wong and I am the author of The Sky, Soft Red. This book emerged from the influx of emotions I’ve experienced in the past few years, and grew into a way I could begin to express my fears and hopes and uncertainties about life. 

There’s a little about the worry of not knowing what you want in life, not knowing where you see yourself in the future. About leaving behind a changing city and the fear that you’ll never be able to see it again, or at least that the next time you return, you wouldn’t be able to recognise it. About coming to terms of being trans and queer in an unsupportive family. The book doesn’t explicitly address any of these topics, but the story very much arose from my own experiences with this. 

It took years of self-doubt and fear before I found the courage inside me to be true to myself. And I still don’t think I truly have what it takes to go where I need to go. But I hope that this book helps you on that journey, wherever you might be in life, struggling through times of uncertainty, of breaking expectations, of building futures. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn alongside the characters about the struggles and joys we face. I hope that this book will remind people that there’s so much more out there, and there’s always so much more room to grow. 

This book is written for everyone dealing with uncertainty in some sort of way. You’d love this book if you enjoy coming of age stories, or stories about discovery and courage with an ominous tone. 

 

The Book - The Sky, Soft Red

The book follows Jordan, our protagonist, as she discovers some terrifying truths about the city she lives in and the choices she makes in light of this knowledge. Jordan’s journey is rooted in the connections we build and break in our lives, from the relationships with our families and friends, to the bonds linking us to the places we grew up in. It’s a story about courage, and overcoming the trials and dangers of a city that has a mind of its own. 

 

Visually, the book is set in a twisted, dystopian megacity, inspired by the urban landscape of Hong Kong in which I grew up. I want to capture a sense of wonder for the city, especially at night, and build an immersive environment for the characters to explore. 

From where I am at right now, it’s like I’m caught between two different stages in life, and this space is where I am writing this story from. Ultimately, I hope that The Sky, Soft Red inspires you reflect on the connections and relationships around you, as well as how you fit into the spaces you’ve built, or will build for yourself. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get !!

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I have set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups here are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in the fall.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will receive stickers, bookmarks, postcards, and prints illustrated by me!
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community & get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Lysander Wong is an illustrator born and raised in Hong Kong, currently studying Materials Science & Engineering at Northwestern University. He’s passionate about sustainability and carbon-neutral energy tech, and spends his free time completing art projects, playing piano, and thinking about food. 

For more information, you can email Lysander at unghostlys@gmail.com, or connect with him on Instagram and Twitter at @unghostlys. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheSkySoftRed and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!!

Lysander Wong

story:
An anthology of influence...

Maurice Kenny was a teacher for almost as long as he was a poet. He taught at North Country Community College in Saranac Lake, NY, the University of Oklahoma in Norman, OK, Paul Smiths College of the Adirondacks, the En'owkin Center in British Columbia, Canada, and at SUNY Potsdam. The corridors of each of these institutions were decidedly quieter and less interesting after he left them, and the rest of the world has come to know that state of unfortunate silence since his death in Saranac Lake at the age of 86 on April 16, 2016.

We -- Derek C. Maus and Donald McNutt -- would like to publish a volume of poetry and essays inspired by Maurice's wide-ranging influence as a colleague, a teacher, a writer, a performer, an editor, a friend, and more. Our idea for this volume that transcends the forms that such memorials generally take. There's nothing wrong at all with collections of writings that speak directly to someone's memory -- in fact, our friends at Dawnland Voices 2.0 have already published a wonderful compendium of just such works. What we're proposing to do goes in a slightly different direction in order to honor and to reveal the effect that Maurice had on the world: we'd like to collect and publish new (that is, previously unpublished) work that is in some way inspired by Maurice, whether stylistically, thematically, politically, or otherwise (don't worry, we won't ask you to justify the connection). If you have a poem (long or short), a story (preferably fairly short), a photograph, an illustration, or some other form of artwork that you feel was inspired by Maurice, we'd love to consider it for inclusion in this volume. (please e-mail it to derekmaus@gmail.com). The deadline for submissions is November 1, 2017. (please note, this deadline is absolutely not flexible, as we need to start production of the physical volume that soon to get it out by June 1, 2018)

But (of course), this isn't just a call for submissions, it's also a call for financial help. To produce a run of about 400 copies of this volume (which we're estimating will run about 100 pages with verbal and visual artistic contributions from about 30 people...including some previously unpublished work by Maurice himself!) will cost about $4,000 up front. We're pretty much starting from a budget of zero for this project and could use every bit of financial assistance possible to help make it a reality. We don't want to have to set the price for the collection prohibitively high in order to pay for it (such a strategy limits its audience in ways that we're pretty sure Maurice would have despised...), so we're asking for some help up front in the form of donations that will offset the cost of production and allow us to produce a book of high quality and low price. 

In order to make advance sponsorship especially worthwhile, we're also offering some perks that will expand the value of a donation beyond just the positive feeling of helping to keep the legacy of one of New York's greatest writers going for years to come. You can help us out with even a donation of a couple of dollars, but for various levels of advance donations, you will not only be assured an inscribed copy of the book when it is published in the late spring of 2018, but also a choice of some of Maurice's past works to add to your collection. If you prefer simply to send a check to help fund the issue, you can also do that by contacting us directly.

Any amount of funding, large or small, that you feel inclined to contribute is greatly appreciated, and all donors will be explicitly named and thanked (unless you choose to donate anonymously, which you certainly may do...) in the book. Furthermore, you can help us out even more by spreading the word via e-mail, social media, word-of-mouth, etc. about this call for contributions -- artistic and financial -- to anyone who you think might be interesting in helping out, one way or the other. There are buttons on the right side of this screen where you can add this campaign to your Facebook and/or Twitter feeds if that's your thing, and also a button to generate an e-mail to send to others. The fundraising campaign lasts until mid-October 2017, so there's plenty of time to consider whether you might be able to help us out with a donation.

We will keep everyone updated on the status of the publication as the process moves through its various stages toward completion. In the meantime, if you need some more of Maurice's beautiful words to get you through, there's his 2016 collection Saranac Lake Ghost Poems available from Ghost City Press and his brand-new collection called Monahsetah, Resistance and other Markings on Turtle's Back that Chad Sweeney helped edit for Mongrel Empire Press.

story:
In early 2017 I was contacted on Facebook by a man named Joel from Monrovia, Liberia. He said that he needed financial assistance and that he was struggling to provide for his family. I didn’t have much money, but I shipped him a low-level consumer camera and asked him to take pictures of the living conditions where he lived. This book is the result of that endeavor. My interactions with Joel were documented in a YouTube series called "Lie-beria" which you can view today.

The book is 8.5" by 5.5" with 16 pages of beautiful photography from all over Liberia. It will sit nicely on your coffee table in your home and will be a topic of conversation for your guests.

 

Proceeds from this book will go directly to support Joel, his family, and his new business. With your purchase, you will have provided employment and hope to a part of the world where both are hard to find.

story:
When my (Greg) daughter was born, like many parents, my wife and I were concerned about what the world would look like when she grows up. Will there even BE jobs? We decided to take the responsibility upon ourselves to make sure she was prepared for any possible future.

“Science, technology, engineering, and math” — STEM. It’s all you hear about these days. But I soon became painfully aware of the shortage of STEM/STEAM role models and stories aimed specifically at young girls. So, I created my own characters and adventure stories for my daughter, and she loved them.

Pam and I wrote this book, STEAMTeam 5: The Beginning, based on these characters so that parents everywhere can inspire their children with great female role models who use STEAM in fun and exciting ways.   

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

STEAMTEAM 5: The Beginning is a children’s book ‒  an adventure story  ‒ that tells the story of five amazing girls who use science, technology, engineering, art, and math to do amazing things.

This is the first volume in a series of five books that tells the story of how these curious, adventurous girls change the world.

 

 

 

 

 

STEAMTeam 5 is more than just a book ‒ it's a movement to get girls excited about STEM/STEAM. Please join us and help spread the word.

 

Here are just a few of our thousands of Facebook friends... all kids doing science!  

 

 

.

 

Both of us are published authors of best-selling business books, and Greg has self-published over a dozen other, non-business books. We have experience with the schedules, processes, and the costs involved with publishing a book.

This is our first children's book, so we've made it a priority to conduct test readings involving parents, children, and teachers. We even tested the book with our own brutally honest children. ;)

We were excited to discover through testing that our audience is broader than we originally expected. The book has received very positive reviews from boys and girls ranging from age 6-13. And we haven't even added the color images yet!

 

 

Risks & Challenges

 

As written, this hard-bound book is over 125 pages and requires dozens of original full-color illustrations. While we have created some of these illustrations ourselves and sketches for the others, we are working with outsourced talent to create many of them. 

Given Greg's background with graphic design, prepress, and publishing, we feel like we've done a good job of vetting the talent. Their work thus far has been solid. That said, using outsourced talent always poses a risk to deadlines, regardless of how well projects are scoped and scheduled.

story:
AN OVERVIEW

 

The Very Engaging book set is more than just another book. It is a relationship performance enhancer. It is a journey of personal discovery. It is the perfect blend of entertaining conversation prompts and useful relationship tips. Each page's purpose is to create a constructive, fun, and thoughtful discussion between you and your partner. 

THE FORMAT

To get to the heart of big conversation topics, we have engineered a unique method of 'gamifying' deep questions regarding your relationship and personal attributes. Each partner plays through their own unique copy of the book, simultaneously, turning each page together on this humorous, eye-opening journey.

THE PRODUCT

Very Engaging includes two complementary conversation guidebooks (one for each partner), which are structured into 12 chapters, covering critical topics such as money, family, and yes… SEX (hurrah!).

 

OUR STORY

The Very Engaging book was written by two recently-married guys who are super passionate about helping others live happy and fulfilling lives in fun and creative ways. Very Engaging is their first real solution to the many issues they think are worth solving. 

Charly Ligety is currently a graduate student at University of Southern California’s Marshall School of Business. Charly lives in Santa Monica with his wonderful wife, Carley, who has been patient enough to play through many iterations of the book over the past year. A native of Park City, UT, Charly received his BA from Dartmouth College in 2009. 

Les Starck currently works for a national bank. Les lives in Los Angeles with his supportive wife, Ashley, who has been generous enough to lend out her husband for many late nights writing the book with Charly. A native of Reston, VA, Les received his BA from University of Southern California in 2009. 

As former co-workers, Charly and Les spent many-a-lunch together, discussing the typical office politics, pop-culture (Les, being a closet Taylor Swift fan and Charly’s unhealthy love for Justin Bieber), and weekend shenanigans. When they both found ourselves newly engaged, the conversations turned a bit more serious, as they shared our experiences in pre-marital counseling and truly getting to know their partners. After going through the engagement process, they wanted to find a fun, alternative way to initiate these meaningful conversations on their own. So, after reflecting on their relationships with their wives, they started creating conversation prompts to help navigate some of life’s most significant (and…not so significant) discussions.  

Together, Charly and Les have been working on writing Very Engaging since early 2016. While the inception of Very Engaging derives from their own personal relationship experiences, the content of the books has been developed and honed after many long conversations with marriage and family therapists and interviews with dozens of dating, engaged, and recently married couples from around the country. Many of those couple’s stories of challenging conversations, funny quirks, and romantic moments have greatly influenced the overall structure and narrative of the books. The final 250 pages of each book have received overwhelmingly positive feedback from couples and therapists alike. 

THE PERKS

DELIVERY TIMING

 

FOLLOW US!

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Putting the Fun Back in Funeral:

A New Chesapeake Mystery

By Helen Chappell

  Two retired ladies, Miss Doll Ball and Miss Lally Hollyday, find idleness so boring that they have taken up the hobby of attending all the funerals they can find in their area.  They come for the service, the gossip and the drama and stay for the food and sweet tea.

  Although their husbands and their families deplore their interest as morbid and unbecoming, Doll and Lally are enjoying themselves enormously doing something other than cooking, cleaning, waiting on their families and volunteer work. As Lally points out, it beats waiting to die down at the Senior Center. And, Doll adds, it prepares them for their inevitable ends by showing them how they don’t want to go.

  It’s all fun at the funeral until they attend the services for their late butcher and a mourner shows up wearing the exact same outfit as the deceased in his coffin. They wanted drama, and now they’ve got it as they find there may be a killer afoot. Can they find the murderer before they’re found out? A cast of suspects, each more likely than the last has plenty of reason to want the butcher dead, including a pixilated funeral crasher who uses his skills to rob the houses of the mourners while they’re at the funeral home.

  Chappell, author of more than forty two books, including the Oysterback Tales and the Sam and Hollis Mysteries, creates another hilarious tale of murder, mayhem, crabs and characters we haven’t used yet on Maryland’s Eastern Shore. 

Contibutors of $25 or more will recieve an autographed copy of Putting the Fun Back in Funeral as an Advance Reading Copy before the official pub date

story:
Who Is Nehemiah Olson?

I'm an 18 year old homeschooled son of a pastor.

What Will I Be Doing?

I will be going to Australia and Papua New Guinea to learn about God and serve on a medical ship through YWAM. I'll be in Australia for roughly 3 months where I will be immersed in a cross-cultural classroom, study the word of God, take classes in healthcare, learn from missionaries and other teachers, and many other things. During these months I will also be involved in local children and teen ministries. these outreaches will includes hosting camps and high school seminars among various other things. After this, I will be spending about two months on a medical ship going around the island country of Papua New Guinea providing healthcare to multiple different villages. The people of Papua New Guinea have little to no access to medical care which results in many individuals that die to curable diseases. For example, five women die in childbirth every day, and 1 in 13 children die before the age of five. Through YWAM we will not only provide healing to peoples' bodies, but to peoples' souls through the good news of Jesus Christ. 

Why?

Ever since I was young I have always felt called to missions, and recently I have had passion toward medical missions. I am taking a year off of school before I go to college, and I thought I would make good use of it by seeing firsthand what it is like on the medical mission field.

What Is YWAM?

YWAM stands for Youth With A Mission. YWAM is an organization with bases all over the world that train and equip young people to spread the word of God.

I am doing what is called a Discipleship Training School. Here's the official website for what I will be doing:

http://ywamtownsville.org/training/discipleship-training-school

When?

The program runs from January 31 to July 1, 2016.

How Can you support me?

~ most importantly by PRAYER!
*Pray for boldness, that we may fearlessly show God's love through our mouths and our actions.
*Pray, NOT for safety or a "fun" time, but that God would do whatever it takes to pull us closer to Him.
~Also by donating, on this website or by mail of check/cash (Address: 2032 4th Ave. E. International Falls, MN 56649)

story:
Short Summary

I started traveling seriously 5 years ago. Oh, the things I've seen: unimaginable landscapes, savory foods, culture and art I've only read about in books and magazines.

BUT, my travels have also revealed to me the destitute lives that many children and their families go through all around the world. To this day, I still can't get the image of the little Peruvian girl devouring a granola bar I gave her, the same one I was about to throw away because I didn't feel like carrying it around anymore... 

That trip changed my life, my thinking, and my attitude. And I wondered how many others felt the same.

So I started this global book project (nicknamed Project Alpha), pulling together travelers from all over the world to write about the one trip that changed their life. The intent is to show how powerful travel is AND to give back to the communities that have changed our lives for the better; thus, all funds raised through this project will be donated to children charities Save the Children and Unbound. 

Come travel the world with us and be inspired to go on your own journey of self-discovery. 


What We Need & What You Get

Our target is to donate $5,000 to Save the Children and Unbound. The $8,000 crowdfunding goal accounts for book production and fees associated with INDIEGOGO. All remaining funds will be donated.

When you back this project, you will receive a lifetime of reading enjoyment: 

1. E-Book version at $10 [$9 donated to charity - after crowdfunding fees]

2. Black/White paperback version [includes the E-Book] at $25 [cost of producing a paperback is approximately $7; $15 donated to charity - after crowdfunding fees]

3. Coffee table book version [includes the paperback and the E-Book] at $65 [cost of producing a full-colored book is approximately $30; $20 donated to charity - after crowdfunding fees]

All costs are approximate and might be higher/lower depending on how many books are printed. The more we print, the lower the cost! All actual costs will be made public. We will be 100% transparent with each step. Updates will be provided regularly so you can be assured we'll deliver on our promise. 

So let's team up and bring happiness to communities all around the world! 


The Impact

We are proudly supporting Unbound. This organization provides support to communities by helping mothers and their families build a healthy environment, which, in turn, will improve the lives of children in those communities. Furthermore, Unbound spends 92.5% of all donations towards programs and NOT overhead costs!

We are proudly supporting Save the Children. This organization provides direct support to children all around the world in time of crisis and puts together safeguards for the future. Programs include education projects, emergency response during disasters and crises, health and nutrition, protection from harm, and many other initiatives. Furthermore, Save the Children spends 89% of all donations towards programs and NOT overhead costs! 

So how much would $5,000 afford for a community in a developing country? The cost of living varies by countries, but, as an example, for just the cost of a latte at Starbucks, clean drinking water could be provided to a person for 20 years (according to WaterWellsForAfrica.org). You are making a HUGE IMPACT with every dollar this campaign donates. 


Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is finalizing all edits and putting the book together in time; however, our team has 8 outstanding editors to help with this process. 

Our schedule:


As an engineer and project manager at the largest Aerospace company in the world, I manage complex projects daily. Furthermore, the majority of our team members blog regularly. We also have great editors, designers, and specialists. We will get the job done!

Ways You Can Help

We understand that while you would love to back this project, you might not be able to. But, you CAN HELP us succeed. We are focused on minimizing cost; that means $0 on Facebook ads, Twitter sponsored posts, etc. 

This means we rely on YOU entirely to help spread the word. Each share, comment, shout-out, mention, and post means the WORLD to us! Tell all your friends and family. Share this project on any social platform you're a part of. Write about us on your blog. Talk about us on YouTube. EVERY BIT HELPS!

We are indebted to you. 


THANK YOU SO MUCH

It has been a pleasure to tell you about this project. On behalf of this AMAZING team, I'd like to sincerely THANK YOU for your generosity and support.
Humbly Yours, Hung Thai

MEET OUR TEAM!

story:
In partnership with:

 

 

Northbound & Notable Giveaway - Enter for a chance to win!

Last year, Northbound Notebooks launched to overwhelming success. Take it from me -- I'm Adam, by the way. Hello! I built most of those myself. One at a time. In the last year, we've made around three hundred of them. 

Recently, the company moved in to Makerspace North -- a creative hub for makers in Ottawa. And now that we've got a home, there's some great stuff on the horizon.

Get a great notebook and help an artist find their place in print. Northbound & Notable is a crowdfunded magazine available in print and online through northboundnotebooks.com. What makes us unique? We pay our contributors. Because good work should be celebrated and artists should be compensated. 

 

THE PERKS

 

 

These are really cool notebooks that will last forever. Seriously. It's refillable, with any A5 paper (just punch it to match). We use simple bindings, real buffalo leather, and hard work.We build them by hand, one at a time, and with enough TLC to make your significant other jealous.

We learned a lot last year. And found a way to make a compact notebook that gives you a ton of page to work with. We're offering two styles for this campaign at a great price:

 

The Companion Notebook is the A5 version of our Original Notebook from last year. And it's really cool. The Companion uses thick buffalo leather with a smooth finish. The results -- like above -- are aged perfection. The leather will weather to develop its own style. The Companion notebook is a bit thicker -- between 5 or 6 ounces, so it is more resistant to building a nice curve. You've got to work it in over time.

The Rugged Notebook is the same design, but the big difference is the leather. While the Companion boasts a smooth finish, the Rugged notebook is a bit more coarse, with a liiiiitle bit more character. It will mark quickly and beautifully. It's a little less thick, around 4 ounces or so, so it is more malleable and folds and creases more easily. If you want a rough-and-tough notebook, this is your guy (or gal).

And we now offer custom laser engraving, by our friend The Canadian Maker. You can check out his stuff here.

 

 

LEATHER: Full grain Buffalo hide,  hand-cut by rotary blade and hand-punched. We don't machine-make anything. Yours is one of a kind. Don't forget it.

BINDINGS: Standard chicago-style screws in silver or gold. Indiegogo orders include BOTH.

PAPER: Standard A5 sheets, 148 x 210 mm,5.8" x 8.3". 100% recycled paper. 80# thickness. Two-hole punched. Designed for single-side use. Available in blank, lined, and dot grid.

MAINTENANCE: Wash leather with a small amount of water. Avoid using harsh chemicals. Natural blemishes and scarring will occur; it is expected. Do NOT clean with alcohol or detergent. That makes me cry just thinking about it.

BUILD TIME: Northbound Notebooks is run by a guy who makes them by hand. We use local parts and resources (paper, leather, bindings, etc) when possible. We make 'em one at a time. We'll contact you with details every step of the way.

SHIPPING: We ship via Canada post world-wide. For international customers outside of the USA and Canada, expect 4-6 weeks for standard shipping. Tracking is not always available depending on shipping method. We ship internationally and respect the law. That means, sometimes, you might have to pay some customs fees. 

 

Northbound & Notable

 

 

Illustration by Danny Davies​

 

Backers will receive the debut issue of our magazine. We're offering it to everyone in digital format, and to some backers and subscribers in full-colour print. We are aiming for two releases a year: a winter issue and a summer issue. Good things take time, but it will be worth the wait.

It's going to be a beautiful collaboration of the creative spirit. And it'll be a good read. If you want, you can add an extra year subscription to show your support for upcoming artists.

 

Check out some of our featured contributors on Northbound and Notable:

Industria by KATIE CLARKE

Calgary by EMILY MARCHANT

Ottawa in Photographs by TEJESHWAR SHARMA

Out this morning assembling a list by AMANDA EARL

A story on writing by ADAM WILK

 

Want to get involved? Check out our submissions page. We're looking for voices from around the world.

 

Artists Vs. Zombies Adult Colouring

 

 

An extra set of sheets for your adult-colouring pleasure. We're featuring artwork from Dave Merideth. Since we're helping artists, why not bob-rossify the literary greats? You can help detail in their gruesome battles against the undead. All notebook backers get a set of these A5 sheets, ready for their notebook. Including the likes of: Poe, Shakespeare, Beethoven, and some more to be unveiled as we get going. 

 

THE IMPACT

 

 

Ever make something really great, but weren't able to share? Ever write something awesome, but couldn't find it a home? Need a place to put your crazy thoughts and ideas? That's where Northbound & Notable comes in.

We're finding a place in print for artists everywhere. Doesn't matter if you've been published before. We want your content, and we want to compensate you for it. The more people who get involved, the more eyes on our publication, and the more great content we can publish.

It's hard to break in to this industry. Reading fees, editor fees, submission fees galore. It ain't easy feeding yourself on an artist's salary. We can help, together.

  • Our submissions are open to anyone, anywhere. Only our hand-picked favorites will make it to the blog and magazine. Check out our submission guidelines here.
  • We're going to need an editor. By funding this campaign, we'll be able to hire an editor to help hand-pick the best of the best and give a spotlight to contributors everywhere. Apply for an editor position by emailing northboundnotebooks@gmail.com and be sure to include your favorite authors and whatever street cred you bring to the table.
  • Each perk will let you know how much you are contributing to the Northbound & Notable payout pool. This pool is transparent. All contributors get an equal cut of the pie, paid out via paypal twice a year.

 

I NEED YOUR HELP, OBI-WAN KENOBI

 

 

 

Something like this hasn't happened before. It's an enormous risk, setting up a publication. Especially a print one. Do people read print anymore? Does anyone like that kind of stuff? Do people care about artists? Does anyone wanna share their thoughts? A magazine, really?

Yes, really. It's worth a shot.

I remember vividly the first time I had work published. It was in a little magazine run by students at Carleton University. And the sense of pride and belonging I felt afterwards can't be measured. It helped me grow. It helped me belong. I want to recreate that feeling for everyone.

Northbound Notebooks has been a modest success. The extra oomph from this campaign could turn it in to more than just a pass-time. With your help, we can grow our team and brand, and take over the world. The world of notebooks.

There's more we want to figure out. There's a lot of potential with our simple design. With more funds, we can look at alternative binding styles (like rings), folder and sleeve options, and all sorts of other cool stuff. With a modular notebook, the configuration is up to you.

 

STRETCH GOALS

1500 USD -- Funded!

This is what we need to hit our funding goal. All backers will be commemorated in the final page of every issue of Northbound & Notable in a cool name-collage. And everyone will get a handwritten thank-you, from me. You'll also be immortalized on our website, for the rest of forever. Nice.

2200 USD -- Jinhao 599

The Jinhao 599 is the ideal entry point to the world of fountain pens. With a simple, comfortable design and convenient cartridge mechanisms, it's the perfect way to learn the uniqueness of penmanship. We're throwing one in to all Notebook packages if we make it to this goal. Will likely ship separately.

3000 USD - Limited Edition Black

We've got a third leather colour. For bulk purchasing reasons, it's hard for us to offer all three types. But if we make it to this level of funding, all backers will have to option to switch their Companion notebook to a Limited Edition Black.

4000 USD - Authentic Northbound Notebooks Clip

We're working on new, custom-fitted notebook clips for the smaller notebook sizes. They'll fit a bit more snugly than our last ones. All notebook backers would get a clip to keep their notebook tidy.

5000 USD - Binder Ring Spine Option

Image just for reference! Prototype not live yet!

We're working on finding a manufacturer to bring this idea to life. An optional binder spine will screw in to any existing notebook, turning it in to a professional folio, photo album, journal, or school binder. The more choices you have to customizing your stuff, the better. If we reach this funding perk, we'll be able to invest more heavily and launch this option in early 2017.

More to come..

 

SHARE & WIN: FREE NOTEBOOK GIVEAWAY!

Here's the deal: I know that not everybody can afford a fancy leather notebook that is probably the best investment you could ever make (lets be honest). So we're running a giveaway, and the more shares, the more entries. The higher our funding gets, the more we are giving away. And the more we give away, the more artists get a cut of the pie. Everybody wins.

Enter HERE: Northbound & Notable Giveaway

 

Share our social! It goes a long way!

www.northboundnotebooks.com | 

instagram.com/northboundandnotable | 

facebook.com/northboundnotebooks
