While the Companion boasts a smooth finish, the Rugged notebook is a bit more coarse, with a liiiiitle bit more character. It will mark quickly and beautifully. It's a little less thick, around 4 ounces or so, so it is more malleable and folds and creases more easily. If you want a rough-and-tough notebook, this is your guy (or gal).
And we now offer custom laser engraving, by our friend The Canadian Maker. You can check out his stuff here.
 

 
LEATHER: Full grain Buffalo hide,  hand-cut by rotary blade and hand-punched. We don't machine-make anything. Yours is one of a kind. Don't forget it.
BINDINGS: Standard chicago-style screws in silver or gold. Indiegogo orders include BOTH.
PAPER: Standard A5 sheets, 148 x 210 mm,5.8" x 8.3". 100% recycled paper. 80# thickness. Two-hole punched. Designed for single-side use. Available in blank, lined, and dot grid.
MAINTENANCE: Wash leather with a small amount of water. Avoid using harsh chemicals. Natural blemishes and scarring will occur; it is expected. Do NOT clean with alcohol or detergent. That makes me cry just thinking about it.
BUILD TIME: Northbound Notebooks is run by a guy who makes them by hand. We use local parts and resources (paper, leather, bindings, etc) when possible. We make 'em one at a time. We'll contact you with details every step of the way.
SHIPPING: We ship via Canada post world-wide. For international customers outside of the USA and Canada, expect 4-6 weeks for standard shipping. Tracking is not always available depending on shipping method. We ship internationally and respect the law. That means, sometimes, you might have to pay some customs fees. 
 
Northbound & Notable
 

 
Illustration by Danny Davies​
 
Backers will receive the debut issue of our magazine. We're offering it to everyone in digital format, and to some backers and subscribers in full-colour print. We are aiming for two releases a year: a winter issue and a summer issue. Good things take time, but it will be worth the wait.
It's going to be a beautiful collaboration of the creative spirit. And it'll be a good read. If you want, you can add an extra year subscription to show your support for upcoming artists.
 
Check out some of our featured contributors on Northbound and Notable:
Industria by KATIE CLARKE
Calgary by EMILY MARCHANT
Ottawa in Photographs by TEJESHWAR SHARMA
Out this morning assembling a list by AMANDA EARL
A story on writing by ADAM WILK
 
Want to get involved? Check out our submissions page. We're looking for voices from around the world.
 
Artists Vs. Zombies Adult Colouring
 

 
An extra set of sheets for your adult-colouring pleasure. We're featuring artwork from Dave Merideth. Since we're helping artists, why not bob-rossify the literary greats? You can help detail in their gruesome battles against the undead. All notebook backers get a set of these A5 sheets, ready for their notebook. Including the likes of: Poe, Shakespeare, Beethoven, and some more to be unveiled as we get going. 
 

THE IMPACT
 



 
Ever make something really great, but weren't able to share? Ever write something awesome, but couldn't find it a home? Need a place to put your crazy thoughts and ideas? That's where Northbound & Notable comes in.
We're finding a place in print for artists everywhere. Doesn't matter if you've been published before. We want your content, and we want to compensate you for it. The more people who get involved, the more eyes on our publication, and the more great content we can publish.
It's hard to break in to this industry. Reading fees, editor fees, submission fees galore. It ain't easy feeding yourself on an artist's salary. We can help, together.

Our submissions are open to anyone, anywhere. Only our hand-picked favorites will make it to the blog and magazine. Check out our submission guidelines here.
We're going to need an editor. By funding this campaign, we'll be able to hire an editor to help hand-pick the best of the best and give a spotlight to contributors everywhere. Apply for an editor position by emailing northboundnotebooks@gmail.com and be sure to include your favorite authors and whatever street cred you bring to the table.
Each perk will let you know how much you are contributing to the Northbound & Notable payout pool. This pool is transparent. All contributors get an equal cut of the pie, paid out via paypal twice a year.

 

I NEED YOUR HELP, OBI-WAN KENOBI
 
 

 
Something like this hasn't happened before. It's an enormous risk, setting up a publication. Especially a print one. Do people read print anymore? Does anyone like that kind of stuff? Do people care about artists? Does anyone wanna share their thoughts? A magazine, really?
Yes, really. It's worth a shot.
I remember vividly the first time I had work published. It was in a little magazine run by students at Carleton University. And the sense of pride and belonging I felt afterwards can't be measured. It helped me grow. It helped me belong. I want to recreate that feeling for everyone.
Northbound Notebooks has been a modest success. The extra oomph from this campaign could turn it in to more than just a pass-time. With your help, we can grow our team and brand, and take over the world. The world of notebooks.
There's more we want to figure out. There's a lot of potential with our simple design. With more funds, we can look at alternative binding styles (like rings), folder and sleeve options, and all sorts of other cool stuff. With a modular notebook, the configuration is up to you.
 
STRETCH GOALS
1500 USD -- Funded!
This is what we need to hit our funding goal. All backers will be commemorated in the final page of every issue of Northbound & Notable in a cool name-collage. And everyone will get a handwritten thank-you, from me. You'll also be immortalized on our website, for the rest of forever. Nice.
2200 USD -- Jinhao 599

The Jinhao 599 is the ideal entry point to the world of fountain pens. With a simple, comfortable design and convenient cartridge mechanisms, it's the perfect way to learn the uniqueness of penmanship. We're throwing one in to all Notebook packages if we make it to this goal. Will likely ship separately.
3000 USD - Limited Edition Black

We've got a third leather colour. For bulk purchasing reasons, it's hard for us to offer all three types. But if we make it to this level of funding, all backers will have to option to switch their Companion notebook to a Limited Edition Black.
4000 USD - Authentic Northbound Notebooks Clip

We're working on new, custom-fitted notebook clips for the smaller notebook sizes. They'll fit a bit more snugly than our last ones. All notebook backers would get a clip to keep their notebook tidy.
5000 USD - Binder Ring Spine Option

Image just for reference! Prototype not live yet!
We're working on finding a manufacturer to bring this idea to life. An optional binder spine will screw in to any existing notebook, turning it in to a professional folio, photo album, journal, or school binder. The more choices you have to customizing your stuff, the better. If we reach this funding perk, we'll be able to invest more heavily and launch this option in early 2017.
More to come..

 
SHARE & WIN: FREE NOTEBOOK GIVEAWAY!
Here's the deal: I know that not everybody can afford a fancy leather notebook that is probably the best investment you could ever make (lets be honest). So we're running a giveaway, and the more shares, the more entries. The higher our funding gets, the more we are giving away. And the more we give away, the more artists get a cut of the pie. Everybody wins.
Enter HERE: Northbound & Notable Giveaway
 
Share our social! It goes a long way!
www.northboundnotebooks.com | 
instagram.com/northboundandnotable | 
facebook.com/northboundnotebooks

Short Summary

I am Aisha Lumumba, a mother, artist, author, and cook. I have been a vegetarian cook for over 30 years. When I first started on my vegetarian journey, recipes for food that I enjoyed were scarce. So I started to develop my own recipes for good wholesome food that tastes good.

Cuisine On The Nile Cookbook is almost ready. I will be happily shipping them from Atlanta, GA. Shipping is included in the perk, however, international patrons must pay shipping.

This cookbook is important to the well being of people searching for information on a better way of cooking and eating. I became a vegetarian in 1979 and was introduced to a whole new world of food. Luckily I grew up eating a variety of vegetables but had to learn a healthier way of cooking them. I have been all over the United States cooking with friends and family. I now have an opportunity to share the skills I have developed with the world.

I need all of my friends and family to share this information with others. This book will be a blessing to people of all walks of life and many health conditions. Please spread the word.

My goal is $1000.00.  $1000 for pre-order book expenses.

I have some wonderful perks for your support.  One of the greatest perks is the Cuisine On The Nile Cookbook.

I want to say that not reaching the goal is not an option, but realistically it could happen. If I don’t reach my goal the book will still happen.

What is Cuisine On The Nile

Cuisine On The Nile Cookbook comes from a restaurant that was in Atlanta in the late 80’s. The restaurant was staffed with friends that added their own personal recipes. Pamela Diana made a mean Enchilada and I don't know where we would have been with Rich Park's Lasagna and many more. The recipes in this book are healthy revisions of many favorite meals from different traditions. Of course we have New Soul Food, Caribbean Island Foods, Asian Cooking, African Dishes and many more.

I have been cooking vegetarian foods that have brought smiles to people’s faces for over 30 years. Biscuits are my specialty which I have been known to ship to other states. The recipe for these biscuits will be in this book.

What Others Are Saying

I got inspired and just came up with some delicious new vegan/raw recipes this weekend that I'll be sharing shortly. But first I want to share some great news about about the person who inspired me most in vegetarian cooking. People ask me a lot where I learned to cook vegetarian food, if I have to narrow it down to one person, it would have to be Mama Lumumba. She has hands down inspired me more than any other cook, not just because of the ingredients she puts in her foodbut because of the pure essence or "spirit" she puts in it as well... She is the person who taught me the most important lesson in cooking, how to pray while I cook. This one very simple rule has enabled me to uplift, inspire, and Heal myself and others with the simple stir of a pot. One of the greatest gifts one can receive.

-Shakti Vedas Atlanta, GA

I'm excited and eagerly anticipate Aisha Lumumba's new cookbook. SHE Knows the secrets to creating wonderfully, satisfying dishes that are simple, delicious and wholesome...

-Rukiyah Imani  Atlanta, GA

Tofu Foo Yung is an exciting play on Egg Foo Yung for vegan enthusiast like myself! It combines tofu and vegetables in a unique way creating this tasty savory dish. It's it my very favorite dish of culinary genius Mrs. Aisha Lumumba. I would encourage all to try and guarantee you will crave more!!

-Aima Peyton Washington, DC

If you haven’t tried these yet – you are missing a treat!  Don’t be confused with other recipes thinking that Aisha’s fried biscuits refer to dropping dough into a pot of oil and deep frying them.  NO – that is not what these are!  These fried biscuits are slowly fried in a minimum of oil while they are constantly being turned until they are done. 

My Mom use to fry biscuits for me because she knew that I loved them.  Aisha is the first person whose recipe and method remind me of my mother’s biscuits.  There is nothing like them.  Try them.  I’ll bet you can’t eat just one…

-Barbara Sirmans Birmingham, AL

The food I remember eating back at Senbeb in Atlanta was excellent! I remember rushing from work just to eat the BBQ tofu sandwiches and getting my KMT brothers "hooked" on ALL the food from Sister Aisha!

-Nasara Gargonnu San Diego, CA

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Please help me spread the word. Please share with your friends on social media. Please email everyone to tell them this is happening. Tell people that you know. I will be doing the same. Thank you in advance for helping me to make this book a reality.

I am a Communications Officer for a small member association based in Adelaide. For a creative outlet, I have been developing the children's book Albert's Beard. 

This book is very close to my heart, based on the story my own Grandfather used to tell me and my brother about "animals" that lived in his beard.

With the help you give today, I will be able to get this book printed and spread the same joy my grandfather gave me growing up. 

To get 200 copies of Albert's Beard printed, I need to raise at least $1000. Your perk will be copies of this book. Expected release is January 2017!

Somos 22 jugadores de Ultimate Frisbee que compartimos el sueño de viajar a Londres (Inglaterra) para representar a México en la categoría Mixta de nuestro deporte.

En este Mundial de Naciones (World Ultimate & Guts Championships) se verán a los mejores equipos del mundo y queremos ser uno de los equipos que represente con orgullo a su país.

Para este nueva edición del Campeonato Mundial de Ultimate, se enviará a un equipo conformado por jugadores de mucha experiencia, que se están preparando desde meses para esta gran competencia.

Esta campaña de recaudación se inició por las dificultades que tenemos para cubrir gastos de transporte, hospedaje/alimentación y pago de cuotas de inscripción al evento de cada uno de nuestros jugadores y coaches. Así que cualquier apoyo será de gran ayuda para apoyarnos a cumplir este sueño.

Tambien puedes apoyarnos compartiendo esta campaña en las redes sociales para lograr una mayor difusión!

De ante mano, muchas gracias por tu apoyo!

El equipo Mexicoed

...........................................................................................................................................

We are 22 Ultimate Frisbee players dreaming about traveling to London (England) to represent Mexico in the mixed category of our sport.
The best teams worldwide will be present in this World Ultimate & Guts Championships, representing proudly to their country, and we really want to be one of them!

For this new edition of the Ultimate World Championship, we will send a team of experienced players, who have been training for months for this great competition.

This fundraising campaign was initiated for the difficulties we have to cover transport costs, accommodation / food and payment of registration fees for our players and coaches. That’s why your support is so important for us: that would be a big help to reach this dream!

You can also support us by sharing this campaign on social networks to get a better diffusion.

Thanks a lot for your support!

The team Mexicoed

story:
Dissent is preparing for 2020—and we need your help.

Founded in 1954 by Irving Howe and Lewis Coser, Dissent is one of the leading intellectual magazines in the United States and a mainstay of the democratic left. For sixty-five years, we’ve published the very best in political argument, cultural criticism, and longform journalism. We want to be around for at least another sixty-five years. To do that, we need your help.

The coming year will be a crucial one, and not only in the United States, where the elections present us with a chance to throw out a corrupt billionaire president and his plutocratic cronies in Washington. Around the world, from Chile to Hong Kong, democratic forces are fighting back against authoritarianism and the neoliberal consensus. And the deepening climate crisis calls on the left everywhere to think ecologically (and quickly) about the political struggles that lie ahead.

At Dissent, we are working to meet these challenges head on with the rigorous analysis, in-depth reporting, and incisive writing that you have come to expect from us. 

As the oldest democratic socialist magazine in the United States, we already have deep foundations, but we want to keep building. You can help us do it.

 

What We’re Building

Dissent has for many years served as an incubator of intellectual and journalistic talent. Our alumni can be found throughout the worlds of journalism, policy, and academia, challenging dogmas and the status quo wherever they are. To keep it that way, we’ll have to continue paying our writers competitive rates and our staff living wages.

We hope to invest more in the design of our print magazine and website. Though it is the digital age, print isn’t dead, but bad design is. So we want to deliver to you, our readers, the most beautiful product possible.

We plan to be a platform for crucial debates on the left in the lead-up to the 2020 elections and after. Dissent is a unique magazine that brings liberals and leftists together to argue—and find common ground—in the same pages.

Finally, in 2020 and beyond, we want to deepen our internationalist commitments by publishing more analysis and reporting from ongoing and emerging social struggles around the globe.

Can we count on you to help?

 

What Your Money Does

Dissent relies on small donations like yours, and every individual dollar makes a difference. The more funds we raise, the more time the magazine’s editors can devote to ensuring that we remain one of the most dynamic, ecumenical publications on the U.S. left. So we encourage you to give “according to your ability,” as our old friend Karl would say.

But, a few things you should know:

A gift of $250 helps cover an interview with a leading activist, organizer, or scholar. 

A gift of $500 sponsors an essay by the next Irving Howe or Ellen Willis.

A gift of $1,000 helps sponsor a special section in an upcoming issue—plus you'll get some great stuff!

And your donations are tax-deductible!

Become a Dissentnik

By donating to Dissent, you have the opportunity to support the next generation of journalists, thinkers, and writers on the left.

You’ll join the ranks of thousands of other Dissentniks taking part in our project to strengthen the democratic left. The left needs its own institutions, and at a time like this, we need them to be as strong as possible. 

We won’t always win, but we owe it to each other to keep fighting for a better future. 

Thank you for standing with us.

story:
Story Of My Book

Re-route: Post-Grad Guide to Success: Physically, Mentally, and Financially discusses how to navigate post-graduate life and provides tips and tricks on job searching, personal development, along with habit and goal setting.

My name is Geraldin Noemis Diaz and I am the author of Re-route: Post-Grad Guide to Success: Physically, Mentally, and Financially. I wrote this book because as a first generation Afro-Latina graduate I had no guidance coming out of college. I had no one to tell me how apply to a job, how to start paying off my loans and much more. I had to figure it out on my own. I realized through sharing my story that there are many others out there who share a similar narrative. I decided to write this book to be used as a guide to empower and lead you to and through the life you deserve after graduating.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that you are capable of everything you set your mind to achieve. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for post-graduate success in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you gain the confidence you need to apply to a job, start a business, start a project, and most of all take care of yourself while also building a life you love.

In this book, you'll learn about how to navigate post-graduate life to reap the highest levels of success:

  • Hidden route to the job you love through contacting individuals directly
  • What to do with the time you have now that you are not in school
  • How to develop healthy habits to foster the life you want

You will love this book if you feel lost and need some hope and motivation.
Re-route: Post-Grad Guide to Success: Physically, Mentally, and Financially is a non-fiction book that speaks to recent graduates and undergraduates who are looking at success and authentic self care for the first time.

 

The Book- Re-route: Post-Grad Guide to Success: Physically, Mentally, and Financially

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part [1] contains the introduction + additional chapters. In this section of the book I dive into how to mentally be successful in your post-graduate endeavors. Being right mentally is the root of it all. You can't pursue a job, a dream, anything without being right mentally.

Part [2] contains Chapters 3-6. These chapters dive deeper into financial wellbeing and how to approach the job seeking process through the hidden market. In these chapters you will be guided towards your purpose and be able to uncover your true desires and how to have them.

Part [3] contains Chapters 7-11. In Chapter 7-11 we dig into physical wellbeing not only the power of staying active after you're done with school but how we need to take care of our bodies in order to reach our fullest potentials. I discuss healthy habits that have helped me on my journey outside of school but can be implemented at any given point in your life.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020.

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats).

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

Milestones:

  • When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish.

story:
Campaign Update

The #Stigmatized book presale campaign has officially closed and it was a win! Thank you all for your support in backing the book and helping me promote the presale through various platforms. With the $8,000 goal surpassed, pre-sale members will receive a signed paperback edition (or an e-book if you selected this option) along with audiobook in April when it releases in 2021. 

In total, we had 170 backers from DC + 28 US States and 18 different countries! Incredible. It makes me so happy and grateful to report that we finished raising $8,043, which means that my book "Stigmatized" will be published in paperback, hardcover, and audiobook!

We have already begun our early work on book cover design and I am neck-deep in revisions with my editing team.  If you have a book cover you really like, please share it with me.  If you have one you really don't like, send that too!

Here is to one story at a time to humanize & destigmatize TB. Thank you again for all the love & support!

Check out a brief podcast on the book from an interview with New York University here: https://bit.ly/2WcDQOp

Best,

Handaa

 

Story of My Book

Stigmatized is an inspiring story about a Mongolian girl’s fight with stigma and illness and how she overcame obstacles with resilience, hard work, and a change in perspective. In this book, Handaa intertwines her journey battling advanced stage Tuberculosis (TB) and social stigma attached to it, with her stories of growing up in a nomadic country like Mongolia, learning a foreign language, pursuing higher education abroad at the age of 17 on her own, and exploring cultural diversity in different parts of the world.
---

My name is Handaa Enkh-Amgalan and I am the author of Stigmatized. I wrote this book because I want to change the narrative around owning your battle and turning it into your strength to positively change your life trajectory and ultimately, leverage your story to inspire others. We are all humans and all go through storms; nobody needs to be defined and stigmatized by their struggles. I hope that my book helps you understand that your struggle is your story and embracing every component of who you are, even the hidden parts, will influence your healing and growth process. With this book, I hope to instill in you the same curiosity I have in making sense of and articulating your previous experiences and allowing them to give you a new perspective.

When I was a teenager, I was diagnosed with TB and I was encouraged to hide my disease due to fears of social stigma and discrimination. Hiding such an important part of my life created an internal struggle of questioning my identity. However, living abroad pursuing higher education, exploring new perspectives, and befriending individuals from different backgrounds made me realize that being a TB survivor was part of my identity and I needed to embrace it. It took me almost a decade to realize that it is not something to hide, feel ashamed of, or be silent about. By remaining silent, I did not know then that I was unconsciously contributing to the root cause of the problem. And this is what compelled me to write this book; I could no longer be part of the silence.

After reading my story, I hope that people who are battling TB or other stigmatized diseases and challenges feel empowered to raise their voices and join me in the fight to break the silence and remove stigma together. I also hope that policy makers, civil society, and international organizations step up their efforts to not only treat TB medically, but also tackle the attached stigma. With this book, I aim to combine storytelling with activism around TB, stigma, and discrimination.

Stigmatized is a creative non-fiction book that speaks to anyone looking for inspiring stories about the ups and downs of an ordinary journey and how the power of grit and vulnerability drives empowerment. You will love this book if you are someone who enjoys personal storytelling as a way to kickstart your own self-reflection.

 

The Book - Stigmatized

The book is written with 3 core themes that intertwine storytelling with activism:

1: MY LIFE JOURNEY - this theme contains my childhood stories of growing up in an informal settlement in Mongolia, my parents’ work to educate me and my siblings, including how I learned English from scratch. My journey as I left home for the first time to study abroad on my own and explored cultural diversity in Bulgaria, Poland, Uganda, and the United States. Later, how I got admitted into New York University with a full scholarship, and landed the job that I love in humanitarian & development sector in New York City.

2: TB & SOCIAL STIGMA - this theme contains stories of my diagnosis, prolonged stay in a TB health clinic, and valuable friendships made with other TB patients at the hospital. Additionally, realizations from observing the experiences of TB patients and negative attitudes towards TB, the ways in which I was encouraged to hide my disease from society, and how I battled shame, guilt, fear, and isolation by leveraging the power of vulnerability and acceptance.

3: SURVIVOR CULTURE & IDENTITY - this theme encourages readers to be vulnerable, accept every component of who they are, even the stigmatized, hidden parts of their identity to achieve internal reconciliation, empowerment, and confidence. It also promotes survivor culture that fuels sustainable change to empower and engage those with these lived experiences in policy, programming, and other decision-making processes.
 

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring of 2021.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook!


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish,
  • A personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book,
  • A personalized bookmark featuring a quote from my book. 
  • Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”),
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback,
  • The opportunity to help me select my cover,
  • A book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book,
  • The opportunity to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And more!

 

About the Author

Handaa Enkh-Amgalan works in the global humanitarian sector, focusing on refugee empowerment. Born and raised amid resilient, hard-working, and education-loving parents in an informal settlement in Mongolia, Handaa firmly believes in the power of pursuing and gaining higher education to become empowered and make a difference in the world. Through this book, Handaa shares her story of persevering through obstacles from financial hardship to stigma and illness, and obtaining education and achieving success despite the tough odds. Handaa holds a Master’s degree from New York University in public policy and a Bachelor’s in Economics from East Tennessee State University.

In many societies, including Mongolia, TB remains a highly stigmatized disease, making it difficult for TB patients to fight the disease in a dignified way. After finding out that she was the first Mongolian survivor to publicly share her story battling TB and social stigma attached to it, Handaa felt a sense of responsibility and urgency to break the silence and share her story. Her book, Stigmatized, explores the intersections of overcoming stigma and taking back the power to pave your own road in life. Refusing to be ashamed or silenced anymore, Handaa combines storytelling with activism to fight the TB stigma, raise awareness, and promote survivor culture to ensure that people with the lived experiences are at the decision-making table.

Handaa loves dogs and hopes to adopt a puppy in the near future.

For more information, you can connect with Handaa at handaa.rea@gmail.com and on LinkedIn: Handaa Enkh-Amgalan, MPA, Facebook: Handaa Rea, Twitter: @Handaa-Rea, and Instagram: handaarea.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #STIGMATIZED and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
  • Please share any media opportunities (e.g. podcasts, interviews) to help me reach more people about my story and destigmatize TB!

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support. This is really my dream come true, and I am counting my lucky stars that I get to share it with all of you.

Thanks again,
Handaa Enkh-Amgalan

Watch live masses, testimonies religious programs, listen to hymns, check the daily bible, prayers, and the holy rosary, and many more upcoming features on Sancta Maria Radio’s app.
It is the generosity of you, our listeners, and supporters that enables Sancta Maria Radio to stay on air.
Nowadays, many churches are adopting various digital technologies to spread their teachings and faith, rather than spreading the word through traditional media.
Technology is only valuable when used to highlight the Word of God.
Then why not help us share God's love to the world?
A flashback of Sancta Maria Radio’s Foundation
Sancta Maria Radio shed light in June 2013 with a mission to spread God's word all over the world using today's mobile technology. It is the ultimate praying tool for all Christians. There’s an app and a website for all our digital listeners and an FM and online radio broadcasting hymns and other religious programs. 24/7/365

The 300,000+ active listeners and the 100,000+ active users are the ones who motivate us and keep us going.
Your financial support is needed to continue Sancta Maria Radio’s mission. This money will cover the app’s support costs on multiple platforms, along with its new website.

Thank you for your generosity. We wouldn’t have done it without you!
God bless you!

story:
I’m happy to announce that my campaign goal has now been fully funded due to additional outside funding! Thanks so much to my friends, family, mentors, publisher, and other new members of my author community for coming together to support me on this endeavor. We couldn’t have done this without you!

 

Story of My Book

My name is Douglas Scherer, and I am the author of F.O.R.G.E.D.: Six Traits of Great Leaders in Volatile Times. I wrote this book because we’re now in the perfect storm of extreme change and rapid life-changing decisions while facing the unknown. When things are out of balance and completely new, the question becomes - what leadership skills are essential and how can they be learned and wielded?

Different fields of practice might call volatile times “disruption,” “crises,” or “critical incidents.” No matter the name, I believe that readers can embrace the six traits derived from the leadership stories to become their own forms of great leaders in volatile times.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you’ll recognize F.O.R.G.E.D. traits within and bring them to bear when faced with the unknown. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement for leading in volatile times. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you respond with leadership awareness to situations that you’ve never before experienced.

In this book, you'll learn about the importance of building communal relationships, the power of trusting your gut when making decisions, and the overarching necessity to bring compassion to your leadership responses. You'll hear stories such as...

Naimeesha Murthy, Founder of Products by Women - Creates an online community based on a need she saw for women in product development.

Eric Yuan, Creator of Zoom - Steers Zoom Video Communications, Inc., through a 6000% increase in client scheduled meetings in only five months.

Robin Larkins and Marcelo Taiano, Co-leaders of the Dobbs Ferry Food Pantry - Take over a 428% increase in families in need within a month of suddenly being passed the reins at the start of the Covid19 pandemic.

You will love this book if you deal with important decisions that don’t have a road map, captain your organization through uncharted waters, or are building environments that require more creative thinking.

F.O.R.G.E.D. is a nonfiction book that speaks to experienced and new leaders who want to look at leadership and strategy in a new way.

 

The Book - F.O.R.G.E.D.: Six Traits of Great Leaders in Volatile Times


The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1:  The backdrop of disruption and rapid change forces us to take a fresh look at how we lead. The chapters in part 1 explore the foundations of F.O.R.G.E.D. leadership through the perspectives of case studies from Amazon, Kodak, Lego, and more.

Part 2: These core chapters visit each one of the six F.O.R.G.E.D. leadership traits. We’ll unwrap stories from leaders of large and small organizations across a diverse set of industries and settings. The chapters also provide opportunities to explore the ideas derived from the stories so that you can better incorporate them into your own leadership style.

Part 3: The final chapters summarize the lessons learned throughout the book and visit alternative ways of working with moments of crisis focusing more deeply on stress, empathy, and intention. These two chapters allow us to see that the work of developing leadership is not static; it’s a continuous learning process.

 

 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

 

 

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this August, 2021


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

 

Douglas Scherer, Ed.D.: For over twenty years, Douglas has helped individuals and groups with their strategic and real-time decision making, stress reduction, and pain management through embodied, reflective, and systems learning. His earlier work as an author and series technical advisor yielded a highly successful body of books and videos published by McGraw-Hill and Prentice-Hall.

He is a qualified Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction teacher, registered yoga teacher, certified scrum master, certified data privacy solutions engineer, technology executive, and adjunct faculty member at Columbia University, where he earned his master's and doctoral degrees and teaches the core curriculum course Digital Strategy and Leadership.

He has presented in a wide range of settings, including the Meaningful World Annual Mind-Body-Eco-Spirit Festival at the United Nations, the Academy of Management annual meeting in Montreal, and international conferences focused on data technologies.

He wrote F.O.R.G.E.D. because the topic was crying out to be addressed. Covid times spurred the opportunity for leaders from varying realms to share their experiences of leading in situations without precedence. In many ways, he got to see how people rose to meet the moment. He truly hopes the book excites anyone leading or making tough - high-impact decisions in areas that require creative new ways of thinking and responding.

In his off-hours, Douglas enjoys walking Felix the Dog and bicycling on the local trail, playing guitar, eating good food with his family, and riding roller coasters with his daughter.

For more information, you can connect with Douglas at dschereredd@gmail.com and at LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ForgedLeaders and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Douglas Scherer

ABOUT

SPACEONSPACE Magazine (SOS MAG) is an independent, print publication about land, power and art. At SOS MAG, we believe that art and slow, meditative reading have the power to heal and bring transformation to our inner worlds. We are a platform promoting belonging and hope by uplifting voices of artists and storytellers. We activate others towards making positive change by building context around complex issues and forming authentic relationships within spaces of tension. We are motivated by the tension that sits between opposing ideas and are energized to build connectedness through empathy, which is fostered through listening and learning.
 

Each issue of the magazine will feature:

    - Interviews and essays around belonging and place making
        - Land stewardship principles
    - Critical dialogues around power dynamics: money, politics, influence
        - readings and listenings to support radical re-imagining
        - mental health, self care and trauma-informed tools and practices
    - Art and Design Content
        - STORIES, ART FILES & SPACE FUTURES


ISSUE 1: DISRUPT

Myself and my Advisory Board are launching this campaign to raise money for the issue 1: DISRUPT. 2020 has been a year of disruption across the globe. Lives have been drastically altered in the face of pandemic uncertainty, political division and racial tension. As my own mother put it, "it’s like the world is in the midst of a global panic attack." In this issue, we look at this moment in time within the context of history. We unpack three neighborhoods in the United States that underwent immense disruption in the 60s and 70s and how these events have a rippling effect still today. We look at disruption from the lens of hope and healing. Reimagining worlds is something SPACEONSPACE does best. Included in this issue is a conversation with a group of Mamas from across the country, work from artists around the world processing 2020, as well as, two artist interviews on meditation, performance and the changing planet.

Art Contributors

*Jesse Shussett                                       *Kayla Kochanowicz
*Molly Root                                                *Liz Lanphear
*Kelechi Azu                                              *Eva Switala
*Emily Jung                                                *Emily Ruth Hazel
*Ryota Kuwabara                                     *Brandon Youndt
*Richard Gayler                                        *Lucy H. West
*Kristina Sheufelt                                     *Kristina Escala
*Amaris Marquez Hunter                       *Chahn Chance
*Skander Khlif                                            *Julia Glatfelter
*Mackenzie Abernethy                           *Rachel Cosgrove


Interviewees & Contributing Storytellers
*Estella Habal from Maniltown Heritage Foundation
*Badir McCleary of ArtAboveReality
*Florence Nishida from LA Green Grounds
*Sheila Quintana Aguilar
*Jessica Foster
*Brittney Anderson
*Maria Vivanco
*Carrie Hansen
*Aysha Pamukcu
*Yesenia Hunter
*Charity May
*Judy Elizabeth
*Jamie Brooke

 

Subscribe to the magazine email newsletter for updates!


FUNDRAISING

We are asking for $10,000 to cover the initial start up costs and the launch of the first issue of the magazine. At SPACEONSPACE, we believe artists deserve to get paid for their creative and cultural labor. Your contribution will go toward funding the printing, distribution and graphic design costs, as well as, paying our contributing artists and writers! There are options to preorder the first issue of the magazine, subscribe to a year of SOS goodness delivered to your door, collect SPACEONSPACE Stickers, and purchase prints and collectables from our contributing artists!
 

COLLABORATORS & ADVISORY BOARD

Dylan Chan (Graphic Designer and Art Director) is a graphic designer currently based in her tropical island city of Singapore. In 2019, she obtained her BFA from the University of the Arts (UArts), Philadelphia. Her skills range from branding, web design, print, illustration, type design, photography, videography and motion graphics. A humanitarian at heart, she advocates for marginalized communities, particularly those of immigrant status. She also fights for the environment and is learning to live a zero-waste lifestyle. Recently, she has taken up the art of composting and considers herself an old-timer in rock climbing. Follow her at: @dillpicklechan
https://dylanpicklechan.com/

Liv Malloy (Assistant Editor) is a journalism student and editor from Philadelphia. She will graduate from Temple University in 2021, after three years of school. With her editorial and multimedia experience, Malloy is beyond excited to be a part of SPACEONSPACE. In her free time, she enjoys pursuing her interest in politics, reading up on land use, and teaching herself new things.

Emily Logan (Founder & Editor) (she/her) is an artist based in Los Angeles who has devoted her practice to cultivating frameworks of healing and collaboration through the use of the body, material objects and space. Acting as an evolving visual anthology, Logan's work constructs spaces designed for reflection, healing and growth. The word anthology comes from the Greek word anthos meaning flowers and logia meaning collection. Her work acts as a symbolic collection of "flora" often using materials that are lifeless, cold, resistant to pressure and not easily broken. She strives to find collaborators who are also resistant to pressure and whom are not easily marred by the negative societal forces that impact us all. The work embodies elements of performance, installation, video/photography, metal fabrication and public engagement. Logan is also interested in community planning, urban development and social entrepreneurship. Learn more at www.spaceonspace.com

Yesenia Navarrete Hunter (Advisor) (she/her) is a PhD Candidate in History at the University of Southern California. Her project, called “Entangled Histories of Land and Labor on the Yakama Reservation in the 20th century,” centers on the braided histories of immigrants and Native Americans on a racialized agricultural landscape. Her work is guided by the question: How do people make place and create rhythms of belonging in fragile spaces? The aesthetics of her work are guided by elements of place, memory, embodied practices, and relationality. Along with her scholarly work, Yesenia and the Hunter family explore questions of belonging through what they call “Hunter Gatherings,” events that invite others to participate in dialogue and making. Yesenia’s art and scholarship are fueled by her role as a mother and wife, and deeply influenced by the belief that belonging is more than a basic human need, it also operates as a motivation and expression and can link us to living big full lives. Learn more at https://yeseniahunter.weebly.com/ .

Charity May (Advisor) is an investor, writer, designer and strategist who finds purpose in helping people and organizations create regenerative impact. She is the founder of a regenerative systems practice that guides compassionate leaders in the art of sustainable future-making. Her virtual incubator program, Fly Parallel Studio, coaches culture-makers in taking an idea from concept to creation using regenerative practices. Charity is also an Associate Director at Turner Impact Capital, a social impact investing firm committed to building socially enriching infrastructure in communities across the U.S. In this role, she is responsible for the sourcing, underwriting, analyzing, negotiating and executing of investment opportunities and management of fund finances for the Turner-Agassi Education Facilities Funds. Charity enjoys being in nature, exploring cities with her husband, Kevin, learning new skills and engaging in conversations about healing, economics, spirituality and design. Learn more at www.charitytaylormay.com.

Judy Elizabeth (Advisor) is a money coach who is obsessed with talking about money and putting people on the course to financial freedom. After growing up with a vulnerable immigrant mother and experiencing financial abuse from her father – and later accumulating a lot of credit card debt in her 20s – Judy decided to take the reins of her life to steer her down the path of financial wellness. Now, she draws from her own experiences in her business Hear Me Finance, LLC to help others do the same. Coming from a background as a union organizer – fighting for low wage workers to get better salaries and benefits – Judy now loves coaching women and couples to pay off debts, negotiate down the cost of literally anything, create ‘escape funds’ to leave their jobs or their own financial abuse situations, maximize their finances, or become money coaches, too. When she is not coaching she loves going to the park, cuddling her dog Debbie Harry and her partner Brandon and making things like homemade candles and lip balm. Learn more at https://hearmefinance.com/ . 

Jamie Brooke (Advisor) (they, she) is a multidisciplinary artist, collaborator, and builder of organizational infrastructure. They studied Theater and Anthropology at Temple University in Philadelphia from 2012-2016. While in college, Jamie found community through theatre, LGBTQIA+ studies & activities, political organizing, and social/cultural learning while studying abroad in India. Post-college, Jamie has a deeper focus on confronting systems of oppression in the United States, particularly as it pertains to race, gender, and class. Jamie is in gratitude to Power Street Theatre Company, the entrepreneurial group, Junto, JANE.hr, and now the San Francisco Foundation, for the opportunities to grow as an artist, project manager, and collaborator for social change. Jamie would not be here without the mentorship and leadership of the womxn of color in their life, particularly through Power Street. Jamie is excited to begin this new chapter with SPACEONSPACE Magazine as a Higher Council Advisory Board member and looks forward to helping shape this co-creative experience.

Jamie is in gratitude to Power Street Theatre Company, the entrepreneurial group, Junto, JANE.hr, and now the San Francisco Foundation, for the opportunities to grow as an artist, project manager, and collaborator for social change. Jamie would not be here without the mentorship and leadership of the womxn of color in their life, particularly through Power Street. Jamie is excited to begin this new chapter with SPACEONSPACE Magazine as a Higher Council Advisory Board member and looks forward to helping shape this co-creative experience.

Story of My Book

The Silicon Leviathan: How Digital Natives will Transform Governance will explore what it means to be a digital native, how they operate in the world differently and will identify the key things that the government is going to NEED to change in order to adapt. Exploring themes of technology, innovation, and government bureaucracy, it calls into question our traditional calculus on adopting technological change, showing the value in understanding the youth perspective.

My name is Justin Potisit and I am the author of The Silicon Leviathan: How Digital Natives will Transform Governance. I wrote this because I wanted to introduce a new youth perspective in the formation of federal digital policy, think critically about the realities of an increasingly hyper-connected world and to provide a roadmap to the future of governance.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover some of the different ways that digital natives are unique—and what that might mean for the future of the government. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to think about the significance of generational divides, and how we might liberate governance from its past to slay the Leviathan—the creature of the old ways—and raise a new creature better representing the new multitudes of future digital natives.

You will love this book if you are interested in science and technology policy, reading about the future, and thinking about emerging technologies.

The Silicon Leviathan speaks to program managers and futurologists who want to grapple with the federal innovation system and digital nativism in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that The Silicon Leviathan inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How has my life changed over the last 20 years and how it might change in the next 20?
  • What distinguishes digital natives from previous generations?
  • How might the federal government be best positioned to adapt to a new hyper-connected world?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing technology, innovation, digital nativism, and the future of the federal government will change us all for the better. 
 

The Book - The Silicon Leviathan

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the Introduction + chapters 1-3. It will be dedicated to defining the current problem at hand. Chatting with generational scholars and experts in federal innovation, I explore who digital natives are and what pitfalls the US federal government has faced thus far in trying to prepare for the future.

Part 2 contains chapters 4-6. It will explore the underpinnings of how and why digital natives operate in the world the way they do. Exploring the fluid nature of digital identities and stories, I walk readers through the complexities of the new digital environment and its impact on how people view Generation Z and will view future generations.

Part 3 contains chapters 7-9. It will look into how things are going to need to change in order to take into account the needs, wants, and experiences of digital natives. Interviewing some of the movers and shakers of the tech industry, I draw up a plan for what a better future might look like.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring!


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Justin Potisit is a junior at Georgetown University majoring in Technology Policy, Ethics and History. He is a 2018 Figge Fellow and winner of the 2016 Junior Dublin Literary Awards for his essay, Ennui in Contemporary Society. A proud graduate of ISE International School, he has worked at the US Senate and currently holds a position as a Federal Analyst at Ictect, a federal contractor specializing in developing artificial intelligence technologies for the Department of Defense.

Justin has always been passionate about “disruptive innovation” and thinking about its impacts on people. He hopes to think about different ways in which emerging technologies can be used in an ethical and sustainable manner. He is curious about all things history, philosophy and policy.

In his free time, Justin is an avid fencer and chess player. He also enjoys reading science fiction, watching foreign films and playing with his Corgi, Jo Jo. 

For more information, you can connect with Justin Potisit at jpotisit@gmail.com and on Facebook or LinkedIn. 
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #TheSiliconLeviathan and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,


Justin Potisit

story:
Story of My Book

When You Stand Up To The Sun is a memoir of psychological and spiritual growth that occurs through traveling abroad and encountering unique romantic experiences. It takes one through both an inner and outer journey of self growth and awakening by embracing life as it comes to us. 

My name is Deanna Amodeo and I am the author of When You Stand Up To The Sun. I wrote this book because of the unique experiences I have encountered while traveling both domestically and internationally. During my travels I learned how to trust the process of the journey, invite the unknown into my life and open up to relationships and spiritual connections. In doing so I have shifted the way in which I view the world. I want to share my adventurous stories and vulnerable insights with the world, exposing that our hard-to-crack minds sometimes need a new way of understanding life. 

 

My hope is that in reading this book you will discover:

How you have transformed either through life changing relationships, challenging hardships or passionate adventures, seeing clearly the deeper meaning and connection behind all of these topics throughout your life. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage in creative ways with your inner and outer surroundings, your day to day psychology and with your conscious or unconscious spiritual beliefs.

In this book, you'll encounter:

Multifaceted dimensions of my travels alongside four unique individuals from different cultures with whom I share a spiritual and romantic connection to. The book takes us through a journey of personal growth and spiritual lessons which blossom through soulful adventures with narratives like:

  • Exploring the synchronistic events of life and the bigger picture to our Human experience
  • Engaging life as an adventure, where the outcome is uncertain, yet the journey itself is certain
  • Seeing relationships in a new light to understand the creative influence that certain people bring into our lives in order to encourage self growth and inner discovery

You will love this book if: 

You are a person who enjoys engaging with unique story telling, reading about different cultures, or enjoy hearing about other’s mind-opening experiences.

When You Stand Up To The Sun speaks to curious Humans and fellow lovers of life who want to grapple with unique experiences and cultural discovery in a new way. Ultimately, I hope that When You Stand Up To The Sun inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What deeper purpose do relationships serve in our lives?
  • What is the world around us trying to teach us, communicate to us or show us through our individual journeys?
  • How can we become more open to embracing the uncertainties of life in order to live day to day adventurously? 

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing personal relationships, self discovery, embracing the unknown and growing spiritually will change us all for the better. 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December 2020

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About The Author

Deanna Amodeo left behind the traditional lifestyle in New Jersey to acquaint herself with an unfamiliar world. She spent her early twenties in a state of never-ending travels discovering culture, opening herself up to unique people, and experiencing diverse lifestyles all around the world. She has a passion for connecting to Humans, hearing their stories and learning through their life journeys, as well as her own journey of being Human. 

With a natural love for hearing others’ stories, Deanna has been waiting for the right opportunity to share her own. Over the last 5 years, she lived an adventurous life gathering unique experiences and meeting magnificent people. When You Stand Up to the Sun is her attempt to transfer those experiences from her memory onto paper to share with the world. 

"I am a human being having an experience here on Earth. Just like you."

For more information you can connect with Deanna Amodeo at Deamo@comcast.net and by following @authoramodeo on Instagram. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #whenyoustanduptothesun and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Deanna Amodeo

Story of My Book

The Childish Entrepreneur is a book about how young entrepreneurs and change-makers overcome the obstacles associated with their age.

My name is Aarav Gupta and I am the author of The Childish Entrepreneur. I wrote this book because I was interested in learning more about young entrepreneurship and teaching others about it.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that you don’t need to wait until you are older to have an impact on the world; rather, the best time to start is now. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for entrepreneurship. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you achieve your goals and take action when it comes to entrepreneurship and making a difference in the world.

In this book, you'll learn a plethora of lessons, including ways to overcome doubt and always learn no matter where you are in life. You'll hear stories such as...

 

  • How Sydney Phillips became a successful entrepreneur and business woman after being forced to live by herself at the age of 14
  • How Tayo Rockson was inspired to have a profound impact on the world after a near death experience
  • How Ben Matthew created an app to help local charities despite having gone through bullying in high school 
You will love this book if you are interested in navigating the entrepreneurial landscape as a young adult, and have a desire to change the world for the better.

The Childish Entrepreneur is a nonfiction book that speaks to young entrepreneurs and individuals longing to have an impact on the world who want to look at business ventures and startups in a new way.
 

The Book - The Childish Entrepreneur


The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the Introduction and Chapters 1-3. In this section of the book, you will learn about the entrepreneurial mindset— overcoming doubt, understanding that the journey will not be smooth, and learning how to move past failures.

Part 2 contains Chapters 4-6. In this section of the book, you will learn about important habits such as trying new things, understanding your purpose, and the importance of always learning no matter where you are in life.

Part 3 contains chapters 7-9. In this section of the book, you will learn about starting your journey by exploring how to take action, realizing that the best time to start is now, and how to find a support network.


 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author


Aarav Gupta is a high school student in New Jersey who has a deep passion for business, finance, investing, and entrepreneurship.

Aarav wrote this book because he was interested in learning more about how young entrepreneurs find success in a constantly changing world. He decided to put the knowledge that he gained from research and direct interviews in the form of a book so that others could benefit from it

For fun, Aarav likes to play tennis, hang out with his friends, and listen to music. In addition, Aarav is a part of his high school speech and debate team because he loves communication, public speaking, and spreading his message with the world. His favorite food is pizza and he would be willing to eat this for every meal!

For more information, you can connect with Aarav Gupta at aaravsg5@gmail.com and on Instagram (@aaravrgupta), Facebook, and LinkedIn.
