How Ben Matthew created an app to help local charities despite having gone through bullying in high school 
You will love this book if you are interested in navigating the entrepreneurial landscape as a young adult, and have a desire to change the world for the better.The Childish Entrepreneur is a nonfiction book that speaks to young entrepreneurs and individuals longing to have an impact on the world who want to look at business ventures and startups in a new way. The Book - The Childish Entrepreneur
The book is written in 3 parts.Part 1 contains the Introduction and Chapters 1-3. In this section of the book, you will learn about the entrepreneurial mindset— overcoming doubt, understanding that the journey will not be smooth, and learning how to move past failures.Part 2 contains Chapters 4-6. In this section of the book, you will learn about important habits such as trying new things, understanding your purpose, and the importance of always learning no matter where you are in life.Part 3 contains chapters 7-9. In this section of the book, you will learn about starting your journey by exploring how to take action, realizing that the best time to start is now, and how to find a support network. What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more! About the Author
Aarav Gupta is a high school student in New Jersey who has a deep passion for business, finance, investing, and entrepreneurship.Aarav wrote this book because he was interested in learning more about how young entrepreneurs find success in a constantly changing world. He decided to put the knowledge that he gained from research and direct interviews in the form of a book so that others could benefit from itFor fun, Aarav likes to play tennis, hang out with his friends, and listen to music. In addition, Aarav is a part of his high school speech and debate team because he loves communication, public speaking, and spreading his message with the world. His favorite food is pizza and he would be willing to eat this for every meal!For more information, you can connect with Aarav Gupta at aaravsg5@gmail.com and on Instagram (@aaravrgupta), Facebook, and LinkedIn. International PreordersFor international preorders, please send me a private message. Risks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheChildishEntrepreneur and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Aarav Gupta

story:
Share the Love

A virtual ticket to ride on a real time adventure

Is it an experiment?

Is it a celebration of the power of the word?

Is it  an art project comparing online platforms for connecting people, with good old fashioned real time eye-balling?

Is it a love story?

Is it a gripping adventure, or an entertaning disaster?

Is it the dumbest thing I've ever done?...

 

Let's find out together.

All these questions and more can be answered with your help. Let me share this intimate process of  discovery with you. 

(Please note:  the reference to "the word" above is not even remotely intended in the biblical sense. All words have power, sacred and profane alike in my opinion).

 

Hi I’m Carmen I live in Melbourne, I'm an Art Therapy student. These are confused times. Connection & disconnection come up a lot as themes in my work with clients.  I'm very interested in the role technology plays at both ends of this spectrum. Brendan lives in Burnaby outside of Vancouver, he's an ex-professional musician into sound design and composition for film. He's into the power of story and how it shapes our experience. We both write. We have a combined age of 87. That’s a lot of experience, but not enough to have dulled our curiosity, or crushed our spirit of adventure.

We've decided to co-create a story that's partially virtual and partly confrontingly real. We invite you to live vicariously through us as it happens. Down the track it needs to be a book.

  • Phase 1: The virtual interaction is almost complete.
  • Phase 2: Crossing over into the physical realm, involves getting me to Vancouver by Easter. That's why I'm here...

What We Need 

 A plane ticket to Vancouver

We've both served various muses most of our lives, and as with the majority of creative types, our enriched existence  and our efforts are not proportionately reflected in our bank balances. Did I mention I'm a student?...

  

What You Get

  • A share in a happy ending or a front row seat at a train wreck 
  • A warm fuzzy feeling 
  • A written report of the findings of "the experiment"                                                       Has technology helped or hindered / illuminated or distorted the human connection at the centre of this story?
  • A blow by blow serial account
  • A thrill or two
  • Some original short erotic fiction

The Impact

This is the dangerous edge where life and art get blurry. The fine line between inspiration and insanity.

This experiment is the first stage in what I hope will be an ongoing exploration and body of work comparing virtual vs real mechanisms for human connection.

These are complex times where the world is at your finger tips, but no one smiles at you on the tram. Where personal experience no longer lives in your heart, but on your Facebook page, requiring virtual witnesses and validation to be meaningful. Where the oxytocin released by skin on skin contact cannot be squeezed out of your mouse. Where a video of eye can never hope to compete with meaningful eye contact. Where small contributions from strangers all over the world can make exiting things happen. Where two people on opposite sides of the world can explore these questions.

 

The Back Story

We bumped into eachother kind of accidentally on-line early this year. Tens of thousands  of words have been exchanged since then. We've rummaged in eachothers brains, exposing hard edges and soft underbellies, taking full advantage of the candid protection a 14,000km divide provides. 

With mental fluids thoroughly exchanged, we decided to up the ante with imagery, an eye (as above) a mouth, a miscellaneous curve and a hand.

As a side note:  Gentlemen, are you aware of how many ladies are repelled by small child like hands?

I recently conducted an informal survey on this, mistakenly under the impression I was the only one with a hand fetish. My fetish is inextricably linked to a predilection for being 'man handled', (please refer to the perks, if you'd like to know more about this). About two weeks ago, we skyped for the first time - no video just sound,  then finally the whole walking talking shebang.

On the one hand we're thrilled by the richness of the exchange.  On the other  we are riddled with doubt concerning how much projection is involved in this mutual admiration. What is not being seen? What are the limits of the technology? Despite attempts to eliminate as many variables as possible, we have determined that until the interplay of pheremones and eye contact are thrown in to the mix, we are doomed to exponentially distort our perceptions of eachother. Communication has  escalated to a crack like addiction, which is no longer healthy or sustainable. It's lyrical limmerence.

We're not saying we're in love, we are equally prepared to accept we may loathe eachother on sight. We are curious creatures with hypotheses in need of testing. And in the spirit of rigorous scientific enquiry, physical chemistry  is  one of the elements on the virtual to physical plane comparison list. There is a  scary chasm between talking the talk, and walking the walk. Ask any obessive 'sexter'. You just never know...

 

 Other ways you can help

If you can’t contribute financially, please:

• Share this campaign with your friends and family

• Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.

story:
My name is Kelly Buell. I am a writer, blogger and freelance journalist. First and foremost I am a Mom. When I was two and a half I was adopted, in my early twenties, I surrendered a child to C.A.S. This inspired me to write this children's story. Loved Like Me reaches out to children who have been adopted that wonder about what it means to be adopted, that may have questions about their adoption and may have questions about their biological families. It is (I think ) an invaluable resource that serves as a reminder that no matter their family circumstance, children are unique and they need to know they are loved by their family and how they feel as an adopted child is an important thing to acknowledge. This campaign will help me raise funds to complete illustrations, afford a graphic designer and go towards off setting production costs . For anyone who would like to contribute but for whatever reason cannot, word of mouth is sometimes the most valuable gift there is. Thank you all for your consideration of supporting my project. To see an excerpt of the upcoming book you can go to my blog https//:www.notmystraitjacket.com

 I have an excerpt of Loved Like Me posted there.

story:
50 Way To Be A Lover

When Carlos and I had a baby it made us think a lot about family. Thinking about family made us think about love, and how there aren't any role-models for the life that we find ourselves living.
Unfortunately, movies, books, and music all have a very narrow presentation of what love and family look like. We have never thought it was realistic; I'm sure you don't either. There is really only one book that we have ever read that we think does a good job of looking at relationships realistically and honestly, Opening Up by Tristan Taromino, and we want to take it to the next level.We are going to travel the entire US and some of Canada to meet and interview people so we can talk about all the ways be find and express love in practice.  
We are buying a motorhome and trying to meet as many people as possible in the next year so we can write a book about what we see and who we meet. The part that we want you help with is the middle of this adventure, documenting the process and people (even the ones that aren't cited in the book).

Help Us Stay In Touch

Our goal is raise money to buy reliable mobile Internet and a hotspot and basic recording gear so we can regularly update the blog (Grumpy Pie) and upload video and audio of our progress. If we go beyond our goal amount then we will use the money on upgrading our equipment to have better production values for you, and to expand the number of places that we visit. Comming SOON! 50waystobealover.com

Why Your Help is Important

For us this is a labor of love (pun intended). Your help will make it easier for us to share from day one. We can have a more regular schedule of updating and focus more more time on completing the project and less time doing other things.

Other Ways You Can Help

If Indiegogo isn't the right place for you can help in otherways:

  • Suggest people you think we should talk to.
  • Help us find a place to park in your city.
  • Lend/Give us an RV.
  • Fill out our survey on Family or Dating.
  • Share a meal with us.
  • Let us interview you.
  • Help us make a logo.
  • Tell people about our project :)

Thanks,

Rose, Carlos, and Rockford

story:
An independent feminist blog in Armenia

We are a group of feminists promoting gender equality and raising awareness about women's human rights in Armenia. We are passionate about our work, which is why the blog has been created, designed and filled with various content thanks to the full dedication of our group. It is important for us to continue working on the blog, since the popularity of the blog is growing and we have a chance to truly reach out to the general public of Armenia. Because feminist texts are more readily available and abundant in the English language, we need to translate various texts relating to feminism, gender issues, women's rights and concerns from English to Armenian, especially as it may relate to reality of women living in Armenia today. We need funds to hire translators and to continue this important work. In addition,  we need to buy a domain and hosting for the blog.

Even with the vast information flow of the 21st century, there are still certain groups in Armenian society, which remain on the margins. Most often these are women who are cut off from the media and alternative modes of obtaining information about their rights, opportunities, etc. This situation makes women more vulnerable to sustaining abusive relationships, dysfunctional family relations, abuse of their economic and political rights, etc. Even if these women have access to the media, the lack of coverage on topics that are considered taboo or irrelevant make these women subject to isolation, frustration, lack of acknowledgement. The general attitude of keeping quiet about taboo topics, which make people feel uncomfortable  contributes to the general attitude that there are no problems in society at all.

This is exactly why we need a strong independent feminist blog. Blogs are a perfect platform to express opinions, but also to disseminate information about general human rights concerns that people may not be encouraged to know about. The Armenian Feminist Blog is also a platform where multiple feminisms can receive coverage, and thereby ensure that the women's movement in Armenia does not corner itself in only one type of feminism. This blog will address all the issues that are of public concern, including current events, which may be of relevance to the women's movement in Armenia. 

It's time to empower women living in Armenia, to remind them of their rights, their strength and their potential. Being oppressed in a patriarchal system doesn't mean you can't speak out. Just the opposite. The Armenian Feminist blog will be a perfect tool for those who are victims of this inhumane and oppressive system to raise their voice, share their stories, find support among each other and share with others. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 6000 Euros, which will be enough to fund our project for a whole year. We will pay the translators to do the precious work of translating quality news and articles from English as well as Russian into Armenian. Our work is also concerned with finding interesting topics to cover in Armenia, including interviews with various people who are relevant for the topic of women. If we don't reach our goal we will still pay translators with as much money as we can. We are planning to pay translators 150 euros for several months as well as buy a domain and hosting for the blog. If we don't get the funding we will try to find alternative funding methods so we can keep going the amazing work of spreading feminist ideals in Armenian society. But the point is that we want to stay independent and be open to contributions and volunteer work. We don't want to be told what to publish and how to publish stuff just because we are being financed by a governmental or non-governmental organization. For this very reason, we need you to help us via this crowd-funding platform to reach our goal.

The Impact

In the increasingly homophobic, sexist and patriarchal context of Armenia we need an alternative resource which will approach local and international events critically and provide quality, independent content to readers. 

At first we were skeptical about being able to do this, but then we realized there is an obvious need for this kind of blog in our country. Our goal is to raise awareness, educate youth and adults about women's rights as well as make a space for discussion about different topics which are considered taboos. In addition, we hope that our blog will enable a more pluralistic feminism in Armenia, meaning that women and men who consider themselves feminist will have vast knowledge of different waves, schools and types of feminism in the world.

And here is a fun anecdote for you: We heard that there was a taxi driver who was driving some friends from Yerevan to Gyumri, and he said that he had read an article on our blog about insults and he was impressed, because he never thought about analyzing insults. We were so happy to know and realize that there are people actually reading our articles and thinking about criticizing oppressive norms in our society. We hope to hear more incidents like this with the growth of the Armenian Feminist blog in the upcoming months!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. One of the most important contributions anyone who wants to help us can do is to share our campaign with their family, friends, classmates, co-workers, networks they are a part of and anyone they think will benefit from this blog and will be able to help. Please feel free to use Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

The Armenian Feminist Blog Team 

(Kara, Tatev, Narine, Nik, Milena)

story:
The youth group at Promise (Henry's Church) just got back from an amazing spring break mission trip to Atlanta. As part of the pre-trip meetings each year, they read a book together. If your church has a youth group (or is doing a mission trip) show them some love pick up a "Bakers Dozen" and use it for your pre-trip sessions.

You could be a hero and pick up the "Pair-A-Baker's Dozens" so they can wear matching shirts on the trip. This week, the first 3 who support the project at this level will get a skype session with Dani and Henry for one of your groups pre-trip meetings.

The "pair" chapters are designed for group building and the "bull" chapters will help prepare your group to process what they face on your trip.

Check out out facebook page & let us know your favorite mission trip story.

What's this book about...

It’s more than a story...
It’s about a lived story.
The story that bears the kind of fruit that echoes into eternity.

It’s about living better stories.
     in communities of truth.
Where conversations are keys to giving earthly stories their heavenly meaning.
                                      Some call these parables.
Join us as we explore her story, his story and their story,
     which we will see is our story...yours and mine.
And it is so much more than a story.

The story behind the story

Have you ever been sitting in a coffee shop found yourself eavesdropping on a really interesting conversation.  As international public speakers, Dani & Henry have had those kinds of conversations.  About a decade ago they wondered what would happen if they joined up and approached speaking from a conversational model, inviting the audience into their conversation.  Giving the audience permission to eavesdrop.  About three year ago, they made it happen.

As Dani & Henry have heard stories, told stories and lived stories, they have realized that these are not just stories, they are parables.  Henry’s childhood Pastor said, “A parable is an earthly story, with a heavenly meaning."  Dani & Henry believe that the stories we all tell, and the stories we all live can be just that.

Like Henry and Dani moved from the coffee shop to the stage, they are moving again - this time to a book.  In “Pear-A-Bull: More Than a Story,” Dani and Henry will explore their stories, unpacking them and addressing the heavenly meaning through conversational writing. With their conversation as a model, they invite you to start living your own meaningful story by finding the purpose behind the story.

Making the Story happen

We took a week in the summer of 2012 and started writing together in hopes to have this book hit the streets in November of 2013...that’s where indiegogo and you come in.

Creating a book is expensive and the majority of the funding will actually go to getting the book printed and mailed out.

In addition to our speaking gigs, and last years “write week” we need about 3 more flights between Fort Wayne, Indiana (where Henry lives) and Minneapolis, Minnesota (where Dani lives) to make it happen.  Although we will do a lot of the collaborative effort through phone calls and Skype sessions, we know we need about 3 more face-to-face "write weeks".

The rest of the money will go to photographers, graphic designers, and layout experts.  We are professional speakers writing our first book and our iphones are great, but we are trying to be professionals here.

Can’t contribute doesn’t mean you can’t help....
 Can contribute, we still need your help....

Help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.  Tell your friends on Facebook, Twitter, email, letter, phone call, text, hand painted placard, sky writing, smoke signal, mores code or any other way you can think of about this project.  The more people that know, the better.  Indiegogo has some awesome share tools to help you. Help us get the word out.

story:
NEWS FLASH: March 27th
                                 "2014 INDIEFAB Book of the Year Finalist"

                       "'The Divine Art of Dying' is the best book of its genre." 
                                               New Perspectives Magazine

                                        With a Foreword by Ira Byock, M.D. ,
     Executive Director/Chief Medical Officer, Institute for Human Caring

                                                               *  *  *

The Divine Art of Dying offers the terminally ill, their loved ones, their families  and caregivers, a way to live well – and die well.

                                                          

This book identifies the decisions the dying one and his or her loved ones and friends must make. The Divine Art of Dying is a well integrated look at the divine art of living and dying to the fullest, that includes spiritual insights from many sources.

                                                                         *  *  *

“A magnificent achievement…a moving and inspiring book about taking control of your life as it starts to come to a close.” — Will Schwalbe, author of the best-selling The End of Your Life Book Club

Karen Speerstra is the co-author of the book.  She wrote two other books for our publishing house, including the Nautilus Gold Medal winner, Sophia: the Feminine Face of God. You could say she was the ‘heart’ of Divine Arts.

One day she told us that after 10 years of cancer treatment she'd had enough. She said she was stopping all treatments and would “turn toward death”.  Then, she happily asked if she could tell us about another book she’d like to write. We said, ‘sure’.

Karen said her new book would document her changes and transformations as she approached death; she would provide insight to others facing the same journey we all must take.  It would also be a practical book for not only the terminally ill, but their families, caregivers, and friends.  

Joining her is Herbert Anderson, the author or co-author of more than thirteen books on topics such as death and grief, ritual and narrative, empathy and spirituality, and a leading figure in the hospice/palliative care community.  Herbert wrote the “caregiver’s guide” sections in this book.  Ira Byock, M.D. , Executive Director/Chief Medical Officer, Institute for Human Caring wrote the foreword.

In the months that followed, Karen and Herbert wrote every day and chronicled her changes.  Her family members wrote observations  as well. They finished the manuscript and then, a few weeks later, Karen died. This book is her legacy.

                 

“Fortunately, one can now take life’s final exam with an open book and the answer to mortality’s question can be found within these pages. How then shall we live? Fully. Intentionally. Attentively. Lovingly.”  — Ira Byock, MD, bestselling author of Dying Well: Peace and Possibilities at the End of Life

                               


                                                   Read Book Reviews

An Excerpt from 'The Introduction'

"We intend this book to be a spiritual resource supporting people who

choose to take the turn toward death in order to live fully until they die.
It is for anyone who wishes to know how to walk with someone toward
death; how to listen carefully, advocate appropriately, avoid “fixing,” and
begin to live gracefully with the helplessness.

The support of a dedicated hospice team also makes it possible to
live comfortably and peacefully at this juncture of life. There is still hard
work to do letting things and dreams and people go. The dying will grieve
for all we’re leaving behind. Those who are gifted with time for living
while dying have an amazing opportunity for quality conversations, joyous
gift-giving, and deepening friendships as we love and are loved. We
want this to be a book to inspire, to help and to offer courage to others
who can intentionally choose, as Karen did, for our final passage to be as
rich and as fulfilling as possible. Living while dying is our final human act
– it’s not a medical craft, but a Divine Art.  We offer this book as a gentle
and loving gift to you.'     

                                                                                       – Karen & Herbert

OUR INTENT

This is an extraordinary book that we would like to share with everyone.  We want to make sure it ends up in the right hands where it can do the most good.

So we’ve come up with an innovative distribution plan which will seed the very communities that need it the most...and we need your help.

We want to send a FREE BOOK to as many front-line caregivers in hospices, palliative care centers, and hospitals as possible.  These institution care for millions of people each year.

We will send out as many books as the contributions allow.  (See the financial breakdown at bottom of the page.)  The money raised will go to the printing, packaging and shipping of the books including a royalty to the authors.  The publisher makes no money from this campaign but is donating services.  The more money we raise, the more hospices, caregivers and terminally ill people will receive the books and comforting information.  We'd like to raise money beyond our goal to expand our efforts.

Please make your contribution now, the clock is ticking. 

Thank you.

Michael Wiese

Publisher, Divine Arts

If you'd like your copy of the book you may order it now

or from Amazon or fine bookstores everywhere.

FOLLOW THE MONEY

As of March 25th, we have raised $3,000 that will allow us to distribute 197 copies of the book to donors and hospice caregivers.  A promising start – but it still a long way still to go to meet our $30,000 goal before April 19th.

If and when we meet our goal, we will be able to distribute 1,970 copies of the book reaching nearly 43% of all care centers in the U.S.

Following the distribution of these books we will have a tried and tested method and will then determine how we may support the hospice community any further.

Here's where the money goes:

$3000  Funds raised to date
    -270   9% Indiegogo fee*
     - 90   3% payment processor fees
   2640  Net

Expenses
    3.50  book printing each
    7.00  pick, pack, ship, postage
      .50   insert letters
      .50   name purchase

     1.89  authors' royalty

        0     campaign launch, promotion, marketing, management

        0     Divine Arts staff/overhead, calls to hospices

$13.39 TOTAL PER BOOK

   This allows 197 books to be sent to donors and hospice caregivers.  If the full campaign goal of $30,000 is raised, we can send 1,970 books to donors and caregivers.

* Indiegogo fee is reduced to 5% if goal is met.


Won't you please make a donation now?

story:
This campaign continues at venusandherlover.com  

 ~ DONATE button on the left side of the Home Page


What is the Story Behind this Book?

or CLICK HERE to see the story.

How Did We Get Here?

What started the War Between the Sexes?  How can we heal it?  These questions pulse through the book I am now ready to publish.

    

Venus and Her Lover – Transforming Myth, Sexuality, and Ourselves  is the first book of a larger Tantric art project (Venus and Her Lover – Transcending the Myth);  this 700-page book is the travel adventure story of two artists driven by destiny to explore the mysteries of the Feminine and the Masculine, and where they meet, in sexuality.  

        

Our quest took us around the world, where we experienced how different cultures have interpreted Man and Woman – through myths, both ancient and modern (Venus and Mars, Adam and Eve, or Isis and Osiris, for example).  The journey challenged our ability to survive as a couple, and to stay true to our spiritual truths.

Wherever our family lived, James painted mythological stories, and I wrote about what I was learning, always following the trail of how our cultural relationship dysfunction began -- why all the shame and guilt? -- and how to attain satisfaction and integrity within our own relationships.

What I discovered on our 15-year odyssey blew my mind.  I want to share with you the hard-won realizations, as well as tips for a fuller life personally, sexually, and spiritually.  This book offers guidance for those ready to look behind the veils, to face the shadow realms, and to embrace the pleasures of liberation.

The most effective change agents in the world are IDEAS.   I believe that if people were truthfully informed about the forces at work in our world -- both seen and unseen, internal and external -- they could choose lives of greater harmony with each other and the Earth. 

I have written a substantial, honest book.   It needs one final edit, and then it is ready to go.  Your contribution would help get this information more widely out into the world!  


What Impact Could this Book Have?

COMMENTS FROM THOSE WHO HAVE READ THE MANUSCRIPT:  

It's a wonderful, wonderful read ~ soulful and inspiring ~ weaving the personal & mythic realms.  I've worked with Becca & James in an editorial/compositional capacity and know that their passion & courage are singular!

            ~ Mary Trainor~Brigham, author of DEEP CINEMA, and Scribe~for~Hire                           Coastal Maine, USA


Once I started reading Venus and Her Lover, I couldn’t put it down.  

I am a professional editor and have started two successful national publications.  This book is so exceptional that I had virtually no edits.  I was just honored to get to read it early!

I honestly think this book will inspire a movement. 

 ~  Susan Davis Moora,  President, Capital Missions Company,  founder of                                KINSinnovation.org, and author of The Trojan Horse of Love                                         Vilcabamba, Loja, Ecuador

                                

Certainly gripping but not in the pulp fiction page-turner way, Venus and Her Lover leads the reader into a very interesting world, enticing him/her along with revealing and sometimes spicy doses of sexuality and spiritual knowledge.  Tantalizing. The combination of travelogue style and delivery of information is quite unique in Becca’s easy-flowing voice; it is womanly writing as well.

 ~ Daniel Pugh, Humanitarian Operations Consultant and Yoga Teacher                              Kathmandu, Nepal


Toward the end of the book, where Becca describes her past life vision, I felt it to the core of my being, and I felt a shift and healing so deep, there are no words yet to describe it, for it goes to the depth of my spirit and limbic brain.

Venus and Her Lover is a life-affirming, transformative project touching humanity’s spirit at a level deep into our DNA.

 ~ Mary L. Renaghan,  Spiritual Life Coach                                                                                 Palo Alto, California, USA 


Becca reveals with great love, skill and clarity the inner archetypal world we carry. Her work points us to a path of choice where finally we can open to the deliciousness of who we truly are and free ourselves.  It is a work dedicated to birthing switched-on people who can give and receive love in truthful connection. Bravo, Becca, for providing this rich pool of reflection to reclaim our lost selves - a delicious and crystal clear sensual vista of soul redemption unfolds.

 ~ Sienna Lea                                                                                                                                      Founder, risemultiversity.org, radio show host, author of Stealing the Moon                 Chicago, Illinois, USA


This is a unique travel book, Becca’s own personal Lonely Planet guide for the masses of yearning souls who know that there is something "else" out there, another way...

 ~  Dana Teton,  CEO, Option 3                                                                                                        Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA


Reading Venus and Her Lover,  it felt as if I travelled with Becca and James on their journey:  behind the camera in the erotic photo shoots, dissolving boundaries, facing vestiges of shame and moving beyond it, tears flowing and heart aching as dear friends turned away from uncomfortable truths, healing lifetime wounds through naked transparency, opening my mind through the life-affirming discussions with the wonderful scientist Nassim Haramein, being there on the Caribbean beach as Becca and James communed with the Goddess/es, the moments of contraction and expansion and self-discovery with Kali and Lilith, the breathing practices and retreats to self-loving, facing the grief of closing certain life chapters, and then bravely moving forward.

A shocking experience I had was Becca’s memories of patriarchal history – shocking in that it brought back my own memory.  It is likely that others reading this work will have similar resonances.  It is very helpful … the style she has chosen of being so transparent with her personal experience.  I’m sure that others will find this story an aid in people's own healing.

~  Premdaya Wajida Mathieu,  Wholistic Wellness Consultant                                               Boise, Idaho, USA

        


Wow, I felt so many parallels with my own life during the course of reading this impressive memoir.  Once the fire of Kali and Pele took hold of me, I had no choice but to surrender to the power of transformation.  It was quite a journey!

In Venus & Her Lover, Becca artistically weaves her personal experience with mythology, science, religion, and history...and ultimately reveals that we have the ability to transcend it all.  So empowering!!!

~  Ginna Grace, Vibrational Healing Artist, Vilcabamba, Loja, Ecuador


Reading Venus and Her Lover was very thought-provoking.  For the last one-and-a-half years I have been on an incredible journey, following my own path learning about the Divine Feminine.  Funny how important books turn up for me, just at the right time.  This was one of them.  I found it riveting and picked up quite a few new ways of looking at the development of human consciousness.

~ Walter Moora, Biodynamic Farmer, Workshop Leader (on reconnecting to the             Earth), author of A Farmer’s Love                                                                                             East Troy, Wisconsin, USA


I left Tuscany, my home, twenty years ago and never looked back, and never wanted to go back until I read the Italian chapters of Becca's book.  Her words brought me back to the beauty of the Tuscan countryside, to the flavours and the scents of my homeland.  I relived through her writing the feeling of being home and the ancient mysteries of that magical place that Tuscany is.  Thank you, Becca, for bringing home back to me.

~ Franco Magrini,    Food Artist                                                                                                      Vilcabamba, Loja, Ecuador

                

Venus and Her Lover  is right up my alley of interest almost in a genetic sense. My mother taught me a great deal about the history of the Patriarchy when I was very young and she wrestled – as have I – with the questions:  Where did it all go off the rails?  What caused the shift?  Where did we go wrong?  Becca presents so much to consider, I was not only totally intrigued but also engaged and entertained.

  ~ Madeleine MacKenzie,   Writer, Artist                                                                                      Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada


I am thankful to Venus and Her Lover  for relentlessly harvesting the mythological wisdom of the world's diverse cultures.  Becca digs so deep and soars so high, breaking through our societal restraints, to lead us on to a more integrated and healing place. Becca and James are tour guides to our deeper souls.

    ~ Robert Althouse,  Filmmaker                                                                                                      Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA



 Who is Becca Tzigany?

       

                   

Poet, writer, mother, partner.  Environmental and community activist, relationship counselor, Transformational Breathwork therapist, ceremonialist, ecstatic dance facilitator, doula (birth coach), meditation teacher, event coordinator, translator and cultural interpreter, yogini, tai chi practitioner.

   Education:  BS in International Studies, BA in Spanish, Reiki Level II, global travel. 

 

What Happens with your Contribution?

Level I :  The Book is Published!  (Funding Goal is Reached)

Editing, formatting, graphic art, printing, fulfillment, conversion into Kindle format, set up distribution, beginning promotion, paying costs of fulfilling the perks of this campaign.  Venus & Her Lover - Transforming Myth, Sexuality, & Ourselves will be able to reach a wide audience.

Level II :  Book Tour, Promotion, & CD  (Stretch Goal)

Virtual book tour via the internet, magazines, TV & radio shows, and other media.  Contract the services of a publicist.

When enough money is raised, a real live book tour might be possible.

If we go $2000 over our Funding Goal, we could produce the CD, "Venus and Her Music", a compilation CD of musical artists  Armand and Angelina, Lovestorm, Stacey Joy, and Jaiia Earthschild.   Their uplifting music and life-affirming lyrics bring a fresh reflection of the experience of love.  This would help Yab/Yum Original Tantric Art fulfill its mission of supporting other artists promoting conscious relationship.   Upon fulfilling Level II, we would then offer a download of this CD as a bonus reward to everyone that contributed $100 or more.

Level III:  Finish The Pillow Book of Venus and Her Lover  (Stretch Goal)

The Pillow Book of Venus and Her Lover – Transcending the Myth  is a coffee-table book (actually a bedside book) featuring the 64 original paintings by JG Bertrand, each accompanied by a poem, artist notes, and mythology notes by Becca Tzigany. 

While James has completed the 64 paintings, Becca still requires at least 6 months to finish the poems and additional writing for this book that reinvents and then transcends the myths for a new age.  When this level is funded, Becca can devote herself to her writing, without having to take on extra jobs needed to pay the rent and groceries.

Any further monies will be put toward the publication of this masterwork of art and poetry.


Your Contribution Earns You Perks!

Please note:  Shipping costs are included in the rewards that are shipped within the United States.  If you live outside the US, you will cover those costs.

This campaign continues at venusandherlover.com   ~ DONATE button on the left side of the Home PageWhat is the Story Behind this Book?or CLICK HERE to see the story.How Did We Get Here?
What
started the War Between the Sexes?  How can we heal it? 
These questions pulse through the book I am now ready to publish.    
Venus and Her Lover – Transforming Myth,
Sexuality, and Ourselves  is the first book of a larger Tantric art project (Venus and Her Lover – Transcending the
Myth);  this 700-page book is the travel adventure story of two artists driven by destiny to
explore the mysteries of the Feminine and the Masculine, and where they meet,
in sexuality.          Our quest took us around the world, where we experienced how
different cultures have interpreted Man and Woman – through myths, both ancient
and modern (Venus and Mars, Adam and Eve, or Isis and Osiris, for example).  The journey challenged our ability to
survive as a couple, and to stay true to our spiritual truths.

Wherever
our family lived, James painted mythological stories, and I wrote about what I was learning, always following the trail
of how our cultural relationship dysfunction began -- why all the shame and guilt? -- and how to attain
satisfaction and integrity within our own relationships.
What
I discovered on our 15-year odyssey blew my mind.  I want to share with you the hard-won realizations, as well
as tips for a fuller life personally, sexually, and spiritually.  This book offers guidance for those
ready to look behind the veils, to face the shadow realms, and to embrace the
pleasures of liberation.
The
most effective change agents in the world are IDEAS.   I
believe that if people were truthfully informed about the forces at work in our
world -- both seen and unseen, internal and external -- they could choose lives of greater harmony with
each other and the Earth. I have written a substantial, honest book.   It needs one final edit, and then it is ready to go.  Your contribution would help get this information more widely out into the world!  What Impact Could this Book Have?
COMMENTS FROM THOSE WHO HAVE READ THE MANUSCRIPT:  
It's a wonderful, wonderful read ~ soulful and
inspiring ~ weaving the personal & mythic realms.  I've worked
with Becca & James in an editorial/compositional capacity and know that
their passion & courage are singular!            ~ Mary Trainor~Brigham, author of DEEP CINEMA, and
Scribe~for~Hire                           Coastal Maine, USA
Once I started reading Venus and Her Lover, I couldn’t put it
down.  
I am a professional editor and have started two successful national publications.  This book is so exceptional that
I had virtually no edits.  I was
just honored to get to read it early!I honestly think this book will inspire a movement.  ~  Susan Davis Moora,  President, Capital Missions Company,  founder of                                KINSinnovation.org, and author of The Trojan Horse of Love                                         Vilcabamba, Loja, Ecuador
                                Certainly gripping but not in the
pulp fiction page-turner way, Venus and
Her Lover leads the reader into a very interesting world, enticing him/her
along with revealing and sometimes spicy doses of sexuality and spiritual
knowledge.  Tantalizing. The
combination of travelogue style and delivery of information is quite unique in
Becca’s easy-flowing voice; it is womanly writing as well. ~ Daniel Pugh, Humanitarian
Operations Consultant and Yoga Teacher                              Kathmandu,
Nepal


Toward the end of the book,
where Becca describes her past life vision, I felt it to the core of my being,
and I felt a shift and healing so deep, there are no words yet to describe it, for it goes to the depth of my spirit and limbic brain.
Venus and Her Lover is a life-affirming, transformative project
touching humanity’s spirit at a level deep into our DNA.
 ~ Mary L. Renaghan,  Spiritual Life Coach                                                                                 Palo Alto, California, USA 



Becca
reveals with great love, skill and clarity the inner archetypal world we carry.
Her work points us to a path of choice where finally we can open to the
deliciousness of who we truly are and free ourselves.  It is a work dedicated to
birthing switched-on people who can give and receive love in truthful connection.
Bravo, Becca, for providing this rich pool of reflection to reclaim our lost
selves - a delicious and crystal clear sensual vista of soul redemption
unfolds. 
 ~ Sienna
Lea                                                                                                                                      Founder, risemultiversity.org, radio show host, author of Stealing the Moon                 Chicago,
Illinois, USA


This is a
unique travel book, Becca’s own personal Lonely Planet guide for the masses of
yearning souls who know that there is something "else" out there,
another way...
 ~  Dana Teton,  CEO, Option 3                                                                                                        Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA


Reading Venus and Her Lover,  it felt as if I travelled with Becca and James on their journey:  behind the camera in the erotic photo shoots, dissolving boundaries, facing vestiges of shame and moving beyond it, tears flowing and heart aching as dear friends turned away from uncomfortable truths, healing lifetime wounds through naked transparency, opening my mind through the life-affirming discussions with the wonderful scientist Nassim Haramein, being there on the Caribbean beach as Becca and James communed with the Goddess/es, the moments of contraction and expansion and self-discovery with Kali and Lilith, the breathing practices and retreats to self-loving, facing the grief of closing certain life chapters, and then bravely moving forward.
A
shocking experience I had was Becca’s memories of patriarchal history –
shocking in that it brought back my own memory.  It is likely that others reading this work will have similar
resonances.  It is very helpful …
the style she has chosen of being so transparent with her personal experience.  I’m sure that others will find this
story an aid in people's own healing.
~  Premdaya Wajida Mathieu,  Wholistic Wellness Consultant                                               Boise, Idaho, USA


        
Wow, I felt so many parallels with my own life during the course of reading this impressive memoir.  Once the fire of Kali and Pele took hold of me, I had no choice but to surrender to the power of transformation.  It was quite a journey!In Venus & Her Lover, Becca artistically weaves her personal experience with mythology, science, religion, and history...and ultimately reveals that we have the ability to transcend it all.  So empowering!!!~  Ginna Grace, Vibrational Healing Artist, Vilcabamba, Loja, Ecuador


Reading Venus and Her Lover was very thought-provoking.  For the last one-and-a-half years I have been on an incredible journey,
following my own path learning about the Divine Feminine.  Funny how important
books turn up for me, just at the right time.  This was one of them.  I found it
riveting and picked up quite a few new
ways of looking at the development of human consciousness.
~ Walter Moora, Biodynamic Farmer,
Workshop Leader (on reconnecting to the             Earth), author of A Farmer’s Love                                                                                             East Troy,
Wisconsin, USA


I left Tuscany, my home, twenty years ago and
never looked back, and never wanted to go back until I read the Italian chapters
of Becca's book.  Her words brought
me back to the beauty of the Tuscan countryside, to the flavours and the scents
of my homeland.  I relived through
her writing the feeling of being home and the ancient mysteries of that magical
place that Tuscany is.  Thank you, Becca, for bringing home back to me.
~ Franco
Magrini,    Food
Artist                                                                                                      Vilcabamba,
Loja, Ecuador
                
Venus and Her Lover  is right up my alley of interest almost in a
genetic sense. My mother taught me a great deal about the history of the Patriarchy
when I was very young and she wrestled – as have I – with the questions:  Where
did it all go off the rails?  What
caused the shift?  Where did we go wrong? 
Becca presents so much to consider, I was not only totally intrigued but
also engaged and entertained.
  ~
Madeleine MacKenzie,   Writer,
Artist                                                                                      Vancouver, British
Columbia, Canada


I am thankful to Venus and Her Lover  for relentlessly harvesting the
mythological wisdom of the world's diverse cultures.  Becca digs so deep and soars so high, breaking through our
societal restraints, to lead us on to a more integrated and healing place.
Becca and James are tour guides to our
deeper souls.
    ~
Robert Althouse,  Filmmaker                                                                                                      Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA
 Who is Becca Tzigany?
                          Poet,
writer, mother, partner. 
Environmental and community activist, relationship counselor,
Transformational Breathwork therapist, ceremonialist, ecstatic dance
facilitator, doula (birth coach), meditation teacher, event coordinator,
translator and cultural interpreter, yogini, tai chi practitioner.

   Education:  BS in International Studies, BA in
Spanish, Reiki Level II, global travel.

The Express Diaries at Innsouth House

THE EXPRESS DIARIES

‘And so, my friends,’ he said, looking back at each one of us in turn, ‘it falls to me to pass this burden to someone other than myself. I dare not ask, yet I hope that you will take it for me. The statue must be recovered and destroyed before these men find it.’

____________

EUROPE, 1925. The continent still licks its wounds from the devastating war that raged across it a few years before. Meanwhile, in London, an ageing professor has uncovered the clues to the whereabouts of pieces of an ancient statue, all but forgotten by history.

When his investigations lead him to fear for his life, he enlists the aid of an unlikely group of allies; a retired colonel, a secretive academic, a magician’s wife, and a Yorkshire matriarch with her reluctant assistant.

Together they will journey across Europe to recover the long-lost statue. They will travel in style, on the most luxurious train the world has ever seen. Unbeknownst to them, however, their activities have already attracted the attention of a sinister cult, desperate to acquire the artefact for their own dark purposes, and now a terrible creature, trapped for centuries, senses that the opportunity for revenge has come at last... 

THE EXPRESS DIARIES is a tale of a journey into darkness and horror on the world's most famous train.

Download the first chapter: LONDON, 1925 (PDF, 1.7 MB)


What We Need & What You Will Receive

We've set a target of $5,500 to cover the initial print run (published in England, RRP £24.95). The Octavo Royal format hardcover book will be as deluxe as we can possibily make it, including: printing on cream bookwove paper, ribbon bookmark, head and tail bands, spine blocking, dustjacket, printed endpapers, 16 full colour pages of illustrations and more in the text.

By supporting this fundraiser/pre-order you will essentially:

  1. Get it first.
  2. Get it cheaper.
  3. Get your name in the book.
  4. Get extras.

 

How This Helps Us

Reaching our target means we won't lose our shirts on printing this deluxe edition of THE EXPRESS DIARIES. It will mark the first major fiction publication from Innsmouth House Press and allows us to continue with other exciting projects we have in the pipeline.

This is brought to you by the same people who produced the successful LOVECRAFTIAN LETTERS project, which was selected as one of the most creative campaigns of the year by Indiegogo.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you know someone who might like this book? Please let them know!

You can use Indiegogo's "Share Tools" to get the word out and help make this endeavour a success.

Thank you

Extra Goals

Now the project is funded we thought we'd add a few incentives to help reach a couple of extra targets.

 

$7,500 - VIOLET'S DIARY & POSTCARD SET - GOAL MET

Every backer gets an eBook copy of the original (and newly revised & updated) VIOLET'S DIARY written by Helen Maclean. The book that started it all. Print backers also get an EXPRESS DIARIES four postcard set along with their book(s).

 

$10,000 - THE AUSPERG AFFAIR - GOAL MET

Every backer also gets an eBook copy of "THE AUSPERG AFFAIR" - recovered from Moretti's memoirs - the thrilling prequel to THE EXPRESS DIARIES.

Professor Moretti: "Austrian-trained giant zombie carnivorous apes..?"
Col. Goodenough: "The latest horror of the Austrian war machine."

 

 About The Author

Nick Marsh has never forgiven his parents for giving him a happy childhood, thus depriving him of the necessary angst and bottled-up rage to become a full-time writer. Not only that, his genetic inheritance has so far thwarted every attempt to grow a beard to make him appear dark and brooding. Four weeks of strenuous effort only result in a near-invisible fluffy covering that even a student would quickly shave off in embarrassment.

Since his late teenage years he is proud that he had managed to maintain his height at a constant five feet ten inches. If only everything in life were that simple. He currently works as a veterinary surgeon in Plymouth, and doesn’t think the job is all that bad really. On his days off he spends his time being cruel to pot plants, drinking cups of tea and, occasionally, writing.

He has been a weird fiction fan his whole life, and can still remember the good old days when going out with mates meant funny-shaped dice and dragon slaying, rather than nightclubs and loud music.

Nick is married (to another vet - it makes for some very boring after dinner conversations) and has three horses, two rescued greyhounds and a psychotic cat that he can't seem to get rid of.

Visit Nick's web site at: www.nick-marsh.co.uk


About The Artist

Eric M. Smith is an illustrator, cartoonist, painter and drawer of fine things. Besides having done many creative pieces for the YSDC web site in the past he also illustrated the cover of Lovecraftian Tales from the Table.

Visit Eric's web site at: ericmsmith.com

EUROPE, 1925. The continent still licks its wounds from the devastating war that raged across it a few years before. Meanwhile, in London, an ageing professor has uncovered the clues to the whereabouts of pieces of an ancient statue, all but forgotten by history.
When his investigations lead him to fear for his life, he enlists the aid of an unlikely group of allies; a retired colonel, a secretive academic, a magician’s wife, and a Yorkshire matriarch with her reluctant assistant.
Together they will journey across Europe to recover the long-lost statue. They will travel in style, on the most luxurious train the world has ever seen. Unbeknownst to them, however, their activities have already attracted the attention of a sinister cult, desperate to acquire the artefact for their own dark purposes, and now a terrible creature, trapped for centuries, senses that the opportunity for revenge has come at last... 
THE EXPRESS DIARIES is a tale of a journey into darkness and horror on the world's most famous train.

Download the first chapter: LONDON, 1925 (PDF, 1.7 MB)


What We Need & What You Will Receive
We've set a target of $5,500 to cover the initial print run (published in England, RRP £24.95). The Octavo Royal format hardcover book will be as deluxe as we can possibily make it, including: printing on cream bookwove paper, ribbon bookmark, head and tail bands, spine blocking, dustjacket, printed endpapers, 16 full colour pages of illustrations and more in the text.
By supporting this fundraiser/pre-order you will essentially:

Get it first.
Get it cheaper.
Get your name in the book.
Get extras.
 
How This Helps Us
Reaching our target means we won't lose our shirts on printing this deluxe edition of THE EXPRESS DIARIES. It will mark the first major fiction publication from Innsmouth House Press and allows us to continue with other exciting projects we have in the pipeline.
This is brought to you by the same people who produced the successful LOVECRAFTIAN LETTERS project, which was selected as one of the most creative campaigns of the year by Indiegogo.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Do you know someone who might like this book? Please let them know!
You can use Indiegogo's "Share Tools" to get the word out and help make this endeavour a success.

Thank you

Extra Goals
Now the project is funded we thought we'd add a few incentives to help reach a couple of extra targets.
 
$7,500 - VIOLET'S DIARY & POSTCARD SET - GOAL MET
Every backer gets an eBook copy of the original (and newly revised & updated) VIOLET'S DIARY written by Helen Maclean. The book that started it all. Print backers also get an EXPRESS DIARIES four postcard set along with their book(s).

 
$10,000 - THE AUSPERG AFFAIR - GOAL MET
Every backer also gets an eBook copy of "THE AUSPERG AFFAIR" - recovered from Moretti's memoirs - the thrilling prequel to THE EXPRESS DIARIES.

Professor Moretti: "Austrian-trained giant zombie carnivorous apes..?" Col. Goodenough: "The latest horror of the Austrian war machine."
 
 About The Author
Nick Marsh has never forgiven his parents for giving him a happy childhood, thus depriving him of the necessary angst and bottled-up rage to become a full-time writer. Not only that, his genetic inheritance has so far thwarted every attempt to grow a beard to make him appear dark and brooding. Four weeks of strenuous effort only result in a near-invisible fluffy covering that even a student would quickly shave off in embarrassment.
Since his late teenage years he is proud that he had managed to maintain his height at a constant five feet ten inches. If only everything in life were that simple. He currently works as a veterinary surgeon in Plymouth, and doesn’t think the job is all that bad really. On his days off he spends his time being cruel to pot plants, drinking cups of tea and, occasionally, writing.
He has been a weird fiction fan his whole life, and can still remember the good old days when going out with mates meant funny-shaped dice and dragon slaying, rather than nightclubs and loud music.
Nick is married (to another vet - it makes for some very boring after dinner conversations) and has three horses, two rescued greyhounds and a psychotic cat that he can't seem to get rid of.
Visit Nick's web site at: www.nick-marsh.co.uk

About The Artist
Eric M. Smith is an illustrator, cartoonist, painter and drawer of fine things. Besides having done many creative pieces for the YSDC web site in the past he also illustrated the cover of Lovecraftian Tales from the Table.
Visit Eric's web site at: ericmsmith.com

story:
[17 June 2014, Note: Our campaign was successful and we've finished this project. The book is now available from publisher Earthcare Books.] 

To fuel its growing economy, India has an immense hunger for energy, mostly from giant open-pit coal mines. To make room for the ever-increasing number of mines, the government evicts people from their homes.

I need your support to make the voices of some of these people heard, through a collection of oral histories of their experiences. I have 18 hours of recordings of interviews with them, but I don't have the money to hire someone to translate and transcribe them so I can publish them. 

The people interviewed are residents of what used to be Lat, a fairly typical agricultural village in the coalfields of Chhattisgarh, about an hour from the town of Raigarh in eastern India. A few years ago, the government decided that the coal under Lat was more important that the residents' way of life. 

There aren't any official numbers on how many people have been displaced like this, but a widely cited figure comes from Dr. Walter Fernandes, who has estimated that about 60 million people were displaced or affected by development-related projects from 1947 to 2004. These are disproportionately people from India's most disadvantaged groups. 

I'm an American journalist, working in Kolkata. While writing a book for a Delhi-based publisher last year about India's energy shortage, I discovered that increasing resistance to such displacement is slowing down government and corporate efforts to build new coal mines, dams, power plants and other energy-related projects. 

I also found, however, that there are almost no sources available in English describing the experiences and views of such displaced people at length. Books by activists and reports by coal companies and government agencies push their agendas, news reporters occasionally decorate their prose with quotes from displaced people, but displaced people themselves almost never get to have their say. 

"Lat Does Not Exist" is meant to fill that gap, making available transcripts of conversations with people in one development-affected village, for researchers and other people who are unable to travel to such a village, live there, and chat with its residents for a couple of weeks -- as I was able to in January 2013 with a small team of journalists and photographers: Nikhil Roshan, Lo Kapila, Chandan Prasad and Devika Singh.   

"Lat Does Not Exist" will include about 50,000 words of lightly edited transcripts of these conversations, and about 150 photographs. I'll write a 1,000-word introduction putting the village's experience in context but, other than that, the book will just be a forum for the people of Lat to tell the world about their experiences and their opinions about what has happened to them.   

Speakers include people who are refusing to leave the fragment of the village that remains, teetering on the edge of the massive pit that is the Chhal open-cast coal mine. They also include members of the Lat diaspora, who have already moved away from the village, to the official resettlement site provided by the coal company, and two unofficial resettlement sites.

From young guys excited that jobs at coal mines will pay for new motorcycles to women who miss farming as it was their chance to get out of the house, from families whose first days at the resettlement site were spent fending off elephants to those who refused to move and sit daily in protest at the mine gate, this is a collection of their stories.

We hope to get a commercial publisher for "Lat Does Not Exist," but even if we don't, we'll publish it through Amazon.com's publish-on-demand service, and distribute it throughout the world. I've done this before with a book of oral histories called "Life on the Edge of the Empire: Oral Histories of Soviet Kyrgyzstan." Either way, if you help me get these interviews translated and transcribed, there will be a book.
